description | Baldur's Gate Feature: City Guard | The effects of a Baldur's Gate feature can be used only while the character is in Baldur's Gate—though, at the DM's discretion, they might have applicable effects in situations similar to those in Baldur's Gate.

text | You may choose to currently serve in either the Flaming Fist or the Watch. If you do, you have responsibilities related to your post. For as long as you perform these responsibilities, you gain benefits. If you stop performing your responsibilities, though, you lose access to the benefits and might suffer further fallout. Should you lose these benefits, you may regain them by having an unpleasant conversation with your commanding officer and fulfilling your responsibilities for a month.

description | Flaming Fist | If you serve in the Flaming Fist, once every ten days, you must report to the Seatower of Balduran for training, and you're required to take a regular shift patrolling either the Lower City or the Outer City. In return, you have access to the Flaming Fist's fortresses and a direct line of communication with Flaming Fist officers and other soldiers. You can also pass through the city's gates without question—although you can't bring guests into the Upper City as a member of the Watch might. Additionally, you're always welcome at the Three Old Kegs, where the Three Old Toads are glad to greet you with a smile and a mug of ale.

description | The Watch | If you serve in the Watch, you're required to conduct a regular patrol in the Upper City or take a regular shift at its gates, and must report for training in the Watch Citadel once every ten days. In return, you have access to the Citadel and a direct line of communication with Watch officers and officials. Your word carries considerable weight in the High Hall, and most establishments in the Citadel Streets neighborhood are happy to give you and your friends free meals. Additionally, you can escort people into the Upper City without question, regardless of whether they are patriars or have Watch tokens. Outside the Upper City, however, most people regard you with suspicion, and you generally get a chilly reception while in uniform.

description | Baldur's Gate Feature: Loyalty Test | The effects of a Baldur's Gate feature can be used only while the character is in Baldur's Gate—though, at the DM's discretion, they might have applicable effects in situations similar to those in Baldur's Gate.

text | You've had enough dealings with crooked soldiers that you can spot the behaviors common to corrupt guards and military officers a mile away. While awareness of such corruption doesn't equate to evidence of it, and your sense certainly isn't foolproof, your instinct proves a useful starting point when determining who might take a bribe, who might turn a blind eye to a crime, or who might have criminal connections. You can also use this sense to get a feeling about who might fulfill their duties strictly by the book.
description | Specialty | During your time as a soldier, you had a specific role to play in your unit or army. Roll a d8 or choose from the options in the table below to determine your role:
text | d8｜Role
text | 1｜Officer
text | 2｜Scout
text | 3｜Infantry
text | 4｜Cavalry
text | 5｜Healer
text | 6｜Quartermaster
text | 7｜Standard-bearer
text | 8｜Support staff (cook, blacksmith, or the like)

description | Suggested Characteristics | The horrors of war combined with the rigid discipline of military service leave their mark on all soldiers, shaping their ideals, creating strong bonds, and often leaving them scarred and vulnerable to fear, shame, and hatred.
text | d8｜Personality Trait
text | 1｜I'm always polite and respectful.
text | 2｜I'm haunted by memories of war. I can't get the images of violence out of my mind.
text | 3｜I've lost too many friends, and I'm slow to make new ones.
text | 4｜I'm full of inspiring and cautionary tales from my military experience relevant to almost every combat situation.
text | 5｜I can stare down a hell hound without flinching.
text | 6｜I enjoy being strong and like breaking things.
text | 7｜I have a crude sense of humor.
text | 8｜I face problems head-on. A simple, direct solution is the best path to success.
text | d6｜Ideal
text | 1｜Greater Good. Our lot is to lay down our lives in defense of others. (Good)
text | 2｜Responsibility. I do what I must and obey just authority. (Lawful)
text | 3｜Independence. When people follow orders blindly, they embrace a kind of tyranny. (Chaotic)
text | 4｜Might. In life as in war, the stronger force wins. (Evil)
text | 5｜Live and Let Live. Ideals aren't worth killing over or going to war for. (Neutral)
text | 6｜Nation. My city, nation, or people are all that matter. (Any)
text | d6｜Bond
text | 1｜I would still lay down my life for the people I served with.
text | 2｜Someone saved my life on the battlefield. To this day, I will never leave a friend behind.
text | 3｜My honor is my life.
text | 4｜I'll never forget the crushing defeat my company suffered or the enemies who dealt it.
text | 5｜Those who fight beside me are those worth dying for.
text | 6｜I fight for those who cannot fight for themselves.
text | d6｜Flaw
text | 1｜The monstrous enemy we faced in battle still leaves me quivering with fear.
text | 2｜I have little respect for anyone who is not a proven warrior.
text | 3｜I made a terrible mistake in battle that cost many lives—and I would do anything to keep that mistake secret.
text | 4｜My hatred of my enemies is blinding and unreasoning.
text | 5｜I obey the law, even if the law causes misery.
text | 6｜I'd rather eat my armor than admit when I'm wrong.

title: Baldur's Gate Urchin
contents: bullet | Skill Proficiencies: Sleight of Hand, Stealth
bullet | Tool Proficiencies: Disguise kit, Thieves' tools
bullet | Equipment: A small knife, a map of the city you grew up in, a pet mouse, a token to remember your parents by, a set of common clothes, and a belt pouch containing 10 gp

description | Feature: City Secrets | You know the secret patterns and flow to cities and can find passages through the urban sprawl that others would miss. When you are not in combat, you (and companions you lead) can travel between any two locations in the city twice as fast as your speed would normally allow.

description | Baldur's Gate Feature: Gateguide Connection | The effects of a Baldur's Gate feature can be used only while the character is in Baldur's Gate—though, at the DM's discretion, they might have applicable effects in situations similar to those in Baldur's Gate.

text | Even though you might not be a member of the Gateguides crew, you've associated with enough of them that you know their torch-based code. From the lighting, placement, and type of torch arranged on or near a structure, you can gather a great deal of information about those who live or do business there, particularly if they deal fairly with strangers, have Guild or government connections, or have either helped or denied the Gateguides in the past.

description | Suggested Characteristics | Urchins are shaped by lives of desperate poverty, for good and for ill. They tend to be driven either by a commitment to the people with whom they shared life on the street or by a burning desire to find a better life—and maybe get some payback on all the rich people who treated them badly.
text | d8｜Personality Trait
text | 1｜I hide scraps of food and trinkets away in my pockets.
text | 2｜I ask a lot of questions.
text | 3｜I like to squeeze into small places where no one else can get to me.
text | 4｜I sleep with my back to a wall or tree, with everything I own wrapped in a bundle in my arms.
text | 5｜I eat like a pig and have bad manners.
text | 6｜I think anyone who's nice to me is hiding evil intent.
text | 7｜I don't like to bathe.
text | 8｜I bluntly say what others are hinting at or hiding.
text | d6｜Ideal
text | 1｜Respect. All people, rich or poor, deserve respect. (Good)
text | 2｜Community. We have to take care of each other, because no one else is going to do it. (Lawful)
text | 3｜Change. The low are lifted up, and the high and mighty are brought down. Change is the nature of things. (Chaotic)
text | 4｜Retribution. The rich need to be shown what life and death are like in the gutters. (Evil)
text | 5｜People. I help the people who help me—that's what keeps us alive. (Neutral)
text | 6｜Aspiration. I'm going to prove that I'm worthy of a better life. (Any)
text | d6｜Bond
text | 1｜My town or city is my home, and I'll fight to defend it.
text | 2｜I sponsor an orphanage to keep others from enduring what I was forced to endure.
text | 3｜I owe my survival to another urchin who taught me to live on the streets.
text | 4｜I owe a debt I can never repay to the person who took pity on me.
text | 5｜I escaped my life of poverty by robbing an important person, and I'm wanted for it.
text | 6｜No one else should have to endure the hardships I've been through.
text | d6｜Flaw
text | 1｜If I'm outnumbered, I will run away from a fight.
text | 2｜Gold seems like a lot of money to me, and I'll do just about anything for more of it.
text | 3｜I will never fully trust anyone other than myself.
text | 4｜I'd rather kill someone in their sleep than fight fair.
text | 5｜It's not stealing if I need it more than someone else.
text | 6｜People who can't take care of themselves get what they deserve.

title: Boros Legionnaire
contents: bullet | Skill Proficiencies: Athletics, Intimidation
bullet | Tool Proficiencies: One type of gaming set
bullet | Languages: Choose one of Celestial, Draconic, Goblin, or Minotaur

bullet | Equipment: A Boros insignia, a feather from an angel's wing, a tattered piece of a Boros banner (a souvenir from a famous battle), a set of common clothes, and a belt pouch containing 2 gp (Boros-minted 1-zino coins)

description | Feature: Legion Station | You have an established place in the hierarchy of the Boros Legion. You can requisition simple equipment for temporary use, and you can gain access to any Boros garrison in Ravnica, where you can rest in safety and receive the attention of medics. You are also paid a salary of 1 gp (a Boros-minted 1-zino coin) per week, which (combined with free lodging in your garrison) enables you to maintain a poor lifestyle between adventures.
description | Boros Guild Spells | Prerequisite: Spellcasting or Pact Magic class feature

text | For you, the spells on the Boros Guild Spells table are added to the spell list of your spellcasting class. (If you are a multiclass character with multiple spell lists, these spells are added to all of them.)
text | Boros Guild Spells
text | Spell Level｜Spells
text | Cantrip｜fire bolt, sacred flame
text | 1st｜guiding bolt, heroism
text | 2nd｜aid, scorching ray
text | 3rd｜beacon of hope, blinding smite
text | 4th｜death ward, wall of fire
text | 5th｜flame strike
text | Your magic often features dramatic bursts of flame or radiance. When you cast beneficial spells on your allies, they appear momentarily surrounded with halos of bright fire.

description | Suggested Characteristics | The Boros Legion is a zealous army, full of righteous energy tempered with military discipline. Its members share its leadership's devotion to the ideals of justice, or they find satisfaction in the more warfare-oriented aspects of the legion's work.
text | Personality Traits
text | d8｜Personality Trait
text | 1｜I approach every task with the same high degree of military precision.
text | 2｜I am always the first into the fray.
text | 3｜I bear any injury or indignity with stoic discipline.
text | 4｜My righteous wrath is easily inflamed by the slightest iniquity.
text | 5｜My honor is more important to me than my life.
text | 6｜Dangerous work is best accomplished by an orderly group working with common purpose.
text | 7｜I treat my weapons, uniform, and insignia with reverence, for they are gifts of the angels.
text | 8｜I pace when standing and fidget incessantly when forced to sit.
text | Ideals
text | d6｜Ideal
text | 1｜Guild. My guild is all that really matters. (Any)
text | 2｜Justice. Achieving justice requires establishing fair, equitable, and compassionate relationships within a community. (Good)
text | 3｜Protection. It isn't right for innocents to suffer because of the arrogance of the powerful. (Good)
text | 4｜Solidarity. It is most crucial to act with a single will, marching side by side in perfect accord. (Lawful)
text | 5｜Order. Society functions only if people do their duty and respect the chain of command. (Lawful)
text | 6｜Conviction. Anything worth doing is worth doing with your whole heart. (Lawful)
text | Bonds
text | d6｜Bond
text | 1｜I would lay down my life for Aurelia and the angels.
text | 2｜I owe my life to the Boros captain who took me in when I was living on the streets.
text | 3｜My fellow legionnaires are my family.
text | 4｜I wield the same Boros weapon my grandparent did, for the honor of our family.
text | 5｜I ran with the Rakdos in my youth, and I'm striving to atone for my past misdeeds.
text | 6｜I do what I can to help out the spouse of a comrade who died in battle.
text | Flaws
text | d6｜Flaw
text | 1｜I act bravely when I'm in a group, but I'm a coward when I'm alone.
text | 2｜I see everything in clear-cut black and white.
text | 3｜I'm just a little fascinated by the ways of the Gruul.
text | 4｜I trust the chain of command more than anything—more even than my closest friends.
text | 5｜I'm slow to trust members of other guilds.
text | 6｜I've been known to turn a blind eye to injustice, with the help of a modest bribe.

description | Contacts | The ordered structure of the Boros Legion offers abundant opportunities to make friends—and rivals—in higher places. You might have close friends in other guilds that share the Boros emphasis on order and community, or bitter enemies among the guilds that represent chaos and destruction.
text | Roll twice on the Boros Contacts table (for an ally and a rival) and once on the Non-Boros Contacts table.
text | Boros Contacts
text | d8｜Contact
text | 1｜A former comrade in arms was promoted into the prestigious Sunhome Guard.
text | 2｜One of my parents is a ranking Boros officer.
text | 3｜A close friend serves aboard the Parhelion II, a flying fortress.
text | 4｜I had a tangled affair with a Boros garrison captain.
text | 5｜I have maintained a relationship with one of my instructors at Horizon Military Academy.
text | 6｜I competed with a fellow student for the attention of a mentor at Horizon Military Academy.
text | 7｜The person who recruited me into the legion changed the course of my life.
text | 8｜A Boros angel knows my name.
text | Non-Boros Contacts
text | d10｜Contact
text | 1｜One of my siblings is an Azorius arrester.
text | 2｜Roll an additional Boros contact; you can decide if the contact is an ally or a rival.
text | 3｜I showed mercy to an injured, now-grateful Dimir spy.
text | 4｜I suspect someone I know is a Golgari assassin, but I can't prove it.
text | 5｜An adolescent relative ran off to join the Gruul in an act of rebellion and has not yet returned.
text | 6｜I once befriended an Izzet scientist, and we're still cordial though the relationship ended messily.
text | 7｜I owe a monetary debt to an Orzhov syndic.
text | 8｜A Rakdos blood witch seems to enjoy harassing me.
text | 9｜I tried to recruit a friend who ended up joining the Selesnya.
text | 10｜I keep running into a particular Simic biomancer, and I enjoy the arguments that inevitably result.

description | How Do I Fit In? | As a member of the Boros Legion, you are subject to the orders of your superior officers. You go where the angels tell you to go, and you do what they command you to do, to the best of your ability. If you enjoy some measure of independence, it's either because you have proven yourself capable of working without close supervision or because you're a rebellious sort who is willing to disobey orders now and face the consequences later.

text | As a soldier on the street, you are tasked with bringing dangerous threats like the Rakdos and the Gruul in line. You might contend with Rakdos performances gone horribly out of control, Gruul raids on outlying neighborhoods, shipments of rot-infested vegetation from the Golgari undercity, and violent uprisings among the guildless. At the same time, you might have to worry about Dimir spies infiltrating your leadership, overzealous or corrupt Azorius senators abusing the law at the expense of justice, Izzet experiments leveling city blocks, and Simic creations that break out of laboratories and wreak havoc through the Tenth District.
section | Tajic, Blade of the Legion

text | Tajic is a firefist who carries the exalted title of Blade of the Legion, putting him just below the angels in rank. He maintains close communication with Aurelia, though recent events in the city have set them at odds. Tajic believes that the Boros can trust only the Boros. He is convinced that any effort at peace among the guilds is doomed to failure without the Guildpact. The Boros, he argues, would be better off spending their energy to make themselves stronger so they can uphold the fragile balance that exists now—and protect the innocent when the balance tilts. Aurelia feels that his negative attitude runs the risk of poisoning the hearts of the other Boros and undermining any peace efforts. For the most part, in deference to the angel, Tajic keeps his views to himself.

title: Carouser
contents: bullet | Ability Scores: Dexterity, Intelligence, Charisma

title: Celebrity Adventurer's Scion
contents: bullet | Skill Proficiencies: Perception, Performance
bullet | Tool Proficiencies: Disguise kit
bullet | Languages: Two of your choice
bullet | Equipment: Disguise kit, a set of fine clothes, and a belt pouch containing 30 gp.

description | Feature: Name Dropping | You know and have met any number of powerful people across the land—and some of them might even remember you. You might be able to wrangle minor assistance from a major figure in the campaign, at the DM's discretion. Additionally, the common folk treat you with deference, and your heritage and the stories you tell might be good for a free meal or a place to sleep.

description | Suggested Characteristics | Scions of celebrity adventurers must deal with fame that's not theirs, wealth they didn't earn, and expectations they can never hope to meet. These hardships can have adverse effects, but those who cope with them can arrive at a decent attitude and a grounded worldview. Those who fail become bitter—or worse.
text | d8｜Personality Trait
text | 1｜I will never get out of my famous parent's shadow, and no one else will ever understand this burden.
text | 2｜I've seen enough of the adventuring life to have realistic expectations and empathy for my peers.
text | 3｜Living up to my legacy will be difficult, but I'm going to do it.
text | 4｜I'm used to the very best in life, and that's a hard habit to break.
text | 5｜My parent taught me a sense of duty. I strive to uphold it, even when the odds are against me.
text | 6｜No one can fake a smile, a handshake, or an interested nod like I can.
text | 7｜I've been part of the adventuring life since I was old enough to walk. Let me explain a few things to you.
text | 8｜No risk is too great for the rewards of defeating my enemies... and taking their stuff.
text | d6｜Ideal
text | 1｜Power. The only way to get ahead in this world is to attain power and hold onto it with all your might. (Evil)
text | 2｜Peace. Those who can find or make peace in the chaotic world around them have everything. (Lawful)
text | 3｜Fame. I've seen what fame can bring. And I'll do anything to get all that for myself. (Neutral)
text | 4｜Training. Hard work, sacrifice, and training lead to success—and eventually to perfection. (Any)
text | 5｜Anonymity. I want to be successful. And alone. With lots of guards and wards between me and everyone else in the world. (Any)
text | 6｜Wisdom. Material wealth is an illusion. Wisdom is the real treasure. (Good)
text | d6｜Bond
text | 1｜While my parent was out adventuring, a servant raised me, and I care about that person more than anyone.
text | 2｜I consider every member of my parent's former adventuring party to be family.
text | 3｜Despite their absences, my famous parent was kind and generous. I love them and want to make them proud.
text | 4｜My parent once brought a cursed magic item home. It is my obsession.
text | 5｜My childhood home holds all my best memories, and its upkeep is my primary concern.
text | 6｜Growing up, I had an imaginary friend I could always count on. That friend is still with me.
text | d6｜Flaw
text | 1｜You don't know what I'm going through. You never can.
text | 2｜You. Fetch my cloak. And maybe rub my feet for a while.
text | 3｜My comrades are brave, but I must defeat this threat alone to prove my worth.
text | 4｜Oh, yeah, that spell? Named after my parent's best friend. Let me tell you about them.
text | 5｜My best days are behind me. Ahead lies only toil, pain, and death.
text | 6｜You have to look out for yourself. No one else will.

title: City Watch
contents: bullet | Skill Proficiencies: Athletics, Insight
bullet | Languages: Any two of your choice
bullet | Equipment: A uniform in the style of your unit and indicative of your rank, a horn with which to summon help, a set of manacles, and a pouch containing 10 gp

description | Feature: Watcher's Eye | Your experience in enforcing the law, and dealing with lawbreakers, gives you a feel for local laws and criminals. You can easily find the local outpost of the watch or a similar organization, and just as easily pick out the dens of criminal activity in a community, although you're more likely to be welcome in the former locations rather than the latter.

description | Suggested Characteristics | Use the tables for the soldier background in the Player's Handbook as the basis for your traits and motivations, modifying the entries when appropriate to suit your identity as a member of the city watch.

text | Your bond is likely associated with your fellow watch members or the watch organization itself and almost certainly concerns your community. Your ideal probably involves the fostering of peace and safety. An investigator is likely to have an ideal connected to achieving justice by successfully solving crimes.

title: Clan Crafter
contents: bullet | Skill Proficiencies: History, Insight
bullet | Tool Proficiencies: One type of artisan's tools
bullet | Languages: Dwarvish or one of your choice if you already speak Dwarvish

bullet | Equipment: A set of artisan's tools with which you are proficient, a maker's mark chisel used to mark your handiwork with the symbol of the clan of crafters you learned your skill from, a set of traveler's clothes, and a pouch containing 5 gp and a gem worth 10 gp

description | Feature: Respect of the Stout Folk | As well respected as clan crafters are among outsiders, no one esteems them quite so highly as dwarves do. You always have free room and board in any place where shield dwarves or gold dwarves dwell, and the individuals in such a settlement might vie among themselves to determine who can offer you (and possibly your companions) the finest accommodations and assistance.

description | Suggested Characteristics | Use the tables for the guild artisan background in the Player's Handbook as the basis for your traits and motivations, modifying the entries when appropriate to suit your identity as a clan crafter. (For instance, consider the words "guild" and "clan" to be interchangeable.)

text | Your bond is almost certainly related to the master or the clan that taught you, or else to the work that you produce. Your ideal might have to do with maintaining the high quality of your work or preserving the dwarven traditions of craftsmanship.

title: Cloistered Scholar
contents: bullet | Skill Proficiencies: History, plus your choice of one from among Arcana, Nature, and Religion
bullet | Languages: any two of your choice

bullet | Equipment: The scholar's robes of your cloister, a writing kit (small pouch with a quill, ink, folded parchment, and a small penknife), a borrowed book on the subject of your current study, and a pouch containing 10 gp

description | Feature: Library Access | Though others must often endure extensive interviews and significant fees to gain access to even the most common archives in your library, you have free and easy access to the majority of the library, though it might also have repositories of lore that are too valuable, magical, or secret to permit anyone immediate access.
text | You have a working knowledge of your cloister's personnel and bureaucracy, and you know how to navigate those connections with some ease.
text | Additionally, you are likely to gain preferential treatment at other libraries across the Realms, as professional courtesy to a fellow scholar.

description | Suggested Characteristics | Use the tables for the sage background in the Player's Handbook as the basis for your traits and motivations, modifying the entries when appropriate to suit your identity as a cloistered scholar.

text | Your bond is almost certainly associated either with the place where you grew up or with the knowledge you hope to acquire through adventuring. Your ideal is no doubt related to how you view the quest for knowledge and truth - perhaps as a worthy goal in itself, or maybe as a means to a desirable end.

title: Cobalt Scholar (Sage)
contents: bullet | Skill Proficiencies: Arcana, History
bullet | Languages: Two of your choice

bullet | Equipment: A bottle of black ink, a quill, a small knife, a letter from a dead colleague posing a question you have not yet been able to answer, a set of common clothes, and a belt pouch containing 10 gp

description | Feature: Researcher | When you attempt to learn or recall a piece of lore, if you do not know that information, you often know where and from whom you can obtain it. Usually, this information comes from a library, scriptorium, university, or a sage or other learned person or creature. Your DM might rule that the knowledge you seek is secreted away in an almost inaccessible place, or that it simply cannot be found. Unearthing the deepest secrets of the multiverse can require an adventure or even a whole campaign.
description | Specialty | To determine the nature of your scholarly training, roll a d8 or choose from the options in the table below.
text | d8｜Field of Study
text | 1｜Alchemist
text | 2｜Astronomer
text | 3｜Discredited academic
text | 4｜Librarian
text | 5｜Professor
text | 6｜Researcher
text | 7｜Wizard's apprentice
text | 8｜Scribe

description | Suggested Characteristics | Sages are defined by their extensive studies, and their characteristics reflect this life of study. Devoted to scholarly pursuits, a sage values knowledge highly—sometimes in its own right, sometimes as a means toward other ideals.
text | d8｜Personality Trait
text | 1｜I use polysyllabic words that convey the impression of great erudition.
text | 2｜I've read every book in the world's greatest libraries—or I like to boast that I have.
text | 3｜I'm used to helping out those who aren't as smart as I am, and I patiently explain anything and everything to others.
text | 4｜There's nothing I like more than a good mystery.
text | 5｜I'm willing to listen to every side of an argument before I make my own judgment.
text | 6｜I... speak... slowly... when talking... to idiots,... which... almost... everyone... is... compared... to me.
text | 7｜I am horribly, horribly awkward in social situations.
text | 8｜I'm convinced that people are always trying to steal my secrets.
text | d6｜Ideal
text | 1｜Knowledge. The path to power and self-improvement is through knowledge. (Neutral)
text | 2｜Beauty. What is beautiful points us beyond itself toward what is true. (Good)
text | 3｜Logic. Emotions must not cloud our logical thinking. (Lawful)
text | 4｜No Limits. Nothing should fetter the infinite possibility inherent in all existence. (Chaotic)
text | 5｜Power. Knowledge is the path to power and domination. (Evil)
text | 6｜Self-Improvement. The goal of a life of study is the betterment of oneself. (Any)
text | d6｜Bond
text | 1｜It is my duty to protect my students.
text | 2｜I have an ancient text that holds terrible secrets that must not fall into the wrong hands.
text | 3｜I work to preserve a library, university, scriptorium, or monastery.
text | 4｜My life's work is a series of tomes related to a specific field of lore.
text | 5｜I've been searching my whole life for the answer to a certain question.
text | 6｜I sold my soul for knowledge. I hope to do great deeds and win it back.
text | d6｜Flaw
text | 1｜I am easily distracted by the promise of information.
text | 2｜Most people scream and run when they see a demon. I stop and take notes on its anatomy.
text | 3｜Unlocking an ancient mystery is worth the price of a civilization.
text | 4｜I overlook obvious solutions in favor of complicated ones.
text | 5｜I speak without really thinking through my words, invariably insulting others.
text | 6｜I can't keep a secret to save my life, or anyone else's.

title: Courtier
contents: bullet | Skill Proficiencies: Insight, Persuasion
bullet | Languages: Any two of your choice
bullet | Equipment: A set of fine clothes and a pouch containing 5 gp

description | Feature: Court Functionary | Your knowledge of how bureaucracies function lets you gain access to the records and inner workings of any noble court or government you encounter. You know who the movers and shakers are, whom to go to for the favors you seek, and what the current intrigues of interest in the group are.

description | Suggested Characteristics | Use the tables for the guild artisan background in the Player's Handbook as the basis for your traits and motivations, modifying the entries when appropriate to suit your identity as a courtier.

text | The noble court or bureaucratic organization where you got your start is directly or indirectly associated with your bond (which could pertain to certain individuals in the group, such as your sponsor or mentor). Your ideal might be concerned with the prevailing philosophy of your court or organization.

title: Dimir Operative
contents: bullet | Skill Proficiencies: Deception, Stealth
bullet | Tool Proficiencies: Disguise kit
bullet | Languages: One of your choice
bullet | Equipment: A Dimir insignia, three small knives, a set of dark-colored common clothes, and the starting equipment of the background described in this chapter for your secondary guild

description | Feature: False Identity | You have more than one identity. The one you wear most of the time makes you appear to be a member of a guild other than House Dimir. You have documentation, established acquaintances, and disguises that allow you to assume that persona and fit into the secondary guild.
text | Whenever you choose, you can drop this identity and blend into the guildless masses of the city.
text | Consider why you're embedded in the secondary guild. Create a story with your DM, inspired by rolling on the following table or choosing a reason that suits you.
text | d8｜Reason for Infiltration
text | 1｜My parents belong to this guild, and I let them think I'm following in their footsteps.
text | 2｜I've been assigned to track this guild's activities.
text | 3｜I've been assigned to get close to an individual in this guild and learn their secrets.
text | 4｜I've been assigned to recruit a new Dimir spy from the ranks of this guild.
text | 5｜I was a member of this guild before the Dimir recruited me.
text | 6｜I don't like what this guild stands for and want to destroy it from within.
text | 7｜I secretly wish I could leave the Dimir and join this guild, but there is no escaping the Dimir.
text | 8｜I chose this guild at random or on a lark.
description | Dimir Guild Spells | Prerequisite: Spellcasting or Pact Magic class feature

text | For you, the spells on the Dimir Guild Spells table are added to the spell list of your spellcasting class. (If you are a multiclass character with multiple spell lists, these spells are added to all of them.)
text | Dimir Guild Spells
text | Spell Level｜Spells
text | Cantrip｜encode thoughts, mage hand
text | 1st｜disguise self, sleep
text | 2nd｜detect thoughts, pass without trace
text | 3rd｜gaseous form, meld into stone, nondetection
text | 4th｜arcane eye, freedom of movement
text | 5th｜modify memory

text | Your magic is meant to be subtle and undetectable, but it might pull shadows or clouds of mist around you as you cast your spells. Using the encode thoughts cantrip described below, you can turn a creature's thoughts (including your own) into a thought strand that others can potentially read, share, or steal. These thought strands are treated as valuable currency among the Dimir.

description | Suggested Characteristics | Skilled at infiltration, disguise, and deception, members of House Dimir appear inscrutable. Your true personality and ideals might never manifest, or they might mark you as a quirky member of your secondary guild.
text | Personality Traits
text | d8｜Personality Trait
text | 1｜I'm good at hiding my true thoughts and feelings.
text | 2｜When I'm in doubt about revealing something, I assume it's a secret, and I don't share it.
text | 3｜I like to sound mysterious, because wisdom hidden grows deeper with time.
text | 4｜I have no patience with people who get in my way.
text | 5｜I love hearing about other people's nightmares.
text | 6｜Combat is meant to be quick, clean, and one-sided.
text | 7｜I like to stick to the shadows.
text | 8｜I never show my anger. I just plot my revenge.
text | Ideals
text | d6｜Ideal
text | 1｜Guild. My true guild is all that really matters. (Any)
text | 2｜Control. I like pulling the strings. (Lawful)
text | 3｜Secrets. I collect secrets and never reveal them. (Any)
text | 4｜Knowledge. I want to know as much as I can about this city and how it works. (Any)
text | 5｜Independence. I value the freedom to pursue my own goals without interference. (Chaotic)
text | 6｜Nihilism. I don't believe in anything, and anyone who does is a fool. (Neutral)
text | Bonds
text | d6｜Bond
text | 1｜I discovered a secret I can't let anyone else uncover—including my guild superiors.
text | 2｜I formed a close friendship or romance with someone in the guild I'm infiltrating.
text | 3｜The Dimir agent who recruited me was unmasked and killed. My revenge on the killers will be thorough and painful.
text | 4｜I spend as much time as I can in the Ismeri Library because I'm certain an information hub operates behind its facade. I want its secrets!
text | 5｜I'm utterly loyal to my superior in the guild, more than to the guild or its guildmaster.
text | 6｜Someone has discovered my true identity.
text | Flaws
text | d6｜Flaw
text | 1｜I like secrets so much that I'm reluctant to share details of a plan even with those who need to know.
text | 2｜I would let my friends die rather than reveal my true identity.
text | 3｜I have trouble trusting anyone but myself.
text | 4｜I have a particular vice that puts all my secrets at risk if I'm not careful.
text | 5｜I'm pretty sure I've done something horrible that I can't remember because of the guild's mind magic.
text | 6｜I put too much trust in the people who give me orders.

description | Contacts | As an agent of House Dimir working undercover, you have limited contacts within your guild. Your relationships within your secondary guild, in the guise of your false identity, are usually more extensive.

text | Roll once on the Dimir Contacts table, giving you an ally who serves as your contact in Dimir. Then roll twice on the table for your secondary guild. The first roll gives you an ally there, and the second roll gives you a rival.
text | Dimir Contacts
text | d8｜Contact
text | 1｜I know a Dimir courier who relays messages to me from someone higher up the chain of command.
text | 2｜I get orders from a shapeshifter I recognize only through a series of code phrases we exchange.
text | 3｜An ostentatiously wealthy vampire is my secret guild superior, summoning me to a luxurious estate by means of coded messages.
text | 4｜I have never met my guild contact, but I receive telepathic messages, usually in my dreams.
text | 5｜I've never met my guild contact, but I get coded messages from a pattern of street lights and graffiti.
text | 6｜I didn't discover the identity of my guild contact until after we had begun a romantic relationship.
text | 7｜My superior maintains an elaborate identity as a young street urchin... unless it's all a lie, and I'm being sent on ridiculous missions by a twisted child.
text | 8｜My sibling and I both get telepathic orders from a mysterious contact, and I'm starting to question the authenticity of my sibling's orders.

description | How Do I Fit In? | As a Dimir adventurer, you are a member of the guild's network of spies, thieves, assassins, and mind mages that lurks behind the facade of the public guild. On the surface, House Dimir presents the appearance of a network of couriers, investigators, media reporters, and archivists, dealing in information and spreading news. But you and your peers trade in secrets. You use secret symbols, runes, and signals to surreptitiously communicate with other Dimir agents, often in plain sight.

text | Like any good spy, you have multiple identities: your true face as an agent of House Dimir; a guildless identity; and a role as a member of another guild. Within that secondary guild, you might already be on a mission for House Dimir, assigned to spy on the guild, collect information about a person, or recruit another spy from the ranks of the guild. Or that guild could be a launching point for your real mission. Perhaps, for example, you were ordered to infiltrate the Azorius in hopes of gaining access to a notorious inmate in an Azorius prison.

title: Faceless
contents: bullet | Skill Proficiencies: Deception, Intimidation
bullet | Tool Proficiencies: Disguise kit
bullet | Languages: One of your choice
bullet | Equipment: Disguise kit, a costume, a pouch containing 10 gp

description | Faceless Persona | A faceless character adventures behind the mask of a public persona. This persona is as natural to them as their hidden, true face, but it disguises their identity. Roll on the Faceless Persona table to determine your persona, or work with the DM to create a persona that's unique to your character and suits the tone of your game.
text | d10｜Faceless Persona
text | 1｜A flamboyant spy or brigand
text | 2｜The incarnation of a nation or people
text | 3｜A scoundrel with a masked guise
text | 4｜A vengeful spirit
text | 5｜The manifestation of a deity or your faith
text | 6｜One whose beauty is greatly accented using makeup
text | 7｜An impersonation of another hero
text | 8｜The embodiment of a school of magic
text | 9｜A warrior with distinctive armor
text | 10｜A disguise with animalistic or monstrous characteristics, meant to inspire fear

description | Feature: Dual Personalities | Most of your fellow adventurers and the world know you as your persona. Those who seek to learn more about you—your weaknesses, your origins, your purpose—find themselves stymied by your disguise. Upon donning a disguise and behaving as your persona, you are unidentifiable as your true self. By removing your disguise and revealing your true face, you are no longer identifiable as your persona. This allows you to change appearances between your two personalities as often as you wish, using one to hide the other or serve as convenient camouflage. However, should someone realize the connection between your persona and your true self, your deception might lose its effectiveness.

description | Suggested Characteristics | A faceless character usually plays their persona—the hero or extraordinary person they are every day. That's all a facade, though, or a part of them expressed to an extreme. To define a persona, feel free to choose characteristics from other backgrounds, particularly folk hero, hermit, or noble. For the person behind the persona, the one who truly strives to be faceless, consider a distinct set of faceless characteristics. As a result, those with this background have two sets of characteristics, one for their persona, and one for their faceless selves.
text | d8｜Personality Trait
text | 1｜I'm earnest and uncommonly direct.
text | 2｜I strive to have no personality—it's easier to forget what's hardly there.
text | 3｜I treasure a memento of the person or instance that set me upon my path.
text | 4｜I sleep just as much as I need to and on an unusual schedule.
text | 5｜I think far ahead, a detachedness often mistaken for daydreaming.
text | 6｜I cultivate a single obscure hobby or study and eagerly discuss it at length.
text | 7｜I am ever learning how to be among others—when to stay quiet, when to laugh.
text | 8｜I behave like an extreme opposite of my persona.
text | d6｜Ideal
text | 1｜Justice. Place in society shouldn't determine one's access to what is right. (Good)
text | 2｜Security. Doing what must be done can't bring the innocent to harm. (Lawful)
text | 3｜Confusion. Deception is a weapon. Strike from where your foes won't expect. (Chaotic)
text | 4｜Infamy. My name will be a malediction, a curse that fulfills my will. (Evil)
text | 5｜Incorruptibility. Be a symbol, and leave your flawed being behind. (Any)
text | 6｜Anonymity. It's my deeds that should be remembered, not their instrument. (Any)
text | d6｜Bond
text | 1｜I do everything for my family. My first thought is keeping them safe.
text | 2｜What I do, I do for the world. The people don't realize how much they need me.
text | 3｜I've seen too many in need. I must not fail them as everyone else has.
text | 4｜I stand in opposition, lest the wicked go unopposed.
text | 5｜I am exceptional. I do this because no one else can, and no one can stop me.
text | 6｜I do everything for those who were taken from me.
text | d6｜Flaw
text | 1｜I am callous about death. It comes to us all eventually.
text | 2｜I never make eye contact or hold it unflinchingly.
text | 3｜I have no sense of humor. Laughing is uncomfortable and embarrassing.
text | 4｜I overexert myself, sometimes needing to recuperate for a day or more.
text | 5｜I think far ahead, a detachedness often mistaken for daydreaming.
text | 6｜I see morality entirely in black and white.

title: Faction Agent
contents: bullet | Skill Proficiencies: Insight and one Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma skill of your choice, as appropriate to your faction
bullet | Languages: Any two of your choice
bullet | Equipment: Badge or emblem of your faction, a copy of a seminal faction text (or code-book for a covert faction), a set of common clothes, and a pouch containing 15 gp

description | Feature: Safe Haven | As a faction agent, you have access to a secret network of supporters and operatives who can provide assistance on your adventures. You know a set of secret signs and passwords you can use to identify such operatives, who can provide you with access to a hidden safe house, free room and board, or assistance in finding information. These agents never risk their lives for you or risk revealing their true identities.

description | Suggested Characteristics | Use the tables for the acolyte background in the Player's Handbook as the basis for your traits and motivations, modifying the entries when appropriate to suit your identity as a faction agent. (For instance, consider the words "faith" and "faction" to be interchangeable.)

text | Your bond might be associated with other members of your faction, or a location or an object that is important to your faction. The ideal you strive for is probably in keeping with the tenets and principles of your faction, but might be more personal in nature.

title: Failed Merchant
contents: bullet | Skill Proficiencies: Investigation, Persuasion
bullet | Tool Proficiencies: One type of artisan's tools
bullet | Languages: Any one of your choice
bullet | Equipment: One set of artisan's tools, merchant's scale, a set of fine clothes, and a belt pouch containing 10 gp

description | Feature: Supply Chain | From your time as a merchant, you retain connections with wholesalers, suppliers, and other merchants and entrepreneurs. You can call upon these connections when looking for items or information.

description | Suggested Characteristics | Being a merchant involved having a head for numbers, a strong personality, the ability to make deals with hostile adversaries, a strong sword arm to fight off bandits, and the intuition for knowing what people want and need. The art of business is the art of finding the best path to profit, and that path might be different with each transaction. It takes a strong mind and a stronger stomach to succeed. So why did you fail?
text | d8｜Personality Trait
text | 1｜I didn't have the cutthroat attitude necessary to succeed. I won't make that mistake again.
text | 2｜Even my competitors said I was affable and talented. Those traits should serve me well.
text | 3｜To prosper, you have to be in control.
text | 4｜The customer is always right.
text | 5｜I was cutting corners and breaking deals to maximize profit. That's why I failed.
text | 6｜When I get an idea, I am single-minded in its execution—even if it's a terrible idea.
text | 7｜If I can be everyone's friend, I'll always have support.
text | 8｜My heart wasn't in being a merchant, so I failed. I'm not all that keen on adventuring either, but I need the money.
text | d6｜Ideal
text | 1｜Survival. Where there's life, there's hope. If I remain alive and flexible, I can succeed. (Any)
text | 2｜Generosity. People helped me when I was down. Now that I'm back on my feet, I'll pay it forward. (Good)
text | 3｜Excitement. Caution got me nowhere in my previous business. I'm not going to let it hold me back now. (Chaotic)
text | 4｜Wealth. With enough coin, I can buy comfort, power, knowledge, and even eternal life. Nothing will stand between me and money. (Evil)
text | 5｜Stability. The mercantile trade was too chaotic for me. I need a nice stable profession, like adventuring. (Lawful)
text | 6｜Redemption. Too many people consider me a failure. So I need to prove them wrong. (Any)
text | d6｜Bond
text | 1｜My family means everything to me. I failed them before, and I must not do so again.
text | 2｜My church provides a connection to my god, so I must ensure that it is protected and funded.
text | 3｜My former business partner fell ill, and then our business failed. Part of my new venture involves earning enough to take care of their family.
text | 4｜If I take care of my possessions, they'll take care of me. People come and go, but a weapon or a wand is something you can always rely on.
text | 5｜Although my business failed, the people of my community were kind to me. I'll do everything in my power to protect them.
text | 6｜I owe a dangerous person a lot of money. As long as they're happy, they let my debt rest unpaid.
text | d6｜Flaw
text | 1｜Why spend gold here when you can buy the same thing for copper in the next town?
text | 2｜I must have the best of everything. Like, right now.
text | 3｜You haven't heard of me? I'm sure that's because of your ignorance and low breeding.
text | 4｜I failed, but I'm awesome. So when anyone else is successful, it must be because of nepotism, dishonesty, or dumb luck.
text | 5｜I find that most people are trustworthy. Hey, where's my belt pouch?
text | 6｜Nothing gets between me and danger except my fellow adventurers. So I'll be sure to put them there.

title: Far Traveler
contents: bullet | Skill Proficiencies: Insight, Perception
bullet | Tool Proficiencies: Any one musical instrument or gaming set of your choice, likely something native to your homeland
bullet | Languages: Any one of your choice

bullet | Equipment: One set of traveler's clothes, any one musical instrument or gaming set you are proficient with, poorly wrought maps from your homeland that depict where you are in Faerûn, a small piece of jewelry worth 10 gp in the style of your homeland's craftsmanship, and a pouch containing 5 gp

description | Feature: All Eyes on You | Your accent, mannerisms, figures of speech, and perhaps even your appearance all mark you as foreign. Curious glances are directed your way wherever you go, which can be a nuisance, but you also gain the friendly interest of scholars and others intrigued by far-off lands, to say nothing of everyday folk who are eager to hear stories of your homeland.

text | You can parley this attention into access to people and places you might not otherwise have, for you and your traveling companions. Noble lords, scholars, and merchant princes, to name a few, might be interested in hearing about your distant homeland and people.

description | Why Are You Here? | A far traveler might have set out on a journey for one of a number of reasons, and the departure from his or her homeland could have been voluntary or involuntary. To determine why you are so far from home, roll on the table below or choose from the options provided. The following section, discussing possible homelands, includes some suggested reasons that are appropriate for each location.
text | d6｜Reason
text | 1｜Emissary
text | 2｜Exile
text | 3｜Fugitive
text | 4｜Pilgrim
text | 5｜Sightseer
text | 6｜Wanderer
description | Suggested Characteristics |
text | d6｜Personality Trait
text | 1｜I have different assumptions from those around me concerning personal space, blithely invading others' space in innocence, or reacting to ignorant invasion of my own.
text | 2｜I have my own ideas about what is and is not food, and I find the eating habits of those around me fascinating, confusing, or revolting.
text | 3｜I have a strong code of honor or sense of propriety that others don't comprehend.
text | 4｜I express affection or contempt in ways that are unfamiliar to others.
text | 5｜I honor my deities through practices that are foreign to this land.
text | 6｜I begin or end my day with small traditional rituals that are unfamiliar to those around me.
text | d6｜Ideal
text | 1｜Open. I have much to learn from the kindly folk I meet along my way. (Good)
text | 2｜Reserved. As someone new to these strange lands, I am cautious and respectful in my dealings. (Lawful)
text | 3｜Adventure. I'm far from home, and everything is strange and wonderful! (Chaotic)
text | 4｜Cunning. Though I may not know their ways, neither do they know mine, which can be to my advantage. (Evil)
text | 5｜Inquisitive. Everything is new, but I have a thirst to learn. (Neutral)
text | 6｜Suspicious. I must be careful, for I have no way of telling friend from foe here. (Any)
text | d6｜Bond
text | 1｜So long as I have this token from my homeland, I can face any adversity in this strange land.
text | 2｜The gods of my people are a comfort to me so far away from home.
text | 3｜I hold no greater cause than my service to my people.
text | 4｜My freedom is my most precious possession. I'll never let anyone take it from me again.
text | 5｜I'm fascinated by the beauty and wonder of this new land.
text | 6｜Though I had no choice, I lament having to leave my loved one(s) behind. I hope to see them again one day.
text | d6｜Flaw
text | 1｜I am secretly (or not so secretly) convinced of the superiority of my own culture over that of this foreign land.
text | 2｜I pretend not to understand the local language in order to avoid interactions I would rather not have.
text | 3｜I have a weakness for the new intoxicants and other pleasures of this land.
text | 4｜I don't take kindly to some of the actions and motivations of the people of this land, because these folks are different from me.
text | 5｜I consider the adherents of other gods to be deluded innocents at best, or ignorant fools at worst.
text | 6｜I have a weakness for the exotic beauty of the people of these lands.

title: Feylost
contents: bullet | Skill Proficiencies: Deception, Survival
bullet | Tool Proficiencies: One type of musical instrument
bullet | Languages: One of your choice of Elvish, Gnomish, Goblin, or Sylvan
bullet | Equipment: A musical instrument (one of your choice), a set of traveler's clothes, three trinkets (each determined by rolling on the Feywild Trinkets table), and a pouch containing 8 gp

description | Feature: Feywild Connection | Your mannerisms and knowledge of fey customs are recognized by natives of the Feywild, who see you as one of their own. Because of this, friendly Fey creatures are inclined to come to your aid if you are lost or need help in the Feywild.
description | Fey Mark | You were transformed in some small way by your stay in the Feywild and gained a fey mark, determined by rolling on the Fey Mark table.
text | Fey Mark
text | d8｜Fey Mark
text | 1｜Your eyes swirl with iridescent colors.
text | 2｜You have a sweet scent, like that of nectar or honey.
text | 3｜You have long whiskers like those of a cat.
text | 4｜Your ears are covered with soft tufts of fur.
text | 5｜Your skin sparkles in moonlight.
text | 6｜Flowers either bloom or wilt (your choice) in your presence.
text | 7｜Your hair is made of vines or brambles and grows back to normal length within 1 hour of being cut.
text | 8｜You have a tail like that of a dog or another animal.

description | Feywild Visitor | Whenever you're sound asleep or in a deep trance during a long rest, a spirit of the Feywild might pay you a visit, if the DM wishes it. Determine the spirit's form by rolling on the Feywild Visitor table. No harm ever comes to you as a result of such visits, which can last for minutes or hours, and you remember each visit when you wake up. Conversations that occur with a visitor can contain any number of things, from messages and insights to nonsense and red herrings, at the DM's discretion. Such conversations are always conducted in a language you can understand, even if the Feywild visitor can't speak that language normally.
text | Feywild Visitor
text | d8｜Visitor
text | 1｜Awakened creature (a Beast or an ordinary plant that has had the awaken spell cast on it)
text | 2｜Centaur
text | 3｜Dryad
text | 4｜Faerie dragon
text | 5｜Pixie
text | 6｜Satyr
text | 7｜Sprite
text | 8｜Unicorn
section | Character Traits

text | As the players choose backgrounds for their characters, they can use the following tables to help determine their characters' personality traits, ideals, bonds, and flaws. Players can use these tables instead of the ones that appear in the Player's Handbook, or they can mix and match them. If a rolled result doesn't make sense for a character, the player can roll again or choose a more appropriate entry on the table.
text | These tables, while optional, are well suited to Feywild-themed adventures and are ideal for any character who has the feylost or Witchlight hand background.
text | Personality Traits
text | d8｜Trait
text | 1｜I'm haunted by fey laughter that only I can hear, though I know it's just my mind playing tricks on me.
text | 2｜Like a nomad, I can't settle down in one place for very long.
text | 3｜Good music makes me weep like a baby.
text | 4｜Wherever I go, I try to bring a little of the warmth and tranquility of home with me.
text | 5｜I have never lost my childlike sense of wonder.
text | 6｜When I have a new idea, I get wildly excited about it until I come up with another, better idea.
text | 7｜I live by my own set of weird and wonderful rules.
text | 8｜I can't bring myself to trust most adults.
text | Ideals
text | d8｜Ideal
text | 1｜Friendship. I never leave a friend behind. (Good)
text | 2｜Empathy. No creature should be made to suffer. (Good)
text | 3｜Wanderlust. I prefer to take the less traveled path. (Chaotic)
text | 4｜Changeability. Change is good, which is why I live by an ever-changing set of rules. (Chaotic)
text | 5｜Honor. A deal is a deal, and I would never break one. (Lawful)
text | 6｜Rule of Three. Everything in the multiverse happens in threes. I see the "rule of three" everywhere. (Lawful)
text | 7｜Obsession. I won't let go of a grudge. (Evil)
text | 8｜Greed. I will do whatever it takes to get what I want, regardless of the harm it might cause. (Evil)
text | Bonds
text | d8｜Bond
text | 1｜I would never break my word.
text | 2｜I find magic in all its forms to be compelling. The more magical a place, the more I am drawn to it.
text | 3｜I do what I can to protect the natural world.
text | 4｜A trusted friend is the most important thing in the multiverse to me.
text | 5｜I can't bring myself to harm a Fey creature, either because I consider myself one or because I fear the repercussions.
text | 6｜The Witchlight Carnival feels like home to me.
text | 7｜I'm drawn to the Feywild and long to return there, if only for a short while.
text | 8｜I feel indebted to Mister Witch and Mister Light for giving me a home and a purpose.
text | Flaws
text | d8｜Flaw
text | 1｜I easily lose track of time. My poor sense of time means I'm always late.
text | 2｜I think the whole multiverse is out to get me.
text | 3｜I'm always operating under a tight timeline, and I'm obsessed with keeping everything on schedule.
text | 4｜I'm a kleptomaniac who covets shiny, sparkling treasure.
text | 5｜I'm forgetful. Sometimes I can't remember even the simplest things.
text | 6｜I never give away anything for free and always expect something in return.
text | 7｜I have many vices and tend to indulge them.
text | 8｜I'm always changing my mind—well, almost always.

title: Fisher
contents: bullet | Skill Proficiencies: History, Survival
bullet | Languages: One of your choice
bullet | Equipment: Fishing tackle, a net, a favorite fishing lure or oiled leather wading boots, a set of traveler's clothes, and a belt pouch containing 10 gp

description | Feature: Harvest the Water | You gain advantage on ability checks made using fishing tackle. If you have access to a body of water that sustains marine life, you can maintain a moderate lifestyle while working as a fisher, and you can catch enough food to feed yourself and up to ten other people each day.

description | Fishing Tale | You can tell a compelling tale, whether tall or true, to impress and entertain others. Once a day, you can tell your story to willing listeners. At the DM's discretion, a number of those listeners become friendly toward you; this is not a magical effect, and continued amicability on their part depends on your actions. You can roll on the following table to help determine the theme of your tale or choose one that best fits your character. Alternatively, work with your DM to create your own fishing tale.
text | d8｜Tale
text | 1｜Lobster Wrestling. You fought in hand-to-hand combat with an immense lobster.
text | 2｜It Dragged the Boat. You nearly caught a fish of monstrous size that pulled your boat for miles.
text | 3｜Fins of Pure Gold. You caught a sea animal whose fins were made of pure gold, but another fisher stole it.
text | 4｜Ghost Fish. You are haunted by a ghostly fish that only you can see.
text | 5｜Nemesis Clam. A large clam containing a pearl the size of your head claimed one of your fingers before jetting away; one day, you'll find that clam.
text | 6｜It Swallowed the Sun. You once saw a fish leap from the water and turn day into night.
text | 7｜Dive into the Abyss. You found yourself in an underwater cave leading to the Abyss, and your luck has been sour ever since.
text | 8｜Love Story. You fell in love with a creature of pure water, but your brief romance ended tragically.

description | Suggested Characteristics | Fishers succeed only if they spend time at their jobs. As such, most fishers have a strong work ethic, and they admire others who earn their living honestly. Fishers tend to be superstitious, forming attachments to particular fishing lures or special fishing spots. They have a connection to the bodies of water in which they fish, and they think poorly of those whose actions adversely affect their livelihood.
text | Fisher Personality Traits
text | d8｜Personality Trait
text | 1｜I am unmoved by the wrath of nature.
text | 2｜My friends are my crew; we sink or float together.
text | 3｜I need long stretches of quiet to clear my head.
text | 4｜Rich folk don't know the satisfaction of hard work.
text | 5｜I laugh heartily, feel deeply, and fear nothing.
text | 6｜I work hard; nature offers no handouts.
text | 7｜I dislike bargaining; state your price and mean it.
text | 8｜Luck favors me, and I take risks others might not.
text | Fisher Ideals
text | d6｜Ideal
text | 1｜Camaraderie. Good people make even the longest voyage bearable. (Good)
text | 2｜Luck. Our luck depends on respecting its rules—now throw this salt over your shoulder. (Lawful)
text | 3｜Daring. The richest bounty goes to those who risk everything. (Chaotic)
text | 4｜Plunder. Take all that you can and leave nothing for the scavengers. (Evil)
text | 5｜Balance. Do not fish the same spot twice in a row; suppress your greed, and nature will reward you. (Neutral)
text | 6｜Hard Work. No wave can move a soul hard at work. (Any)
text | Fisher Bonds
text | d6｜Bond
text | 1｜I lost something important in the deep sea, and I intend to find it.
text | 2｜Someone else's greed destroyed my livelihood, and I will be compensated.
text | 3｜I will fish the many famous waters of this land.
text | 4｜The gods saved me during a terrible storm, and I will honor their gift.
text | 5｜My destiny awaits me at the bottom of a particular pond in the Feywild.
text | 6｜I must repay my village's debt.
text | Fisher Flaws
text | d6｜Flaw
text | 1｜I am judgmental, especially of those I deem homebodies or otherwise lazy.
text | 2｜I become depressed and anxious if I'm away from the sea too long.
text | 3｜I have lived a hard life and find it difficult to empathize with others.
text | 4｜I am inclined to tell long-winded stories at inopportune times.
text | 5｜I work hard, but I play harder.
text | 6｜I am obsessed with catching an elusive aquatic beast, often to the detriment of other pursuits.
