title: Folk Hero
contents: bullet | Skill Proficiencies: Animal Handling, Survival
bullet | Tool Proficiencies: One type of artisan's tools, vehicles (land)
bullet | Equipment: A set of artisan's tools (one of your choice), a shovel, an iron pot, a set of common clothes, and a belt pouch containing 10 gp

description | Feature: Rustic Hospitality | Since you come from the ranks of the common folk, you fit in among them with ease. You can find a place to hide, rest, or recuperate among other commoners, unless you have shown yourself to be a danger to them. They will shield you from the law or anyone else searching for you, though they will not risk their lives for you.

description | Specialty | You previously pursued a simple profession among the peasantry, perhaps as a farmer, miner, servant, shepherd, woodcutter, or gravedigger. But something happened that set you on a different path and marked you for greater things. Choose or randomly determine a defining event that marked you as a hero of the people.
text | d10｜Defining Event
text | 1｜I stood up to a tyrant's agents.
text | 2｜I saved people during a natural disaster.
text | 3｜I stood alone against a terrible monster.
text | 4｜I stole from a corrupt merchant to help the poor.
text | 5｜I led a militia to fight off an invading army.
text | 6｜I broke into a tyrant's castle and stole weapons to arm the people.
text | 7｜I trained the peasantry to use farming implements as weapons against a tyrant's soldiers.
text | 8｜A lord rescinded an unpopular decree after I led a symbolic act of protest against it.
text | 9｜A celestial, fey, or similar creature gave me a blessing or revealed my secret origin.
text | 10｜Recruited into a lord's army, I rose to leadership and was commended for my heroism.

description | Suggested Characteristics | A folk hero is one of the common people, for better or for worse. Most folk heroes look on their humble origins as a virtue, not a shortcoming, and their home communities remain very important to them.
text | d8｜Personality Trait
text | 1｜I judge people by their actions, not their words.
text | 2｜If someone is in trouble, I'm always ready to lend help.
text | 3｜When I set my mind to something, I follow through no matter what gets in my way.
text | 4｜I have a strong sense of fair play and always try to find the most equitable solution to arguments.
text | 5｜I'm confident in my own abilities and do what I can to instill confidence in others.
text | 6｜Thinking is for other people. I prefer action.
text | 7｜I misuse long words in an attempt to sound smarter.
text | 8｜I get bored easily. When am I going to get on with my destiny?
text | d6｜Ideal
text | 1｜Respect. People deserve to be treated with dignity and respect. (Good)
text | 2｜Fairness. No one should get preferential treatment before the law, and no one is above the law. (Lawful)
text | 3｜Freedom. Tyrants must not be allowed to oppress the people. (Chaotic)
text | 4｜Might. If I become strong, I can take what I want—what I deserve. (Evil)
text | 5｜Sincerity. There's no good in pretending to be something I'm not. (Neutral)
text | 6｜Destiny. Nothing and no one can steer me away from my higher calling. (Any)
text | d6｜Bond
text | 1｜I have a family, but I have no idea where they are. One day, I hope to see them again.
text | 2｜I worked the land, I love the land, and I will protect the land.
text | 3｜A proud noble once gave me a horrible beating, and I will take my revenge on any bully I encounter.
text | 4｜My tools are symbols of my past life, and I carry them so that I will never forget my roots.
text | 5｜I protect those who cannot protect themselves.
text | 6｜I wish my childhood sweetheart had come with me to pursue my destiny.
text | d6｜Flaw
text | 1｜The tyrant who rules my land will stop at nothing to see me killed.
text | 2｜I'm convinced of the significance of my destiny, and blind to my shortcomings and the risk of failure.
text | 3｜The people who knew me when I was young know my shameful secret, so I can never go home again.
text | 4｜I have a weakness for the vices of the city, especially hard drink.
text | 5｜Secretly, I believe that things would be better if I were a tyrant lording over the land.
text | 6｜I have trouble trusting in my allies.

title: Gambler
contents: bullet | Skill Proficiencies: Deception, Insight
bullet | Tool Proficiencies: One gaming set
bullet | Languages: Any one of your choice
bullet | Equipment: One gaming set, a lucky charm, a set of fine clothes, and a belt pouch containing 15 gp

description | Feature: Never Tell Me the Odds | Odds and probability are your bread and butter. During downtime activities that involve games of chance or figuring odds on the best plan, you can get a solid sense of which choice is likely the best one and which opportunities seem too good to be true, at the DM's determination.

description | Suggested Characteristics | Some gamble out of necessity. Others do so out of boredom. Still others become addicted to the thrill of winning or losing everything on a turn of fortune. For some, gambling is less a matter of chance and more a matter of seeking every advantage to ensure the outcome. The best gamblers can lose everything, and the worst gamblers sometimes win. Regardless, you can always tell gamblers by the look in their eyes. Lady Luck haunts them.
text | d8｜Personality Trait
text | 1｜I plan for every contingency. Leave nothing to chance!
text | 2｜Every copper wants to be a silver. Each bet is an opportunity.
text | 3｜I'm one of Lady Luck's favored. Anything I try is destined to succeed.
text | 4｜I've lost so much to gambling that I refuse to spend money on anything anymore.
text | 5｜Nothing is certain. Planning is a coward's act.
text | 6｜I can't be sure who I've swindled, cheated, or defeated, so I keep a low profile in public.
text | 7｜The perfect bet is out there somewhere. I just have to keep my eyes open.
text | 8｜I have beaten my addiction, but all it takes is one weak moment and I'll be back at the card table.
text | d6｜Ideal
text | 1｜Knowledge. Knowledge is power, and knowing which horse to back is the key to success. (Any)
text | 2｜Fate. Whatever happens is fated, regardless of any planning or striving. (Lawful)
text | 3｜Bravery. If you want to succeed, you have to take risks. (Chaotic)
text | 4｜Survival. You can't win if you're dead. Live to fight another day—when the odds might be more in your favor. (Any)
text | 5｜Reliability. When I was in need, I was able to rely on others. Now I want to be the one others rely on. (Good)
text | 6｜Victory. Winning is the real measure of a person. In the end, the only thing that matters is the scoreboard. (Evil)
text | d6｜Bond
text | 1｜One person in particular owes me a lot of money, and I need to keep them alive if I want to be repaid.
text | 2｜I'm loyal to the friend or family member who taught me how to gamble.
text | 3｜The person who saved me from my gambling addiction is the only reason I'm alive today.
text | 4｜A patron once fronted me money in exchange for a percentage of my winnings. I owe them a debt of gratitude. And a lot of cash.
text | 5｜A criminal syndicate I once played for isn't happy I left the game, and its enforcers are looking for me.
text | 6｜Urchins once helped me find marks for my games. Now I'm driven to help them escape the streets.
text | d6｜Flaw
text | 1｜I don't know when to quit. Especially when everyone else is telling me to.
text | 2｜I save my sympathy for my friends, and I have no friends.
text | 3｜You think we're in trouble now? Let me tell you how bad things are likely to get!
text | 4｜You can loan me a little, right? I've got a sure thing. I'll double your money, guaranteed.
text | 5｜I was once a terribly flawed person, like you. Let me tell you how you can save yourself.
text | 6｜I'm a great gambler. I'm just bad at math and logic.

title: Gate Warden
contents: bullet | Skill Proficiencies: Persuasion, Survival
bullet | Languages: Two of your choice (Abyssal, Celestial, or Infernal recommended)
bullet | Equipment: A ring of keys to unknown locks, a blank book, an ink pen or quill, a bottle of black ink, a set of traveler's clothes, and a pouch containing 10 gp

description | Feature: Planar Infusion | Living in a gate-town or a similar location steeped you in planar energy. You gain the Scion of the Outer Planes feat. In addition, you know where to find free, modest lodging and food in the community you grew up in.
description | Suggested Characteristics | The influence of an Outer Plane shapes your perspective. The Gate Warden Personality Traits table suggests traits you might adopt for your character.
text | d6｜Personality Trait
text | 1｜Strange events and otherworldly creatures don't faze me.
text | 2｜I think in terms of exchange: something for something, nothing for nothing.
text | 3｜I speak with an unusual cadence.
text | 4｜I pepper my speech with words or curses borrowed from planar languages.
text | 5｜I've seen enough to know that you can't take anyone at face value, so I scrutinize everyone.
text | 6｜I have a superstitious habit I picked up from my gate-town, such as touching iron when I'm nervous or arranging objects in a specific order.

description | Building a Gate Warden Character | Those who dwell for an extended time near a permanent portal to another plane absorb the essence radiating from the realm beyond. Those influenced by the same plane share similarities in behavior and even physical appearance.

description | Gate Warden Trinkets | When you make your character, you can roll once on the Gate Warden Trinkets table, instead of on the Trinkets table in the Player's Handbook, for your starting trinket.

title: Genie Touched
contents: bullet | Ability Scores: Dexterity, Wisdom, Charisma
bullet | Feat: Magic Initiate (Wizard)
bullet | Skill Proficiencies: Perception and Persuasion
bullet | Tool Proficiencies: Glassblower's Tools
bullet | Equipment: Choose A or B: (A) Light Hammer, Glassblower's Tools, Fine Clothes, Lamp, Oil (3 flasks), Waterskin, 2 GP; or (B) 50 GP

title: Giant Foundling
contents: bullet | Skill Proficiencies: Intimidation, Survival
bullet | Languages: Giant and one other language of your choice
bullet | Equipment: A backpack, a set of traveler's clothes, a small stone or sprig that reminds you of home, and a pouch containing 10 gp
description | Origin Stories | How you came to live among colossal creatures is up to you to determine, but the Foundling Origin table suggests a variety of possibilities.
text | Foundling Origin
text | d6｜Origin
text | 1｜You were found as a baby by a family of nomadic giants who raised you as one of their own.
text | 2｜A family of stone giants rescued you when you fell into a mountain chasm, and you have lived with them underground ever since.
text | 3｜You were lost or abandoned as a child in a jungle that teemed with ravenous dinosaurs. There, you found an equally lost frost giant; together, you survived.
text | 4｜Your farm was crushed and your family killed in a battle between warring groups of giants. Racked with guilt over the destruction, a sympathetic giant soldier promised to care for you.
text | 5｜After you had a series of strange dreams as a child, your superstitious parents sent you to study with a powerful but aloof storm giant oracle.
text | 6｜While playing hide-and-seek with your friends, you stumbled into the castle of a cloud giant, who immediately adopted you.

description | Building a Giant Foundling Character | Your life among giants has given you a unique perspective. Though you are unusually large for your kind, you're no larger than a giant child, so you might be very mindful of your size.
description | Feature: Strike of the Giants | You gain the Strike of the Giants feat.
description | Suggested Characteristics | The Giant Foundling Personality Traits table suggests a variety of traits you might adopt for your character.
text | d6｜Personality Trait
text | 1｜What I lack in stature compared to giants, I make up for with sheer spite.
text | 2｜I insist on being taken seriously as a full-grown adult. Nobody talks down to me!
text | 3｜Crowded spaces make me uncomfortable. I'd much rather be in an open field than a bustling tavern.
text | 4｜I embrace my shorter stature. It helps me stay unnoticed—and underestimated.
text | 5｜Every avalanche begins as a single pebble.
text | 6｜The world always feels too big, and I'm afraid I'll never find my place in it.

title: Golgari Agent
contents: bullet | Skill Proficiencies: Nature, Survival
bullet | Tool Proficiencies: Poisoner's kit
bullet | Languages: Choose one of Elvish, Giant, or Kraul
bullet | Equipment: A Golgari insignia, a poisoner's kit, a pet beetle or spider, a set of common clothes, and a belt pouch containing 10 gp worth of mixed coins

description | Feature: Undercity Paths | You know hidden, underground pathways that you can use to bypass crowds, obstacles, and observation as you move through the city. When you aren't in combat, you and companions you lead can travel between any two locations in the city twice as fast as your speed would normally allow. The paths of the undercity are haunted by dangers that rarely brave the light of the surface world, so your journey isn't guaranteed to be safe.
description | Golgari Guild Spells | Prerequisite: Spellcasting or Pact Magic class feature

text | For you, the spells on the Golgari Guild Spells table are added to the spell list of your spellcasting class. (If you are a multiclass character with multiple spell lists, these spells are added to all of them.)
text | Golgari Guild Spells
text | Spell Level｜Spells
text | Cantrip｜dancing lights, spare the dying
text | 1st｜entangle, ray of sickness
text | 2nd｜protection from poison, ray of enfeeblement, spider climb
text | 3rd｜animate dead, plant growth
text | 4th｜giant insect, grasping vine
text | 5th｜cloudkill, insect plague
text | Golgari magic is often accompanied by a sickly green glow and a rotting stench.

description | Suggested Characteristics | Members of the Golgari Swarm are unmistakably products of the undercity, ill at ease amid the comforts of civilization. They bring about the same discomfort in others by reminding them of death's inevitable approach.
text | Personality Traits
text | d8｜Personality Trait
text | 1｜Remember, I could kill you in your sleep. Or put centipedes in your bedroll.
text | 2｜I like to remind people of their inevitable demise.
text | 3｜Sometimes I give voice to the whispers of the rot, which I hear but no one else does.
text | 4｜I do my best to discourage anyone from approaching or talking to me.
text | 5｜I have accepted my death. Hence, I don't fear it.
text | 6｜Like roots growing through stone, I am relentless and determined in my action.
text | 7｜I put my knowledge of anatomy to use by narrating the injuries my enemies suffer in grisly detail.
text | 8｜Like a wild animal, I lash out viciously when I'm provoked—and I'm easily provoked.
text | Ideals
text | d6｜Ideal
text | 1｜Guild. My guild is all that really matters. (Any)
text | 2｜Stoicism. All of us are part of the cyclical march of nature, which will continue with or without us. (Neutral)
text | 3｜Nature. The natural world is more important than the edifices of the city and civilization. (Neutral)
text | 4｜Interdependence. We are all part of nature's web. (Lawful)
text | 5｜Ambition. The time of Golgari ascendance is at hand, and I intend to have a prominent place in the new world order. (Evil)
text | 6｜Live and Let Live. Meddling in the affairs of other guilds is a great way to get squashed like a bug. (Neutral)
text | Bonds
text | d6｜Bond
text | 1｜I cherish the finger of a family member who was petrified by a medusa.
text | 2｜I have an identical twin who is as different from me as any person could be.
text | 3｜I want to lead one faction of the guild to a new position of dominance.
text | 4｜I love spending time in the moss-covered building where I took part in my first reclamation mission.
text | 5｜I found something in the sewer that must never come to light.
text | 6｜I am forever grateful to the reclaimer who found me floating facedown in the sewer, moments from death.
text | Flaws
text | d6｜Flaw
text | 1｜Death comes for us all, so you can't expect me to take care of someone who can't fight it off.
text | 2｜I assume that anyone outside the Golgari looks down on me.
text | 3｜I feel a need for revenge against those who enjoy the privilege of living above ground.
text | 4｜I don't bother to couch my opinions in flattering words.
text | 5｜I can't help but pocket any trinket or coin I come across, no matter how worthless.
text | 6｜I'm convinced that I'm better and stronger than members of other guilds, isolated as they are from the realities of life and death.

description | Contacts | To the extent that the Golgari Swarm acts like a single organism, you are connected to every other member in some way or another. Convinced that the rest of the world is out to get you, you find it easy to form close bonds with your guild mates, and harder to make meaningful connections with others.
text | Roll twice on the Golgari Contacts table (for an ally and a rival) and once on the Non-Golgari Contacts table.
text | Golgari Contacts
text | d8｜Contact
text | 1｜One of my parents is an elite assassin, a member of the Ochran.
text | 2｜I learned combat from a kraul.
text | 3｜I know a medusa who is stationed in the guildhall.
text | 4｜I had a torrid romance with a spore druid responsible for a large rot farm.
text | 5｜There's a troll in a remote area of the undercity who seems to find me interesting—and who knows more than you'd think.
text | 6｜An elf lich is determined to see me become a lich someday, too.
text | 7｜A medusa decided it would be more fun to recruit me into the guild than to kill me.
text | 8｜I know a findbroker who can locate just about anything, for the right price.
text | Non-Golgari Contacts
text | d10｜Contact
text | 1｜An Azorius arrester I literally pulled out of the gutter will do anything for me.
text | 2｜Someone joined the Gruul in a battle against the Boros once, and the sergeant of that Boros squad would love to prove that it was me.
text | 3｜I had a romance with a Dimir agent whom I still feed secrets to.
text | 4｜Roll an additional Golgari contact; you can decide if the contact is an ally or a rival.
text | 5｜I joined the Gruul in a battle against the Boros once, and the chief of that small clan thanks me for turning the tide.
text | 6｜An Izzet scientist resents that I sold a scrapped invention I found in the sewer.
text | 7｜My undercity explorations led me into an Orzhov vault, and a spirit thinks I stole something valuable.
text | 8｜I found a baby beast and sold it to a Rakdos wrangler who remains grateful to me.
text | 9｜A Selesnya druid and I share an interest in the same garden, and we have enjoyable arguments there.
text | 10｜I regularly pick up refuse from beneath a Simic laboratory, and sometimes I talk to the researcher who dumps it there.

description | How Do I Fit In? | As part of the Golgari Swarm, you are a specialized instrument of the greater body. Your orders, when you have such, come from the guildmaster by way of his chancellors, who carry his messages throughout the guild. The swarm relies on you to advance the greater good by protecting some part, however small, of its teeming existence. That responsibility doesn't mean you're indispensable; your eventual death is part of your purpose and function, too, and you'll be replaced even as your body provides nutrients to further the swarm's growth.

text | A classic adventuring role for a member of the Golgari involves crawling through dungeon-like environments—the sewers and ancient vaults of the undercity—in search of treasures left behind by the dead. Sometimes you might be sent to find a specific item believed lost in a dangerous part of the undercity. At other times, you could be asked to collect samples of a specific fungus, retrieve a body floating in the muck of the sewers, or bring back whatever booty you can to help fill the swarm's coffers.

text | You might gain enough renown to become a member of the Ochran, assigned to a variety of tasks concerning thievery, assassination, or the protection of important figures in your guild. You might steal something because the guild needs it, or because its loss will bring harm to another guild, hastening that group's decline. You could be assigned to kill an outspoken and active enemy of the Golgari, such as an overzealous Boros captain whose raids into the undercity have approached dangerously close to the swarm's inner sanctum. Or you could serve as a bodyguard to one of Guildmaster Jarad's high chancellors, escorting this figure through the undercity while being ready to intervene at a moment's notice if things go wrong.

text | The shamans of the Golgari use their magic to accelerate the cycle of decay and regrowth. You might be sent to spread spores throughout an area that the Golgari want to claim as their territory or to convince the inhabitants of such a territory to abandon it. You might also contend with the ever-present threat of hostile monsters encroaching into Golgari-controlled regions.

title: Grinner
contents: bullet | Skill Proficiencies: Deception, Performance
bullet | Tool Proficiencies: One type of musical instrument, thieves' tools
bullet | Equipment: A set of fine clothes, a disguise kit, a musical instrument of your choice, a gold-plated ring depicting a smiling face, and a pouch containing 15 gp

description | Feature: Ballad of the Grinning Fool | Like every Grinner, you know how to find a hideout. In any city of 10,000 people or more on the Menagerie Coast or in the lands of the Dwendalian Empire, you can play the "Ballad of the Grinning Fool" in a major tavern or inn. A member of the Golden Grin will find you and give shelter to you and any companions you vouch for. This shelter might be discontinued if it becomes too dangerous to hide you, at the DM's discretion.
text | This feature must be used with caution, for not all who know the ballad are your friends. Some are traitors, counterspies, or agents of tyranny.

description | Suggested Characteristics | Grinners are trained in the art of secrecy and innuendo, and are skilled at hiding in plain sight by being the loudest and brightest person in the room. Their skills in subterfuge and combat lend themselves well to an adventuring lifestyle, and traveling with mercenaries and treasure hunters creates a convenient excuse to journey through lands bent under tyranny.
text | d8｜Personality Trait
text | 1｜I love the spotlight. Everyone, look at me!
text | 2｜Give me a drink and I'm your friend.
text | 3｜Talk to me about yourself. I'm a hell of a listener.
text | 4｜I hate to start fights, but I love to finish them.
text | 5｜I can't sit still.
text | 6｜I'm always humming an old tune from my past.
text | 7｜When I don't have a reason to smile, I'm miserable.
text | 8｜I'm lucky like you wouldn't believe.
text | d6｜Ideal
text | 1｜Revolution. Tyrants must fall, no matter the cost. (Chaotic)
text | 2｜Compassion. The only way to make a better world is to perform small kindnesses. (Good)
text | 3｜Justice. A nation built upon just foundations will uphold freedom for all. (Law)
text | 4｜Expression. Music, joy, and laughter are the keys to freedom. (Good)
text | 5｜Self-Determination. People should be free to do as they please. (Chaotic)
text | 6｜Vigilance. A free people must be carefully taught, lest they be misled. (Neutral)
text | d6｜Bond
text | 1｜I lost someone important to an agent of the Dwendalian Empire. That regime will fall.
text | 2｜The first people to be hurt by this war will be the common folk. I need to protect them.
text | 3｜Music helped me through a dark time in my life. Now, I'll use music to change the world.
text | 4｜I will be known as the greatest spy who ever lived.
text | 5｜All life is precious to me. I know I can change the world without taking a humanoid life.
text | 6｜The elite in their ivory towers don't understand how we suffer. I intend to show them.
text | d6｜Flaw
text | 1｜I've never lied once in my life. What? No, I'm not crossing my fingers!
text | 2｜I do everything big! Subtlety? I don't know the meaning of subtlety! Oh, that's a problem?
text | 3｜Being a spy in wartime is painful. I've seen so much suffering, I think I'm losing my mind.
text | 4｜I can't focus on my mission. I just want to carouse and sing and play!
text | 5｜Yeah, that's my name. Yeah, I'm a Grinner spy. Who cares about staying undercover?
text | 6｜I can't afford to trust anyone. Not. Anyone.

title: Gruul Anarch
contents: bullet | Skill Proficiencies: Animal Handling, Athletics
bullet | Tool Proficiencies: Herbalism kit
bullet | Languages: Choose one of Draconic, Giant, Goblin, or Sylvan
bullet | Equipment: A Gruul insignia, a hunting trap, an herbalism kit, the skull of a boar, a beast-hide cloak, a set of traveler's clothes, and a belt pouch containing 10 gp (Azorius 1-zino coins)

description | Feature: Rubblebelt Refuge | You are intimately familiar with areas of the city that most people shun: ruined neighborhoods where wurms rampaged, overgrown parks that no hand has tended in decades, and the vast, sprawling rubblebelts of broken terrain that civilized folk have long abandoned. You can find a suitable place for you and your allies to hide or rest in these areas. In addition, you can find food and fresh water in these areas for yourself and up to five other people each day.
description | Gruul Guild Spells | Prerequisite: Spellcasting or Pact Magic class feature

text | For you, the spells on the Gruul Guild Spells table are added to the spell list of your spellcasting class. (If you are a multiclass character with multiple spell lists, these spells are added to all of them.)
text | Gruul Guild Spells
text | Spell Level｜Spells
text | Cantrip｜fire bolt, produce flame
text | 1st｜compelled duel, speak with animals, thunderwave
text | 2nd｜beast sense, shatter
text | 3rd｜conjure animals, conjure barrage
text | 4th｜dominate beast, stoneskin
text | 5th｜destructive wave
text | Fueled by the fire of rage burning in your heart, your magic is almost always accompanied by fiery effects, such as flames smoldering behind your eyes or dancing over your hands.

description | Suggested Characteristics | Gruul ways aren't the ways of civilized folk, and the Gruul have little patience for social niceties. But they do have cherished traditions and values, just as important to them as the different values held by the urban, cosmopolitan culture of Ravnica.
text | Personality Traits
text | d8｜Personality Trait
text | 1｜Unlike people, the beasts of the wild are friends who won't stab me in the back.
text | 2｜Go ahead and insult me—I dare you.
text | 3｜I scorn those who can't survive away from the comforts of the city.
text | 4｜Don't tell me I'm not allowed to do something.
text | 5｜Laws are for people who are afraid to face their inner beasts.
text | 6｜I smear the blood of my enemies over my skin.
text | 7｜I was, in fact, raised by maaka.
text | 8｜HarrRRAAGGHH! [I rarely form a coherent sentence and prefer to express myself by breaking things.]
text | Ideals
text | d6｜Ideal
text | 1｜Clan. My clan is all that really matters. (Any)
text | 2｜Anarchy. No person or law or custom can tell another what to do. (Chaotic)
text | 3｜Nature. We weren't born tame or domesticated, so we shouldn't have to live that way. (Neutral)
text | 4｜Might. The strongest are meant to dominate the weak. (Evil)
text | 5｜Rage. AAAAAARRRRggggh! [To live is to feel and express the rage burning in your belly.] (Chaotic)
text | 6｜Tradition. The Old Ways must be preserved and upheld. (Any)
text | Bonds
text | d6｜Bond
text | 1｜I am determined that one day I will lead my clan—or a new one.
text | 2｜I would give my life for my clan chieftain.
text | 3｜The chieftain of another clan has a grudge against me.
text | 4｜I am devoted to a sacred site in the midst of the rubblebelt.
text | 5｜My weapon is made from the first raktusk I ever hunted.
text | 6｜GrrrRRAAAAGGHH! [I will do anything to prove myself greater than my siblings or ancestors.]
text | Flaws
text | d6｜Flaw
text | 1｜If you question my courage, I will never back down.
text | 2｜HrrrGGGAAAARRuuuh! [My anger in battle led to the death of a loved one.]
text | 3｜I'm as stubborn as a batterboar.
text | 4｜I'm so convinced of my superiority over soft, civilized people that I'll take great risks to prove it.
text | 5｜I'm easily manipulated by people I find attractive.
text | 6｜I'm not actually all that angry.

description | Contacts | The members of the Gruul Clans rely on each other even as they vie for territory and glory. Their encounters with members of other guilds are more often violent than friendly, but occasional bonds do form.
text | Roll twice on the Gruul Contacts table (for an ally and a rival) and once on the Non-Gruul Contacts table.
text | Gruul Contacts
text | d8｜Contact
text | 1｜One of my parents is a renowned warrior in my clan.
text | 2｜My sibling has the ear of the clan chief.
text | 3｜I have cousins in a different clan.
text | 4｜When we were younger, I was romantically involved with a prominent warrior in my clan.
text | 5｜A druid in my clan believes I have a destiny to fulfill.
text | 6｜The warrior who trained me remembers me for my exceptional potential.
text | 7｜My clan chief killed one of my parents, who had challenged the chief for leadership of the clan. Some combination of resentment and remorse stirs the clan chief to help me sometimes.
text | 8｜I made a strong impression on Borborygmos.
text | Non-Gruul Contacts
text | d10｜Contact
text | 1｜An Azorius arrester thinks I can be reformed.
text | 2｜A Boros soldier gives me gifts in exchange for information about other clans' movements.
text | 3｜I once caught and released a Dimir spy.
text | 4｜I consult with a Golgari shaman for spiritual guidance at times.
text | 5｜Roll an additional Gruul contact; you can decide if the contact is an ally or a rival.
text | 6｜An Izzet scientist blames the Gruul for the destruction of his life's work in a raid, but seems to think that I'm not like other Gruul.
text | 7｜I foolishly borrowed money from an Orzhov syndic to indulge a shameful vice.
text | 8｜A close friend left our clan and joined the Cult of Rakdos.
text | 9｜A distant relative is trying to recruit me into the Selesnya Conclave.
text | 10｜I stopped a Simic biomancer from trapping wild beasts to perform vile experiments on them.

description | How Do I Fit In? | In service of a simple goal, you have a simple part to play: Fight. Unleash your rage. Flatten buildings and defeat those who stand in your way. Be Gruul, in your own way.

text | You will frequently be summoned to participate in a raid your clan is launching against the city or against a group of its defenders. Your clan leader might also send you on a special mission, though it would almost certainly still qualify as a raid. You might join a small group of Gruul warriors on a dangerous charge deep into the settled streets to plunder a certain location, retrieve an item stolen from your clan, or assault a Boros garrison.

text | Sometimes your objective might be more esoteric. With prophecies of the return of Ilharg the Raze-Boar spreading like wildfire among the Gruul druids, you might be asked to carry out some task that the druids believe will speed his coming. Such a task might involve collecting a sacred relic held in an Orzhov vault or collecting sacrifices for a grand ceremony in the Raze-Boar's honor.

contents: bullet | Skill Proficiencies: Insight, Persuasion
bullet | Tool Proficiencies: One type of artisan's tools
bullet | Languages: One of your choice
bullet | Equipment: A set of artisan's tools (one of your choice), a letter of introduction from your guild, a set of traveler's clothes, and a belt pouch containing 15 gp

description | Feature: Guild Membership | As an established and respected member of a guild, you can rely on certain benefits that membership provides. Your fellow guild members will provide you with lodging and food if necessary, and pay for your funeral if needed. In some cities and towns, a guildhall offers a central place to meet other members of your profession, which can be a good place to meet potential patrons, allies, or hirelings.

text | Guilds often wield tremendous political power. If you are accused of a crime, your guild will support you if a good case can be made for your innocence or the crime is justifiable. You can also gain access to powerful political figures through the guild, if you are a member in good standing. Such connections might require the donation of money or magic items to the guild's coffers.
text | You must pay dues of 5 gp per month to the guild. If you miss payments, you must make up back dues to remain in the guild's good graces.

description | Specialty | Guilds are generally found in cities large enough to support several artisans practicing the same trade. However, your guild might instead be a loose network of artisans who each work in a different village within a larger realm. Work with your DM to determine the nature of your guild. You can select your guild business from the Guild Business table or roll randomly.
text | d20｜Guild Business
text | 1｜Alchemists and apothecaries
text | 2｜Armorers, locksmiths, and finesmiths
text | 3｜Brewers, distillers, and vintners
text | 4｜Calligraphers, scribes, and scriveners
text | 5｜Carpenters, roofers, and plasterers
text | 6｜Cartographers, surveyors, and chart-makers
text | 7｜Cobblers and shoemakers
text | 8｜Cooks and bakers
text | 9｜Glassblowers and glaziers
text | 10｜Jewelers and gemcutters
text | 11｜Leatherworkers, skinners, and tanners
text | 12｜Masons and stonecutters
text | 13｜Painters, limners, and sign-makers
text | 14｜Potters and tile-makers
text | 15｜Shipwrights and sail-makers
text | 16｜Smiths and metal-forgers
text | 17｜Tinkers, pewterers, and casters
text | 18｜Wagon-makers and wheelwrights
text | 19｜Weavers and dyers
text | 20｜Woodcarvers, coopers, and bowyers

description | Suggested Characteristics | Guild artisans are among the most ordinary people in the world—until they set down their tools and take up an adventuring career. They understand the value of hard work and the importance of community, but they're vulnerable to sins of greed and covetousness.
text | d8｜Personality Trait
text | 1｜I believe that anything worth doing is worth doing right. I can't help it—I'm a perfectionist.
text | 2｜I'm a snob who looks down on those who can't appreciate fine art.
text | 3｜I always want to know how things work and what makes people tick.
text | 4｜I'm full of witty aphorisms and have a proverb for every occasion.
text | 5｜I'm rude to people who lack my commitment to hard work and fair play.
text | 6｜I like to talk at length about my profession.
text | 7｜I don't part with my money easily and will haggle tirelessly to get the best deal possible.
text | 8｜I'm well known for my work, and I want to make sure everyone appreciates it. I'm always taken aback when people haven't heard of me.
text | d6｜Ideal
text | 1｜Community. It is the duty of all civilized people to strengthen the bonds of community and the security of civilization. (Lawful)
text | 2｜Generosity. My talents were given to me so that I could use them to benefit the world. (Good)
text | 3｜Freedom. Everyone should be free to pursue his or her own livelihood. (Chaotic)
text | 4｜Greed. I'm only in it for the money. (Evil)
text | 5｜People. I'm committed to the people I care about, not to ideals. (Neutral)
text | 6｜Aspiration. I work hard to be the best there is at my craft. (Any)
text | d6｜Bond
text | 1｜The workshop where I learned my trade is the most important place in the world to me.
text | 2｜I created a great work for someone, and then found them unworthy to receive it. I'm still looking for someone worthy.
text | 3｜I owe my guild a great debt for forging me into the person I am today.
text | 4｜I pursue wealth to secure someone's love.
text | 5｜One day I will return to my guild and prove that I am the greatest artisan of them all.
text | 6｜I will get revenge on the evil forces that destroyed my place of business and ruined my livelihood.
text | d6｜Flaw
text | 1｜I'll do anything to get my hands on something rare or priceless.
text | 2｜I'm quick to assume that someone is trying to cheat me.
text | 3｜No one must ever learn that I once stole money from guild coffers.
text | 4｜I'm never satisfied with what I have—I always want more.
text | 5｜I would kill to acquire a noble title.
text | 6｜I'm horribly jealous of anyone who can outshine my handiwork. Everywhere I go, I'm surrounded by rivals.

contents: bullet | Skill Proficiencies: Choose two from among Arcana, Investigation, Religion, or Survival
bullet | Languages: Choose two, one of which must be Abyssal, Celestial, Deep Speech, Draconic, Infernal, Primordial, Sylvan, or Undercommon

bullet | Equipment: Monster hunter's pack (containing a chest, a crowbar, a hammer, three wooden stakes, a holy symbol, a flask of holy water, a set of manacles, a steel mirror, a flask of oil, a tinderbox, and 3 torches), a set of common clothes, one trinket of special significance (choose one or roll on the Horror Trinkets table), and 1 sp

description | Feature: Heart of Darkness | Those who look into your eyes can see that you have faced unimaginable horror and that you are no stranger to darkness. Though they might fear you, commoners will extend you every courtesy and do their utmost to help you. Unless you have shown yourself to be a danger to them, they will even take up arms to fight alongside you, should you find yourself facing an enemy alone.

description | Harrowing Event | Prior to becoming an adventurer, your path in life was defined by one dark moment, one fateful decision, or one tragedy. Now you feel a darkness threatening to consume you, and you fear there may be no hope of escape. Choose a harrowing event that haunts you, or roll one on the Harrowing Events table.
text | Harrowing Event
text | d10｜Event
text | 1｜A monster that slaughtered dozens of innocent people spared your life, and you don't know why.
text | 2｜You were born under a dark star. You can feel it watching you, coldly and distantly. Sometimes it beckons you in the dead of night.
text | 3｜An apparition that has haunted your family for generations now haunts you. You don't know what it wants, and it won't leave you alone.
text | 4｜Your family has a history of practicing the dark arts. You dabbled once and felt something horrible clutch at your soul, whereupon you fled in terror.
text | 5｜An oni took your sibling one cold, dark night, and you were unable to stop it.
text | 6｜You were cursed with lycanthropy and later cured. You are now haunted by the innocents you slaughtered.
text | 7｜A hag kidnapped and raised you. You escaped, but the hag still has a magical hold over you and fills your mind with evil thoughts.
text | 8｜You opened an eldritch tome and saw things unfit for a sane mind. You burned the book, but its words and images are burned into your psyche.
text | 9｜A fiend possessed you as a child. You were locked away but escaped. The fiend is still inside you, but now you try to keep it bottled up.
text | 10｜You did terrible things to avenge the murder of someone you loved. You became a monster, and it haunts your waking dreams.
section | Horror Characteristics

text | Characters in a horror-focused campaign might have distinct motivations and characteristics. Use the following tables to supplement your background's suggested characteristics or to inspire those of your own design.
text | Horror Character Personality Traits
text | d12｜Personality Trait
text | 1｜I had an encounter that I believe gives me a special affinity with a supernatural creature or event.
text | 2｜A signature piece of clothing or distinct weapon serves as an emblem of who I am.
text | 3｜I never accept that I'm out of my depth.
text | 4｜I must know the answer to every secret. No door remains unopened in my presence.
text | 5｜I let people underestimate me, revealing my full competency only to those close to me.
text | 6｜I compulsively seek to collect trophies of my travels and victories.
text | 7｜It doesn't matter if the whole world's against me. I'll always do what I think is right.
text | 8｜I have morbid interests and a macabre aesthetic.
text | 9｜I have a personal ritual, mantra, or relaxation method I use to deal with stress.
text | 10｜Nothing is more important than life, and I never leave anyone in danger.
text | 11｜I'm quick to jump to extreme solutions. Why risk a lesser option not working?
text | 12｜I'm easily startled, but I'm not a coward.
text | Horror Character Ideals
text | d12｜Ideal
text | 1｜Adrenaline. I've experienced such strangeness that now I feel alive only in extreme situations.
text | 2｜Balance. I strive to counter the deeds of someone for whom I feel responsible.
text | 3｜Bound. I've wronged someone and must work their will to avoid their curse.
text | 4｜Escape. I believe there is something beyond the world I know, and I need to find it.
text | 5｜Legacy. I must do something great so that I'm remembered, and my time is running out.
text | 6｜Misdirection. I work vigorously to keep others from realizing my flaws or misdeeds.
text | 7｜Obsession. I've lived this way for so long that I can't imagine another way.
text | 8｜Obligation. I owe it to my people, faith, family, or teacher to continue a vaunted legacy.
text | 9｜Promise. My life is no longer my own. I must fulfill the dream of someone who's gone.
text | 10｜Revelation. I need to know what lies beyond the mysteries of death, the world, or the Mists.
text | 11｜Sanctuary. I know the forces at work in the world and strive to create islands apart from them.
text | 12｜Truth. I care about the truth above all else, even if it doesn't benefit anyone.
text | Horror Character Bonds
text | d12｜Bond
text | 1｜I desperately need to get back to someone or someplace, but I lost them in the Mists.
text | 2｜Everything I do is in the service of a powerful master, one I must keep a secret from everyone.
text | 3｜I owe much to my vanished mentor. I seek to continue their work even as I search to find them.
text | 4｜I've seen great darkness, and I'm committed to being a light against it—the light of all lights.
text | 5｜Someone I love has become a monster, murderer, or other threat. It's up to me to redeem them.
text | 6｜The world has been convinced of a terrible lie. It's up to me to reveal the truth.
text | 7｜I deeply miss someone and am quick to adopt people who remind me of them.
text | 8｜A great evil dwells within me. I will fight against it and the world's other evils for as long as I can.
text | 9｜I'm desperately seeking a cure to an affliction or a curse, either for someone close to me for myself.
text | 10｜Spirits are drawn to me. I do all I can to help them find peace.
text | 11｜I use my cunning mind to solve mysteries and find justice for those who've been wronged.
text | 12｜I lost someone I care about, but I still see them in guilty visions, recurring dreams, or as a spirit.
text | Horror Character Flaws
text | d12｜Flaw
text | 1｜I believe doom follows me and that anyone who gets close to me will face a tragic end.
text | 2｜I'm convinced something is after me, appearing in mirrors, dreams, and places where no one could.
text | 3｜I'm especially superstitious and live life seeking to avoid bad luck, wicked spirits, or the Mists.
text | 4｜I've done unspeakable evil and will do anything to prevent others from finding out.
text | 5｜I am exceptionally credulous and believe any story or legend immediately.
text | 6｜I'm a skeptic and don't believe in the power of rituals, religion, superstition, or spirits.
text | 7｜I know my future is written and that anything I do will lead to a prophesied end.
text | 8｜I need to find the best in everyone and everything, even when that means denying obvious malice.
text | 9｜I've seen the evil of a type of place—like forests, cities, or graveyards—and resist going there.
text | 10｜I'm exceptionally cautious, planning laboriously and devising countless contingencies.
text | 11｜I have a reputation for defeating a great evil, but that's a lie and the wicked force knows.
text | 12｜I know the ends always justify the means and am quick to make sacrifices to attain my goals.

description | Feature: Inheritance | Choose or randomly determine your inheritance from the possibilities in the table below. Work with your Dungeon Master to come up with details: Why is your inheritance so important, and what is its full story? You might prefer for the DM to invent these details as part of the game, allowing you to learn more about your inheritance as your character does.

text | The Dungeon Master is free to use your inheritance as a story hook, sending you on quests to learn more about its history or true nature, or confronting you with foes who want to claim it for themselves or prevent you from learning what you seek. The DM also determines the properties of your inheritance and how they figure into the item's history and importance. For instance, the object might be a minor magic item, or one that begins with a modest ability and increases in potency with the passage of time. Or, the true nature of your inheritance might not be apparent at first and is revealed only when certain conditions are met.

text | When you begin your adventuring career, you can decide whether to tell your companions about your inheritance right away. Rather than attracting attention to yourself, you might want to keep your inheritance a secret until you learn more about what it means to you and what it can do for you.
text | d8｜Object or item:
text | 1｜A document such as a map, a letter, or a journal
text | 2-3｜a trinket (see "Trinkets" in chapter 5 of the Player's Handbook)
text | 4｜an article of clothing
text | 5｜a piece of jewelry
text | 6｜an arcane book or formulary
text | 7｜a written story, song, poem, or secret
text | 8｜a tattoo or other body marking

description | Suggested Characteristics | Use the tables for the folk hero background in the Player's Handbook as the basis for your traits and motivations, modifying the entries when appropriate to suit your identity as an inheritor.

text | Your bond might be directly related to your inheritance, or to the person from whom you received it. Your ideal might be influenced by what you know about your inheritance, or by what you intend to do with your gift once you realize what it is capable of.

description | Feature: Official Inquiry | You're experienced at gaining access to people and places to get the information you need. Through a combination of fast-talking, determination, and official-looking documentation, you can gain access to a place or an individual related to a crime you're investigating. Those who aren't involved in your investigation avoid impeding you or pass along your requests. Additionally, local law enforcement has firm opinions about you, viewing you as either a nuisance or one of their own.

description | Path to Mystery | Your first case influenced the types of mysteries you're interested in. Why was this case so impactful, personal, or traumatic? Whom did it affect besides you? Why and how did you get involved? Was it solved? How did it set you on the path to investigating other mysteries? Roll on or choose details from the First Case table to develop the mystery that started your career as an investigator.
text | First Case
text | d8｜Case
text | 1｜A friend was wrongfully accused of murder. You tracked down the actual killer, proving your friend's innocence and starting your career as a detective.
text | 2｜You're told you went missing for weeks. When you were found, you had no memory of being gone. Now you search to discover what happened to you.
text | 3｜You helped a spirit find peace by finding its missing corpse. Ever since, other spectral clients have sought you out to help them find rest.
text | 4｜You revealed that the monsters terrorizing your home were illusions created by a cruel mage. The magic-user escaped, but you've continued to uncover magical hoaxes.
text | 5｜You were wrongfully accused and convicted of a crime. You managed to escape and seek to help others avoid the experience you suffered, even while still being pursued by the law.

text | 6｜You survived the destructive use of a magic device that wiped out your home. Members of a secret organization found you. You now work with them, tracking down dangerous supernatural phenomena and preventing them from doing harm.
text | 7｜You found evidence of a conspiracy underpinning society. You tried to expose this mysterious cabal, but no one believed you. You're still trying to prove what you know is true.
text | 8｜You got a job with an agency that investigates crimes that local law enforcement can't solve. You often wonder which you value more, the truth or your pay.

text | 8｜A great evil dwells within me. I will fight against it and the world's other evils for as long as I can.
text | 9｜I'm desperately seeking a cure to an affliction or a curse, either for someone close to me for myself.
text | 10｜Spirits are drawn to me. I do all I can to help them find peace.
text | 11｜I use my cunning mind to solve mysteries and find justice for those who've been wronged.
text | 12｜I lost someone I care about, but I still see them in guilty visions, recurring dreams, or as a spirit.
text | Horror Character Flaws
text | d12｜Flaw
text | 1｜I believe doom follows me and that anyone who gets close to me will face a tragic end.
text | 2｜I'm convinced something is after me, appearing in mirrors, dreams, and places where no one could.
text | 3｜I'm especially superstitious and live life seeking to avoid bad luck, wicked spirits, or the Mists.
text | 4｜I've done unspeakable evil and will do anything to prevent others from finding out.
text | 5｜I am exceptionally credulous and believe any story or legend immediately.
text | 6｜I'm a skeptic and don't believe in the power of rituals, religion, superstition, or spirits.
text | 7｜I know my future is written and that anything I do will lead to a prophesied end.
text | 8｜I need to find the best in everyone and everything, even when that means denying obvious malice.
text | 9｜I've seen the evil of a type of place—like forests, cities, or graveyards—and resist going there.
text | 10｜I'm exceptionally cautious, planning laboriously and devising countless contingencies.
text | 11｜I have a reputation for defeating a great evil, but that's a lie and the wicked force knows.
text | 12｜I know the ends always justify the means and am quick to make sacrifices to attain my goals.

title: Izzet Engineer
contents: bullet | Skill Proficiencies: Arcana, Investigation
bullet | Tool Proficiencies: One type of artisan's tools
bullet | Languages: Choose one of Draconic, Goblin, or Vedalken

bullet | Equipment: An Izzet insignia, one set of artisan's tools, the charred and twisted remains of a failed experiment, a hammer, a block and tackle, a set of common clothes, and a belt pouch containing 5 gp (Azorius 1-zino coins)

description | Feature: Urban Infrastructure | The popular conception of the Izzet League is based on mad inventions, dangerous experiments, and explosive blasts. Much of that perception is accurate, but the league is also involved with mundane tasks of construction and architecture—primarily in crafting the infrastructure that allows Ravnicans to enjoy running water, levitating platforms, and other magical and technological wonders.

text | You have a basic knowledge of the structure of buildings, including the stuff behind the walls. You can also find blueprints of a specific building in order to learn the details of its construction. Such blueprints might provide knowledge of entry points, structural weaknesses, or secret spaces. Your access to such information isn't unlimited. If obtaining or using the information gets you in trouble with the law, the guild can't shield you from the repercussions.
description | Izzet Guild Spells | Prerequisite: Spellcasting or Pact Magic class feature

text | For you, the spells on the Izzet Guild Spells table are added to the spell list of your spellcasting class. (If you are a multiclass character with multiple spell lists, these spells are added to all of them.)
text | Izzet Guild Spells
text | Spell Level｜Spells
text | Cantrip｜produce flame, shocking grasp
text | 1st｜chaos bolt, create or destroy water, unseen servant
text | 2nd｜heat metal, rope trick
text | 3rd｜call lightning, elemental weapon, glyph of warding
text | 4th｜conjure minor elementals, divination, Otiluke's resilient sphere
text | 5th｜animate objects, conjure elemental

text | Your spells tend to be loud, flashy, or explosive, even when the effect is unremarkable. For example, when you open the portal of a rope trick spell, the portal might be outlined by harmless, showy sparkles.

text | If you use an arcane focus, it probably takes the form of an intricate device that could include metal gauntlets, glass canisters, copper tubing, and leather straps attaching it to your body. The mizzium apparatus described in chapter 5 is a magical version of this gear.
text | The chaos bolt spell is a favorite of Izzet spellcasters because of its unpredictable nature.

description | Suggested Characteristics | Members of the Izzet League embody some combination of chaotic, frenetic energy with intellectual curiosity, in varying proportions. Some are committed to academic pursuits, and others just like explosions.
text | Personality Traits
text | d8｜Personality Trait
text | 1｜I have a hard time staying focused on... oh, and my brain tends to jump from one... did I mention focus?
text | 2｜I get really excited about my ideas and I can't wait to talk about them and start putting them into practice and tinkering with them and I want to tell you about how exciting it all is!
text | 3｜It's not magic—or anything, really—if you do it only halfway. Whatever I do, I give it all I've got.
text | 4｜I do what my gut tells me.
text | 5｜Life's an experiment, and I can't wait to see what happens.
text | 6｜I pepper my speech with the incomprehensible jargon of my trade, like mizzium droplets inserted into a weird-field suspension.
text | 7｜Great ideas are fine, but great results are what counts.
text | 8｜If you can guess what I'm about to do, that means I've run out of imagination.
text | Ideals
text | d6｜Ideal
text | 1｜Guild. My guild is all that really matters. (Any)
text | 2｜Creativity. Half the world's troubles come from stodgy thinking, stuck in the past. We need innovative solutions. (Chaotic)
text | 3｜Discovery. Every experiment has the potential to reveal more secrets of the multiverse. (Any)
text | 4｜Science. A rigorous application of logical principles and protocols will lead us toward progress more surely than any belief system. (Lawful)
text | 5｜Fun. I love my job! Despite the dangerous working conditions, there's nothing I'd rather do. (Chaotic)
text | 6｜Power. Someday I'll find or create the magic that will make me the most powerful being in Ravnica. (Evil)
text | Bonds
text | d6｜Bond
text | 1｜I have dedicated my life to finding a solution to a scientific problem.
text | 2｜I'll never forget the laboratory where I learned my skills, or the other attendants who learned alongside me.
text | 3｜I'm convinced it was sabotage that destroyed my first laboratory and killed many of my friends, and I seek revenge against whoever did it.
text | 4｜I have the schematics for an invention that I hope to build one day, once I have the necessary resources.
text | 5｜A fellow student and I are racing to solve the same scientific puzzle.
text | 6｜I would do anything the guildmaster told me to do.
text | Flaws
text | d6｜Flaw
text | 1｜If there's a plan, I'll probably forget it. If I don't forget it, I'll probably ignore it.
text | 2｜I get bored easily, and if nothing is happening I'll make something happen.
text | 3｜Nothing is ever simple, and if it seems simple, I'll find a way to make it complicated.
text | 4｜I tend to ignore sleep for days when I'm conducting research, often at the expense of my own health and safety.
text | 5｜I'm convinced there's not a soul in Ravnica, except maybe the great Niv-Mizzet, who can match my boundless intellect.
text | 6｜I'm incapable of admitting a flaw in my logic.

description | Contacts | The laboratories of the Izzet League are constantly starting up new projects and dissolving old ones, so it's easy for even the lowliest attendant to make friends (and enemies) in laboratories across Ravnica.
text | Roll twice on the Izzet Contacts table (for an ally and a rival) and once on the Non-Izzet Contacts table.
text | Izzet Contacts
text | d8｜Contact
text | 1｜An older relative is a member of the guild's board of directors.
text | 2｜I know a sprite who carries important messages among the guild's laboratories.
text | 3｜A sibling is the head of a laboratory doing exotic research.
text | 4｜A former colleague is now an attendant in a laboratory in the central guildhall.
text | 5｜I'm in regular communication with an instructor who set me on the course of my life and research.
text | 6｜I had a romance with a chemister working in the Blistercoils.
text | 7｜As an attendant, I had a fierce rivalry with another attendant for our supervisor's attention.
text | 8｜The guildmaster, Niv-Mizzet, took note of one of my experiments!
text | Non-Izzet Contacts
text | d10｜Contact
text | 1｜An Azorius inspector seems interested in my work.
text | 2｜I was ready to join the Boros before I decided on Izzet, and I sometimes still hear from the sergeant who tried to recruit me.
text | 3｜One of my former assistants turned out to be a Dimir spy. We're not on friendly terms anymore, but we have a habit of running into each other.
text | 4｜A Golgari assassin killed a bitter rival of mine, leaving me with conflicted feelings.
text | 5｜I helped a minor Gruul chieftain acquire an Izzet weapon.
text | 6｜Roll an additional Izzet contact; you can decide if the contact is an ally or a rival.
text | 7｜An Orzhov banker financed my laboratory's current work and expects great returns.
text | 8｜I have a cousin in the Cult of Rakdos, and we get along quite well.
text | 9｜A former attendant from the same laboratory ran off to join the Selesnya, and we get into a big argument every time we run into each other.
text | 10｜I compare notes and techniques with a Simic scientist over lunch sometimes.

description | How Do I Fit In? | Whatever your role in the Izzet League, you are expected to contribute to its research in some way. That contribution might involve participating in tests, whether as an assistant, a researcher, or a subject. You might be one of the soldiers who protects a laboratory, or a laborer responsible for lifting heavy pieces of equipment into place. Everyone's contribution matters, even if the Izzet know that some matter more than others.

title: Knight of Solamnia
contents: bullet | Skill Proficiencies: Athletics, Survival
bullet | Languages: Two of your choice
bullet | Equipment: An insignia of rank, a deck of cards, a set of common clothes, and a pouch containing 10 gp
description | Feature: Squire of Solamnia | You gain the Squire of Solamnia feat.
text | In addition, the Knights of Solamnia provide you free, modest lodging and food at any of their fortresses or encampments.

description | Building a Knight of Solamnia Character | Any class that has martial prowess can be a good fit in the Knights of Solamnia. Fighters and paladins make up the bulk of the knighthood's forces. Clerics (often with the War domain) can also be found among the knights' ranks.

text | For a more unusual take on a Knight of Solamnia character, consider playing a bard of the College of Valor (or the College of Swords from Xanathar's Guide to Everything) or a barbarian devoted to the ideals of the nature god Habbakuk (perhaps adopting the Path of the Zealot from Xanathar's Guide to Everything).

description | Knight of Solamnia Trinkets | When you make your character, roll once on the Knight of Solamnia Trinkets table instead of on the Trinkets table in the Player's Handbook for your starting trinket.
text | Knight of Solamnia Trinkets
text | d6｜Trinket
text | 1｜A flat silver disk you record your heroics upon
text | 2｜A piece of a fallen knight's armor
text | 3｜A pendant featuring a crown, a rose, or a sword
text | 4｜The pommel of your mentor's sword
text | 5｜A meaningful favor from someone you defended—perhaps a handkerchief or glove
text | 6｜A locket with a sketch of a silver dragon inside

title: Knight of the Order
contents: bullet | Skill Proficiencies: Persuasion, plus one from among Arcana, History, Nature, and Religion, as appropriate for your order
bullet | Tool Proficiencies: Your choice of a gaming set or a musical instrument
bullet | Languages: Any one of your choice
bullet | Equipment: One set of traveler's clothes, a signet, banner, or seal representing your place or rank in the order, and a pouch containing 10 gp

description | Feature: Knightly Regard | You receive shelter and succor from members of your knightly order and those who are sympathetic to its aims. If your order is a religious one, you can gain aid from temples and other religious communities of your deity. Knights of civic orders can get help from the community—whether a lone settlement or a great nation—that they serve, and knights of philosophical orders can find help from those they have aided in pursuit of their ideals, and those who share their ideals.

text | This help comes in the form of shelter and meals, and healing when appropriate, as well as occasionally risky assistance, such as a band of local citizens rallying to aid a sorely pressed knight, or those who support the order helping to smuggle a knight out of town when he or she is being hunted unjustly.

description | Suggested Characteristics | Use the tables for the soldier background in the Player's Handbook as the basis for your traits and motivations, modifying the entries when appropriate to suit your identity as a knight of your order.

text | Your bond almost always involves the order to which you belong (or at least key members of it), and it is highly unusual for a knight's ideal not to reflect the agenda, sentiment, or philosophy of one's order.

title: Lorehold Student
contents: bullet | Skill Proficiencies: History, Religion
bullet | Languages: Two of your choice
bullet | Equipment: A bottle of black ink, an ink pen, a hammer, a hooded lantern, a tinderbox, a tome of history, a school uniform, and a pouch containing 15 gp
description | Feature: Lorehold Initiate | You gain the Strixhaven Initiate feat and must choose Lorehold within it.

text | In addition, if you have the Spellcasting or Pact Magic feature, the spells on the Lorehold Spells table are added to the spell list of your spellcasting class. (If you are a multiclass character with multiple spell lists, these spells are added to all of them.)
text | Lorehold Spells
text | Spell Level｜Spells
text | 1st｜Comprehend Languages, Identify
text | 2nd｜Borrowed Knowledge, Locate Object
text | 3rd｜Speak with Dead, Spirit Guardians
text | 4th｜Arcane Eye, Stone Shape
text | 5th｜Flame Strike, Legend Lore

text | Consider customizing how your spells look when you cast them. Your Lorehold spells might create displays of golden light. You might use a tome or a scroll as a spellcasting focus, and your spell effects might reflect the appearance of the reference books you study.

description | Building a Lorehold Character | Any class or subclass that deals with knowledge of the past can be a good fit in Lorehold. Bards thrive in Lorehold, and wizards (particularly those of the School of Divination) are numerous among its students. Clerics (often with the Knowledge or Light domains) are also quite common.

text | For a more unusual take on a Lorehold student, you could consider playing a barbarian with a primal connection to the past (perhaps adopting the Path of the Ancestral Guardian from Xanathar's Guide to Everything) or a paladin whose Oath of the Ancients gives a concrete link to history.

description | Suggested Characteristics | Methodical historians and daring adventurers alike can be found among the ranks of Lorehold college. The Lorehold Personality Traits table suggests a variety of traits you might adopt for your character.
text | Lorehold Personality Traits
text | d6｜Personality Trait
text | 1｜I thrive on esoteric lore. The more obscure the historical references I can include in everyday conversation, the better.
text | 2｜By searching for these lost artifacts, I hope to find who I really am along the way.
text | 3｜I can barely go a minute without talking about my research. I have so much knowledge in my head, and it needs to be let out somewhere!
text | 4｜The spirits of the dead are so much more interesting to talk with than living classmates.
text | 5｜I can speak eloquently about the historical ramifications of an ancient war. But ask me to add two-digit numbers together, and I'm a mess.
text | 6｜In the end, it's all just entropy. Everything falls apart someday.
description | Lorehold Trinkets | When you make your character, you may roll once on the Lorehold Trinkets table, instead of on the Trinkets table in the Player's Handbook, for your starting trinket.

title: Luxonborn (Acolyte)
contents: bullet | Skill Proficiencies: Insight, Religion
bullet | Languages: Two of your choice

bullet | Equipment: A holy symbol (a gift to you when you entered the priesthood), a prayer book or prayer wheel, 5 sticks of incense, vestments, a set of common clothes, and a belt pouch containing 15 gp

description | Feature: Shelter of the Faithful | As an acolyte, you command the respect of those who share your faith, and you can perform the religious ceremonies of your deity. You and your adventuring companions can expect to receive free healing and care at a temple, shrine, or other established presence of your faith, though you must provide any material components needed for spells. Those who share your religion will support you (but only you) at a modest lifestyle.

text | You might also have ties to a specific temple dedicated to your chosen deity or pantheon, and you have a residence there. This could be the temple where you used to serve, if you remain on good terms with it, or a temple where you have found a new home. While near your temple, you can call upon the priests for assistance, provided the assistance you ask for is not hazardous and you remain in good standing with your temple.

description | Suggested Characteristics | Acolytes are shaped by their experience in temples or other religious communities. Their study of the history and tenets of their faith and their relationships to temples, shrines, or hierarchies affect their mannerisms and ideals. Their flaws might be some hidden hypocrisy or heretical idea, or an ideal or bond taken to an extreme.
text | d8｜Personality Trait
text | 1｜I idolize a particular hero of my faith, and constantly refer to that person's deeds and example.
text | 2｜I can find common ground between the fiercest enemies, empathizing with them and always working toward peace.
text | 3｜I see omens in every event and action. The gods try to speak to us, we just need to listen.
text | 4｜Nothing can shake my optimistic attitude.
text | 5｜I quote (or misquote) sacred texts and proverbs in almost every situation.
text | 6｜I am tolerant (or intolerant) of other faiths and respect (or condemn) the worship of other gods.
text | 7｜I've enjoyed fine food, drink, and high society among my temple's elite. Rough living grates on me.
text | 8｜I've spent so long in the temple that I have little practical experience dealing with people in the outside world.
text | d6｜Ideal
text | 1｜Tradition. The ancient traditions of worship and sacrifice must be preserved and upheld. (Lawful)
text | 2｜Charity. I always try to help those in need, no matter what the personal cost. (Good)
text | 3｜Change. We must help bring about the changes the gods are constantly working in the world. (Chaotic)
text | 4｜Power. I hope to one day rise to the top of my faith's religious hierarchy. (Lawful)
text | 5｜Faith. I trust that my deity will guide my actions. I have faith that if I work hard, things will go well. (Lawful)
text | 6｜Aspiration. I seek to prove myself worthy of my god's favor by matching my actions against his or her teachings. (Any)
text | d6｜Bond
text | 1｜I would die to recover an ancient relic of my faith that was lost long ago.
text | 2｜I will someday get revenge on the corrupt temple hierarchy who branded me a heretic.
text | 3｜I owe my life to the priest who took me in when my parents died.
text | 4｜Everything I do is for the common people.
text | 5｜I will do anything to protect the temple where I served.
text | 6｜I seek to preserve a sacred text that my enemies consider heretical and seek to destroy.
text | d6｜Flaw
text | 1｜I judge others harshly, and myself even more severely.
text | 2｜I put too much trust in those who wield power within my temple's hierarchy.
text | 3｜My piety sometimes leads me to blindly trust those that profess faith in my god.
text | 4｜I am inflexible in my thinking.
text | 5｜I am suspicious of strangers and expect the worst of them.
text | 6｜Once I pick a goal, I become obsessed with it to the detriment of everything else in my life.

title: Mage of High Sorcery
contents: bullet | Skill Proficiencies: Arcana, History
bullet | Languages: Two of your choice
bullet | Equipment: A bottle of colored ink, an ink pen, a set of common clothes, and a pouch containing 10 gp
description | Feature: Initiate of High Sorcery | You gain the Initiate of High Sorcery feat.

text | In addition, the Mages of High Sorcery provide you with free, modest lodging and food indefinitely at any occupied Tower of High Sorcery and for one night at the home of an organization member.

description | Building a Mage of High Sorcery Character | Mages of High Sorcery are typically sorcerers, warlocks, or wizards and might have any subclass. Spellcasters who gain their magic through devotion are less likely to be welcomed among the traditionalist mages. Nevertheless, the Mages of High Sorcery are shrewd, and they rarely let unique opportunities or individuals pass them by. Even members of martial classes who train in magic might find a rare place among the group's three orders.

description | Mage of High Sorcery Trinkets | When you make your character, roll once on the Mage of High Sorcery Trinkets table instead of on the Trinkets table in the Player's Handbook for your starting trinket.
text | Mage of High Sorcery Trinkets
text | d6｜Trinket
text | 1｜An unopened letter from your first teacher
text | 2｜A broken wand made of black, red, or white wood
text | 3｜A scroll bearing an incomprehensible formula
text | 4｜A purposeless device covered in colored stones that can fold into various enigmatic shapes
text | 5｜A pouch or spellbook emblazoned with the triple moon symbol of the Mages of High Sorcery
text | 6｜A lens through which you can see Krynn's invisible black moon, Nuitari

title: Marine
contents: bullet | Skill Proficiencies: Athletics, Survival
bullet | Tool Proficiencies: Vehicles (water, land)
bullet | Equipment: A dagger that belonged to a fallen comrade, a folded flag emblazoned with the symbol of your ship or company, a set of traveler's clothes, and a belt pouch containing 10 gp

description | Feature: Steady | You can move twice the normal amount of time (up to 16 hours) each day before being subject to the effect of a forced march (see "Travel Pace" in chapter 8 of the Player's Handbook). Additionally, you can automatically find a safe route to land a boat on shore, provided such a route exists.

description | Hardship Endured | Hardship in your past has forged you into an unstoppable living weapon. This hardship is essential to you and is at the heart of a personal philosophy or ethos that often guides your actions. You can roll on the following table to determine this hardship or choose one that best fits your character.
text | d6｜Hardship
text | 1｜Nearly Drowned. You hid underwater to avoid detection by enemies and held your breath for an extremely long time. Just before you would have died, you had a revelation about your existence.
text | 2｜Captured. You spent months enduring thirst, starvation, and torture at the hands of your enemy, but you never broke.
text | 3｜Sacrifice. You enabled the escape of your fellow soldiers, but at great cost to yourself. Some of your past comrades may think you're dead.

text | 4｜Juggernaut. No reasonable explanation can explain how you survived a particular battle. Every arrow and bolt missed you. You slew scores of enemies single-handedly and led your comrades to victory.
text | 5｜Stowaway. For days, you hid in the bilge of an enemy ship, surviving on brackish water and foolhardy rats. At the right moment, you crept up to the deck and took over the ship on your own.
text | 6｜Leave None Behind. You carried an injured marine for miles to avoid capture and death.

description | Suggested Characteristics | Marines are looked up to by other soldiers and respected by their superiors. They are veteran warriors who rarely lose composure on the battlefield. Marines who leave the service tend to work as mercenaries, but their combat experience also makes them excellent adventurers. Though they are self-reliant, marines tend to operate best in groups, valuing camaraderie and the companionship of like-minded individuals.
text | Marine Personality Traits
text | d8｜Personality Trait
text | 1｜I speak rarely but mean every word I say.
text | 2｜I laugh loudly and see the humor in stressful situations.
text | 3｜I prefer to solve problems without violence, but I finish fights decisively.
text | 4｜I enjoy being out in nature; poor weather never sours my mood.
text | 5｜I am dependable.
text | 6｜I am always working on some project or other.
text | 7｜I become cantankerous and quiet in the rain.
text | 8｜When the sea is within my sight, my mood is jovial and optimistic.
text | Marine Ideals
text | d6｜Ideal
text | 1｜Teamwork. Success depends on cooperation and communication. (Good)
text | 2｜Code. The marines' code provides a solution for every problem, and following it is imperative. (Lawful)
text | 3｜Embracing. Life is messy. Throwing yourself into the worst of it is necessary to get the job done. (Chaotic)
text | 4｜Might. The strong train so that they might rule those who are weak. (Evil)
text | 5｜Bravery. To act when others quake in fear—this is the essence of the warrior. (Any)
text | 6｜Perseverance. No injury or obstacle can turn me from my goal. (Any)
text | Marine Bonds
text | d6｜Bond
text | 1｜I face danger and evil to offset an unredeemable act in my past.
text | 2｜I. Will. Finish. The. Job.
text | 3｜I must set an example of hope for those who have given up.
text | 4｜I'm searching for a fellow marine captured by an elusive enemy.
text | 5｜Fear leads to tyranny, and both must be eradicated.
text | 6｜My commander betrayed my unit, and I will have revenge.
text | Marine Flaws
text | d6｜Flaw
text | 1｜I grow combative and unpredictable when I drink.
text | 2｜I find civilian life difficult and struggle to say the right thing in social situations.
text | 3｜My intensity can drive others away.
text | 4｜I hold grudges and have difficulty forgiving others.
text | 5｜I become irrational when innocent people are hurt.
text | 6｜I sometimes stay up all night listening to the ghosts of my fallen enemies.

title: Mercenary Veteran
contents: bullet | Skill Proficiencies: Athletics, Persuasion
bullet | Tool Proficiencies: One type of gaming set, vehicles (land)
bullet | Equipment: A uniform of your company (traveler's clothes in quality), an insignia of your rank, a gaming set of your choice, and a pouch containing the remainder of your last wages (10 gp).

description | Feature: Mercenary Life | You know the mercenary life as only someone who has experienced it can. You are able to identify mercenary companies by their emblems, and you know a little about any such company, including who has hired them recently. You can find the taverns and festhalls where mercenaries abide in any area, as long as you speak the language. You can find mercenary work between adventures sufficient to maintain a comfortable lifestyle (see "Practicing a Profession" under "Downtime Activities" in chapter 8 of the Player's Handbook).

description | Suggested Characteristics | Use the tables for the soldier background in the Player's Handbook as the basis for your traits and motivations, modifying the entries when appropriate to suit your identity as a mercenary.

text | Your bond could be associated with the company you traveled with previously, or with some of the comrades you served with. The ideal you embrace largely depends on your worldview and your motivation for fighting.

contents: bullet | Skill Proficiencies: Deception, Stealth
