bullet | Equipment: A crowbar, a set of dark common clothes including a hood, and a belt pouch containing 15 gp

description | Feature: Criminal Contact | You have a reliable and trustworthy contact who acts as your liaison to a network of other criminals. You know how to get messages to and from your contact, even over great distances; specifically, you know the local messengers, corrupt caravan masters, and seedy sailors who can deliver messages for you.

description | Specialty | There are many kinds of criminals, and within a thieves' guild or similar criminal organization, individual members have particular specialties. Even criminals who operate outside of such organizations have strong preferences for certain kinds of crimes over others. Choose the role you played in your criminal life, or roll on the table below.
text | d8｜Specialty
text | 1｜Blackmailer
text | 2｜Burglar
text | 3｜Enforcer
text | 4｜Fence
text | 5｜Highway robber
text | 6｜Hired killer
text | 7｜Pickpocket
text | 8｜Smuggler

description | Suggested Characteristics | Criminals might seem like villains on the surface, and many of them are villainous to the core. But some have an abundance of endearing, if not redeeming, characteristics. There might be honor among thieves, but criminals rarely show any respect for law or authority.
text | d8｜Personality Trait
text | 1｜I always have a plan for when things go wrong.
text | 2｜I am always calm, no matter what the situation. I never raise my voice or let my emotions control me.
text | 3｜The first thing I do in a new place is note the locations of everything valuable—or where such things could be hidden.
text | 4｜I would rather make a new friend than a new enemy.
text | 5｜I am incredibly slow to trust. Those who seem the fairest often have the most to hide.
text | 6｜I don't pay attention to the risks in a situation. Never tell me the odds.
text | 7｜The best way to get me to do something is to tell me I can't do it.
text | 8｜I blow up at the slightest insult.
text | d6｜Ideal
text | 1｜Honor. I don't steal from others in the trade. (Lawful)
text | 2｜Freedom. Chains are meant to be broken, as are those who would forge them. (Chaotic)
text | 3｜Charity. I steal from the wealthy so that I can help people in need. (Good)
text | 4｜Greed. I will do whatever it takes to become wealthy. (Evil)
text | 5｜People. I'm loyal to my friends, not to any ideals, and everyone else can take a trip down the Styx for all I care. (Neutral)
text | 6｜Redemption. There's a spark of good in everyone. (Good)
text | d6｜Bond
text | 1｜I'm trying to pay off an old debt I owe to a generous benefactor.
text | 2｜My ill-gotten gains go to support my family.
text | 3｜Something important was taken from me, and I aim to steal it back.
text | 4｜I will become the greatest thief that ever lived.
text | 5｜I'm guilty of a terrible crime. I hope I can redeem myself for it.
text | 6｜Someone I loved died because of a mistake I made. That will never happen again.
text | d6｜Flaw
text | 1｜When I see something valuable, I can't think about anything but how to steal it.
text | 2｜When faced with a choice between money and my friends, I usually choose the money.
text | 3｜If there's a plan, I'll forget it. If I don't forget it, I'll ignore it.
text | 4｜I have a 'tell' that reveals when I'm lying.
text | 5｜I turn tail and run when things look bad.
text | 6｜An innocent person is in prison for a crime that I committed. I'm okay with that.

title: Orzhov Representative
contents: bullet | Skill Proficiencies: Intimidation, Religion
bullet | Languages: Two of your choice
bullet | Equipment: An Orzhov insignia, a foot-long chain made of ten gold coins, vestments, a set of fine clothes, and a belt pouch containing 1 pp (an Orzhov-minted 10-zino coin)

description | Feature: Leverage | You can exert leverage over one or more individuals below you in the guild's hierarchy and demand their help as needs warrant. For example, you can have a message carried across a neighborhood, procure a short carriage ride without paying, or have others clean up a bloody mess you left in an alley. The DM decides if your demands are reasonable and if there are subordinates available to fulfill them. As your status in the guild improves, you gain influence over more people, including ones in greater positions of power.
description | Orzhov Guild Spells | Prerequisite: Spellcasting or Pact Magic class feature

text | For you, the spells on the Orzhov Guild Spells table are added to the spell list of your spellcasting class. (If you are a multiclass character with multiple spell lists, these spells are added to all of them.)
text | Orzhov Guild Spells
text | Spell Level｜Spells
text | Cantrip｜friends, guidance
text | 1st｜command, illusory script
text | 2nd｜enthrall, ray of enfeeblement, zone of truth
text | 3rd｜bestow curse, speak with dead, spirit guardians
text | 4th｜blight, death ward, Leomund's secret chest
text | 5th｜geas

text | Your magic tends to manifest as swirling shadows, brilliant light, or sometimes the momentary appearance of shadowy spirit forms. Your spells might draw the blood of your enemies, or even directly touch their souls.

description | Suggested Characteristics | Members of the Orzhov Syndicate range from the decadent nobility at the top of the oligarchy to the debt-ridden wretches at the bottom. You fall somewhere between those extremes, so you might behave with the arrogance of the very rich or the humility of the impoverished.
text | Personality Traits
text | d8｜Personality Trait
text | 1｜I am always willing to act in accordance with the financial incentive offered.
text | 2｜Debts are never meant to be forgiven.
text | 3｜I am accustomed to enjoying the finest pleasures money can buy.
text | 4｜No one could doubt that I am a cut above the masses of pitiful peasants that infest the city.
text | 5｜I can't stand to spend a zib more than necessary to purchase what I need.
text | 6｜I hate it when people try to make light of a serious situation.
text | 7｜I want to make sure everyone is aware of how wealthy, powerful, and important I am.
text | 8｜I can't think of anything to look forward to.
text | Ideals
text | d6｜Ideal
text | 1｜Guild. My guild is all that really matters. (Any)
text | 2｜Wealth. I will do whatever it takes to become as rich as the oligarchs. (Evil)
text | 3｜Power. One day, I will be the one giving orders. (Evil)
text | 4｜Prestige. I want to be admired, respected, feared, or even hated for my position and wealth. (Evil)
text | 5｜Stability. The economy functions best when chaos is kept under control and everyone knows their place. (Lawful)
text | 6｜Eternity. I want to live forever—in the flesh as long as possible, and as a spirit afterward. (Any)
text | Bonds
text | d6｜Bond
text | 1｜The unbearable weight of my debt has driven me to desperation.
text | 2｜I'm duty-bound to obey the dictates of an ancestor on the Ghost Council.
text | 3｜I value my worldly goods more highly than my mortal life.
text | 4｜An oligarch publicly humiliated me, and I will exact revenge on that whole family.
text | 5｜My faith in the Obzedat never wavers.
text | 6｜I want to prove myself more worthy than an older sibling and thereby ensure that I inherit a greater share of my parents' wealth.
text | Flaws
text | d6｜Flaw
text | 1｜I hold a scandalous secret that could ruin my family forever—but could also earn me the favor of the Ghost Council.
text | 2｜I'm convinced that everyone I know is plotting against me.
text | 3｜I'll brave any risk if the monetary reward is great enough.
text | 4｜I am convinced that I am far more important than anyone else is willing to acknowledge.
text | 5｜I have little respect for anyone who isn't wealthy.
text | 6｜I'll take any opportunity to steal from wealthier people, even for worthless trinkets.

description | Contacts | The Orzhov Syndicate operates according to a strict hierarchy built on a network of connections among old, wealthy families. Your family might provide important contacts, while your family's activities in crime, banking, or debt collection could tie you to members of other guilds.
text | Roll twice on the Orzhov Contacts table (for an ally and a rival) and once on the Non-Orzhov Contacts table.
text | Orzhov Contacts
text | d8｜Contact
text | 1｜The spirit of an ancestor has taken an interest in me.
text | 2｜An older cousin has the ear of a powerful oligarch.
text | 3｜I know a knight who is responsible for collecting debts from powerful people.
text | 4｜A vampire pontiff tried to use me as a pawn in past schemes.
text | 5｜A silent spirit follows me around.
text | 6｜A sibling has keys to parts of Vizkopa Bank.
text | 7｜A giant thinks I'm adorable.
text | 8｜I regularly offer tribute to an angel, and the angel has been kind to me in turn.
text | Non-Orzhov Contacts
text | d10｜Contact
text | 1｜An Azorius arrester is always snooping into my family's business transactions.
text | 2｜A Boros paladin saved my life, to my everlasting shame.
text | 3｜I know a shopkeeper who is secretly a Dimir agent and tries to make sure that I keep that secret hidden.
text | 4｜I'm fascinated by the culture of the Golgari kraul, and I have formed a friendship with one of their death priests.
text | 5｜A Gruul druid hates me but would never dare to touch me.
text | 6｜I know an Izzet engineer who is desperate to pay off a debt accrued by a deceased relative.
text | 7｜Roll an additional Orzhov contact; you can decide if the contact is an ally or a rival.
text | 8｜My childhood friend is now a Rakdos torturer. We still meet for drinks occasionally.
text | 9｜I have the key to a vault where a Selesnya druid is hiding an item of secret shame.
text | 10｜I was married to a Simic bioengineer.

description | How Do I Fit In? | The structure of the Orzhov Syndicate means that you are always doing the bidding of someone higher up the ladder than you are. Ultimately, your role in the guild is defined by whatever the people (and spirits) above you decide for you.

text | For most of your career, you can expect to engage in some aspect of the day-to-day criminal operations of the guild. That can mean throwing your weight around to enforce the will of the guild or using religious authority to extort offerings from the people. But it can also mean doing various errands for your superiors, from bearing messages to carrying out assassinations.

title: Outlander
contents: bullet | Skill Proficiencies: Athletics, Survival
bullet | Tool Proficiencies: One type of musical instrument
bullet | Languages: One of your choice
bullet | Equipment: A staff, a hunting trap, a trophy from an animal you killed, a set of traveler's clothes, and a belt pouch containing 10 gp

description | Feature: Wanderer | You have an excellent memory for maps and geography, and you can always recall the general layout of terrain, settlements, and other features around you. In addition, you can find food and fresh water for yourself and up to five other people each day, provided that the land offers berries, small game, water, and so forth.

description | Specialty | You've been to strange places and seen things that others cannot begin to fathom. Consider some of the distant lands you have visited, and how they impacted you. You can roll on the following table to determine your occupation during your time in the wild, or choose one that best fits your character.
text | d10｜Origin
text | 1｜Forester
text | 2｜Trapper
text | 3｜Homesteader
text | 4｜Guide
text | 5｜Exile or outcast
text | 6｜Bounty hunter
text | 7｜Pilgrim
text | 8｜Tribal nomad
text | 9｜Hunter-gatherer
text | 10｜Tribal marauder

description | Suggested Characteristics | Often considered rude and uncouth among civilized folk, outlanders have little respect for the niceties of life in the cities. The ties of tribe, clan, family, and the natural world of which they are a part are the most important bonds to most outlanders.
text | d8｜Personality Trait
text | 1｜I'm driven by a wanderlust that led me away from home.
text | 2｜I watch over my friends as if they were a litter of newborn pups.
text | 3｜I once ran twenty-five miles without stopping to warn to my clan of an approaching orc horde. I'd do it again if I had to.
text | 4｜I have a lesson for every situation, drawn from observing nature.
text | 5｜I place no stock in wealthy or well-mannered folk. Money and manners won't save you from a hungry owlbear.
text | 6｜I'm always picking things up, absently fiddling with them, and sometimes accidentally breaking them.
text | 7｜I feel far more comfortable around animals than people.
text | 8｜I was, in fact, raised by wolves.
text | d6｜Ideal
text | 1｜Change. Life is like the seasons, in constant change, and we must change with it. (Chaotic)
text | 2｜Greater Good. It is each person's responsibility to make the most happiness for the whole tribe. (Good)
text | 3｜Honor. If I dishonor myself, I dishonor my whole clan. (Lawful)
text | 4｜Might. The strongest are meant to rule. (Evil)
text | 5｜Nature. The natural world is more important than all the constructs of civilization. (Neutral)
text | 6｜Glory. I must earn glory in battle, for myself and my clan. (Any)
text | d6｜Bond
text | 1｜My family, clan, or tribe is the most important thing in my life, even when they are far from me.
text | 2｜An injury to the unspoiled wilderness of my home is an injury to me.
text | 3｜I will bring terrible wrath down on the evildoers who destroyed my homeland.
text | 4｜I am the last of my tribe, and it is up to me to ensure their names enter legend.
text | 5｜I suffer awful visions of a coming disaster and will do anything to prevent it.
text | 6｜It is my duty to provide children to sustain my tribe.
text | d6｜Flaw
text | 1｜I am too enamored of ale, wine, and other intoxicants.
text | 2｜There's no room for caution in a life lived to the fullest.
text | 3｜I remember every insult I've received and nurse a silent resentment toward anyone who's ever wronged me.
text | 4｜I am slow to trust members of other races, tribes, and societies.
text | 5｜Violence is my answer to almost any challenge.
text | 6｜Don't expect me to save those who can't save themselves. It is nature's way that the strong thrive and the weak perish.

title: Plaintiff
contents: bullet | Skill Proficiencies: Medicine, Persuasion
bullet | Tool Proficiencies: One type of artisan's tools
bullet | Languages: Any one of your choice
bullet | Equipment: One set of artisan's tools, fine clothes, 20 gp

description | Feature: Legalese | Your experience with your local legal system has given you a firm knowledge of the ins and outs of that system. Even when the law is not on your side, you can use complex terms like ex injuria jus non oritur and cogitationis poenam nemo patitur to frighten people into thinking you know what you're talking about. With common folks who don't know any better, you might be able to intimidate or deceive to get favors or special treatment.

description | Suggested Characteristics | Plaintiffs come in many varieties. Some are innocent bystanders who want only fair compensation for their injuries. Others are professional courtroom operatives, going to extreme lengths to appear wronged in pursuit of a large payout.
text | d8｜Personality Trait
text | 1｜I can't believe I have a chance to join Acquisitions Incorporated! The fun I'm going to have!
text | 2｜I've been wronged my entire life, and the world owes me.
text | 3｜I have always tried to make the best of a bad situation.
text | 4｜The law doesn't protect the honest and the hard working. I'm going to do whatever needs to be done to make things right.
text | 5｜I'm always in the wrong place at the wrong time.
text | 6｜My superiors are smarter and wiser than I am. I do what I'm told.
text | 7｜Never pass up the opportunity to make an easy bit of coin. That's my motto.
text | 8｜I'm beginning to feel like the gods are not on my side.
text | d6｜Ideal
text | 1｜Justice. Those who break the law need to answer for their crimes. (Lawful)
text | 2｜Freedom. People must have the freedom to do what they want and pursue their dreams. (Chaotic)
text | 3｜Greed. Everyone I see is getting theirs, so I'm surely going to get mine. (Evil)
text | 4｜Chaos. You're out of order! And you're out of order! This whole realm is out of order! (Chaotic)
text | 5｜Humility. I'm just a small part of a larger whole. So is everyone else. (Neutral)
text | 6｜Responsibility. We all have our roles to play. I'll hold up my end of the bargain. (Any)
text | d6｜Bond
text | 1｜Others hurt in the same accident that hurt me are my new family. I'll make sure they're taken care of.
text | 2｜The rulers of this place were kind to me, and they have my lifelong devotion.
text | 3｜My parents worry about me, but I'll make them proud.
text | 4｜The only bond that matters is the one holding my money pouch to my belt.
text | 5｜The other new hires at Acquisitions Incorporated are my allies. We have each other's backs.
text | 6｜My legal counsel is my best friend. I owe all my forthcoming opportunities to their hard work.
text | d6｜Flaw
text | 1｜The person who gains the most reward for the least effort wins.
text | 2｜Three magic beans for just one cow? What a deal!
text | 3｜I have only one vice, but it controls my life.
text | 4｜Sleep is for the weak. We need to keep training more if we're going to be ready for the challenges ahead.
text | 5｜Until my songs are sung in every tavern in this realm, I won't be satisfied.
text | 6｜If people find me unpleasant, that's their problem.

title: Planar Philosopher
contents: bullet | Skill Proficiencies: Arcana, the skill associated with your faction (see the Sigil Faction Affinities table) or one skill of your choice
bullet | Languages: Two of your choice

bullet | Equipment: A portal key (such as a bag of golden tea leaves or the tooth of a planar beast), a manifesto of your guiding philosophy, a set of common clothes in your faction's style, and a pouch containing 10 gp worth of coins from different worlds and planes
text | Sigil Faction Affinities
text | Faction｜Skill
text | Athar｜Religion
text | Bleak Cabal｜Insight
text | Doomguard｜Nature
text | Fated｜Intimidation
text | Fraternity of Order｜History
text | Hands of Havoc｜Stealth
text | Harmonium｜Perception
text | Heralds of Dust｜Medicine
text | Mercykillers｜Survival
text | Mind's Eye｜Persuasion
text | Society of Sensation｜Performance
text | Transcendent Order｜Athletics

description | Factions of Sigil | Twelve factions have risen to prominence in the City of Doors, though many more exist. Your character might belong to one of these groups or another ideological faction, perhaps one of your own creation.
text | The primary factions of Sigil, which are further detailed in chapter 2, adhere to the following philosophies:
bullet | Athar. Deities are frauds and merely channel the might of a true, higher power.
bullet | Bleak Cabal. There is no greater truth to the multiverse. Each being must discover their own meaning.
bullet | Doomguard. Nothing lasts forever. The purpose of everything is to crumble and decay.
bullet | Fated. Everyone makes their own fate and is entitled to whatever they can take and hold.
bullet | Fraternity of Order. All of existence is governed by laws, and power comes from understanding and exploiting them.
bullet | Hands of Havoc. Those who try to impose a single order on the multiverse are doomed to fail.
bullet | Harmonium. The multiverse will be perfect only when everything is acting in harmony, whether it wants to or not.
bullet | Heralds of Dust. Everyone is already dead; the entirety of the multiverse is an afterlife. Undeath holds the key to the next stage of existence.
bullet | Mercykillers. Cold, relentless justice is absolute, and no one is above it.
bullet | Mind's Eye. The multiverse exists to be explored. It shapes us, and we shape it in turn.
bullet | Society of Sensation. Sensation is the proof of existence. By experiencing everything, we can understand the multiverse in all its complexity.
bullet | Transcendent Order. Thought clouds action. To fall in step with the multiverse, one must act on instinct alone.

description | Feature: Conviction | You gain the Scion of the Outer Planes feat. In addition, members of your organization provide you free, modest lodging and food at any of their holdings or the homes of other faction members.

description | Suggested Characteristics | Adventurers who dedicate themselves to a particular philosophy regarding the multiverse are welcomed among factions that embrace those beliefs. The Planar Philosopher Personality Traits table suggests various traits you might adopt for your character.
text | d6｜Personality Trait
text | 1｜I don't venerate any gods. With time, we can be as powerful as them or greater.
text | 2｜Experience is everything; live in the moment.
text | 3｜When things crumble, I find meaning in the dust.
text | 4｜Life thrives through order, and I seek to maintain that order.
text | 5｜When others make plans, the multiverse laughs and so do I.
text | 6｜I know what's right, and none will stand in my way.

description | Building a Planar Philosopher Character | Some groups of planar philosophers might prefer certain types of characters, but by and large any character who upholds and furthers the beliefs of such a group is welcome within its ranks.

description | Planar Philosopher Trinkets | When you make your character, you can roll once on the Planar Philosopher Trinkets table, instead of on the Trinkets table in the Player's Handbook, for your starting trinket.

title: Prismari Student
contents: bullet | Skill Proficiencies: Acrobatics, Performance
bullet | Tool Proficiencies: One type of musical instrument or artisan's tools
bullet | Languages: One of your choice
bullet | Equipment: A bottle of black ink, an ink pen, a set of artisan's tools or a musical instrument (one of your choice), a school uniform, and a pouch containing 10 gp
description | Feature: Prismari Initiate | You gain the Strixhaven Initiate feat and must choose Prismari within it.

text | In addition, if you have the Spellcasting or Pact Magic feature, the spells on the Prismari Spells table are added to the spell list of your spellcasting class. (If you are a multiclass character with multiple spell lists, these spells are added to all of them.)
text | Prismari Spells
text | Spell Level｜Spells
text | 1st｜Chromatic Orb, Thunderwave
text | 2nd｜Flaming Sphere, Kinetic Jaunt
text | 3rd｜Haste, Water Walk
text | 4th｜Freedom of Movement, Wall of Fire
text | 5th｜Cone of Cold, Conjure Elemental

text | Consider customizing how your spells look when you cast them. You might wield your Prismari spells with dynamic, gestural movement—as much dance as somatic component. Even a blast of fire in your hands is a sculpted work of art; elemental forces make grand designs as you hurl spells. These forces might linger on your body or in your clothes as decorative elements after your spells are dissipated, as sparks dance in your hair and your touch leaves tracings of frost on whatever you touch.

description | Building a Prismari Character | Any class or subclass that wields elemental forces of cold, fire, lightning, and wind can be a good fit in Prismari. Druids and sorcerers are common in Prismari, and wizards who study the Schools of Evocation or Transmutation are also well represented. Clerics aren't very common in this school, but some with the Tempest domain end up here.

text | Beyond the ranks of traditional spellcasters, Prismari students also include monks who follow the Way of the Four Elements. Some acrobatic rogues and fighters (including those who emulate the archetype of the Eldritch Knight) also delight in the athleticism of Prismari performance.

description | Suggested Characteristics | Though the curriculum of Prismari College attracts many outgoing and driven artists, the school has no shortage of shy scholars and lackadaisical blowhards among its ranks. The Prismari Personality Traits table suggests a variety of traits you might adopt for your character.
text | Prismari Personality Traits
text | d6｜Personality Trait
text | 1｜I'm the life of the party, and I expect everyone's attention when I walk into a room.
text | 2｜Two weeks ago, I was enthralled with my latest project. Now, I think it's garbage and deserves to be destroyed.
text | 3｜I believe everyone has the ability to express their truest selves through art, and I'm happy to quietly push them in the right direction.
text | 4｜Everyone is a critic, and I work to win them all over.
text | 5｜I'm beset with such an overwhelming sense of ennui regarding my art. Nothing quite captures my attention anymore.
text | 6｜Instead of confronting my negative emotions, I channel them into explosive artistic displays.
description | Prismari Trinkets | When you make your character, you may roll once on the Prismari Trinkets table, instead of on the Trinkets table in the Player's Handbook, for your starting trinket.

title: Purple Dragon Squire
contents: bullet | Ability Scores: Strength, Wisdom, Charisma
bullet | Feat: Purple Dragon Rook
bullet | Skill Proficiencies: Animal Handling and Insight
bullet | Tool Proficiencies: Navigator's Tools
bullet | Equipment: Choose A or B: (A) Spear, Navigator's Tools, Fine Clothes, 9 GP; or (B) 50 GP

title: Quandrix Student
contents: bullet | Skill Proficiencies: Arcana, Nature
bullet | Tool Proficiencies: One type of artisan's tools
bullet | Languages: One of your choice
bullet | Equipment: A bottle of black ink, an ink pen, an abacus, a book of arcane theory, a school uniform, and a pouch containing 15 gp
description | Feature: Quandrix Initiate | You gain the Strixhaven Initiate feat and must choose Quandrix within it.

text | In addition, if you have the Spellcasting or Pact Magic feature, the spells on the Quandrix Spells table are added to the spell list of your spellcasting class. (If you are a multiclass character with multiple spell lists, these spells are added to all of them.)
text | Quandrix Spells
text | Spell Level｜Spells
text | 1st｜Entangle, Guiding Bolt
text | 2nd｜Enlarge/Reduce, Vortex Warp
text | 3rd｜Aura of Vitality, Haste
text | 4th｜Control Water, Freedom of Movement
text | 5th｜Circle of Power, Passwall

text | Consider customizing how your spells look when you cast them. Your Quandrix spells might manifest amid kaleidoscopic swirls of fractal patterns, amplifying the tiniest movements of your somatic components. When your magic creates or alters creatures, it might briefly surround the targets with shimmering fractal designs or tessellated patterns.

description | Building a Quandrix Character | Any spellcasting class or subclass can work well for a Quandrix character. Both the scholarly focus of wizards (especially those who study the Schools of Abjuration, Illusion, or Transmutation) and the metamagic manipulations of sorcerers are welcome in Quandrix, and many druids explore the patterns of nature in Quandrix as well. A few clerics, particularly those with the Knowledge or Nature domains, study in Quandrix as well.

text | Aside from traditional spellcasters, a few characters of other classes find homes in Quandrix. Some fighters, monks, rangers, and rogues study here, using Quandrix principles to train their minds.

description | Suggested Characteristics | With subjects ranging from the physical and tangible to the paradoxical and strange, the student body of Quandrix College includes an eclectic mix of individuals. The Quandrix Personality Traits table suggests a variety of traits you might adopt for your character.
text | Quandrix Personality Traits
text | d6｜Personality Trait
text | 1｜When I find a subject I'm interested in, I won't stop studying until I know everything about it. It keeps me up at night.
text | 2｜I hope this all makes sense to me one day. Until then, I'm going to keep faking it.
text | 3｜Equations and patterns come naturally to my mind. I wish friendship came just as easily.
text | 4｜I believe I'm always the smartest person in the room. And I'll prove it, even if no one asks me to.
text | 5｜If these classes have taught me anything, it's that reality is a lie, and nothing matters. So why bother?
text | 6｜Before I graduate, I want to achieve something mathematically impossible. I must leave a legacy!
description | Quandrix Trinkets | When you make your character, you may roll once on the Quandrix Trinkets table, instead of on the Trinkets table in the Player's Handbook, for your starting trinket.

title: Rakdos Cultist
contents: bullet | Skill Proficiencies: Acrobatics, Performance
bullet | Tool Proficiencies: One type of musical instrument
bullet | Languages: Choose either Abyssal or Giant

bullet | Equipment: A Rakdos insignia, a musical instrument (one of your choice), a costume, a hooded lantern made of wrought iron, a 10-foot length of chain with sharply spiked links, a tinderbox, 10 torches, a set of common clothes, a belt pouch containing 10 gp (a mix of Azorius and Boros 1-zino coins), and a bottle of sweet, red juice

description | A Flair for the Dramatic | Rakdos performance styles typically fuse standard circus-style acrobatics with fire, wrought-iron spikes and hooks, and monsters. You can roll a d8 or choose from the options in the Performance Options table to determine your preferred style of performance.
text | Performance Options
text | d8｜Type of Performer
text | 1｜Spikewheel acrobat
text | 2｜Lampooning satirist
text | 3｜Fire juggler
text | 4｜Marionette puppeteer
text | 5｜Pain artist
text | 6｜Noise musician
text | 7｜Nightmare clown
text | 8｜Master of ceremonies

description | Feature: Fearsome Reputation | People recognize you as a member of the Cult of Rakdos, and they're careful not to draw your anger or ridicule. You can get away with minor criminal offenses, such as refusing to pay for food at a restaurant or breaking down a door at a local shop, if no legal authorities witness the crime. Most people are too daunted by you to report your wrongdoing to the Azorius.
description | Rakdos Guild Spells | Prerequisite: Spellcasting or Pact Magic class feature

text | For you, the spells on the Rakdos Guild Spells table are added to the spell list of your spellcasting class. (If you are a multiclass character with multiple spell lists, these spells are added to all of them.)
text | Rakdos Guild Spells
text | Spell Level｜Spells
text | Cantrip｜fire bolt, vicious mockery
text | 1st｜burning hands, dissonant whispers, hellish rebuke
text | 2nd｜crown of madness, enthrall, flaming sphere
text | 3rd｜fear, haste
text | 4th｜confusion, wall of fire
text | 5th｜dominate person

text | Your magic often produces a flashy spectacle, wreathing you or your targets in a mixture of harmless flame and shadowy shapes. When you manipulate an opponent's mind, a flaming symbol of Rakdos might momentarily appear like a mask over the target's face.

description | Suggested Characteristics | Members of demonic cults aren't generally known as the kindest or most mentally stable individuals, so you're likely to have something in your nature that distinguishes you from the law-abiding citizens of Ravnica.
text | Personality Traits
text | d8｜Personality Trait
text | 1｜I revel in mayhem, the more destructive the better.
text | 2｜When violence breaks out, I lose myself in rage, and it's sometimes hard to stop.
text | 3｜Everything is funny to me, and the most hilarious and bloodiest things leave me cackling with sadistic glee.
text | 4｜I derive genuine pleasure from the pain of others.
text | 5｜I enjoy testing other people's patience.
text | 6｜I can't stand it when things are predictable, so I like to add a little chaos to every situation.
text | 7｜I throw my weight around to make sure I get my way.
text | 8｜I enjoy breaking delicate works of art. And fingers, which are sort of the same.
text | Ideals
text | d6｜Ideal
text | 1｜Guild. My guild is all that really matters. (Any)
text | 2｜Hedonism. Death comes for everyone, so take as much pleasure as you can from every moment of life. (Neutral)
text | 3｜Creativity. I strive to find more ways to express my art through pain—my own as well as others'. (Chaotic)
text | 4｜Freedom. No one tells me what to do. (Chaotic)
text | 5｜Equality. I want to see Ravnica remade, with no guilds and no hierarchies. (Chaotic)
text | 6｜Spectacle. People are inspired by the greatness they see in art. (Any)
text | Bonds
text | d6｜Bond
text | 1｜I have belonged to the same performance troupe for years, and these people mean everything to me.
text | 2｜A blood witch told me I have a special destiny to fulfill, and I'm trying to figure out what it is.
text | 3｜I'm secretly hoping that I can change the cult from the inside, using my influence to help rein in the wanton violence.
text | 4｜I own something that Rakdos once touched (it's seared black at the spot), and I cherish it.
text | 5｜I want to be better at my chosen form of performance than any other member of my troupe.
text | 6｜I am devoted to Rakdos and live to impress him.
text | Flaws
text | d6｜Flaw
text | 1｜My family is prominent in another guild. I enjoy my wild life, but I don't want to embarrass them.
text | 2｜I couldn't hide my emotions and opinions even if I wanted to.
text | 3｜I throw caution to the wind.
text | 4｜I resent the rich and powerful.
text | 5｜When I'm angry, I lash out in violence.
text | 6｜There's no such thing as too much pleasure.

description | Contacts | The Cult of Rakdos is anything but organized. Individuals frequently move from one performance troupe to another. Almost all members of the cult know former castmates now in different troupes, which allows for the possibility of a widespread network of contacts.
text | Roll twice on the Rakdos Contacts table (for an ally and a rival) and once on the Non-Rakdos Contacts table.
text | Rakdos Contacts
text | d8｜Contact
text | 1｜I was part of a two-person act until my former partner moved to a different troupe.
text | 2｜My sibling and I ran away from home and joined the Cult of Rakdos together. We're very close.
text | 3｜A childhood friend of mine is an attendant in Rix Maadi, the Rakdos guildhall.
text | 4｜My parents brought me into the guild and taught me my trade.
text | 5｜There's a lesser demon in the cult who thinks he owes me a favor, and who am I to argue?
text | 6｜The master of ceremonies in my troupe is well connected with other troupes.
text | 7｜I had a romance with a pain artist in another troupe.
text | 8｜Rakdos himself has witnessed me perform.
text | Non-Rakdos Contacts
text | d10｜Contact
text | 1｜I know an Azorius elocutor who has a very amusing dark side.
text | 2｜A Boros captain really wants to "redeem" me.
text | 3｜I think a member of my troupe is a Dimir agent.
text | 4｜I once convinced a Golgari medusa to participate in a show. We've been on good terms ever since.
text | 5｜I came from the Gruul and still have relatives there.
text | 6｜An Izzet technician provides pyrotechnics for my performances.
text | 7｜An Orzhov oligarch has taken an interest in my career, like a patron of the arts.
text | 8｜Roll an additional Rakdos contact; you can decide if the contact is an ally or a rival.
text | 9｜A Selesnya healer attends my performances regularly.
text | 10｜A Simic biomancer provides mutant monsters to add a taste of the bizarre to our shows.

description | How Do I Fit In? | The Cult of Rakdos encourages independent action on the part of its members. Its goal is fomenting chaos, and it firmly believes in putting its own house in disorder before carrying that mission into the larger city. So your role is to execute your vision of grand satire and disruptive performance art, as you aspire to outdo your guild mates and attract the attention of Rakdos himself.

text | You work as part of a troupe, with your artistic talents used in service to a ringmaster's vision. But your performance is your own, and no one expects you to follow a script. In fact, if you go through a performance without doing something you haven't done before, you're clearly not trying hard enough.

title: Rashemi Wanderer
contents: bullet | Ability Scores: Strength, Constitution, Charisma
bullet | Feat: Tough
bullet | Skill Proficiencies: Intimidation and Perception
bullet | Tool Proficiencies: Cartographer's Tools
bullet | Equipment: Choose A or B: (A) Cartographer's Tools, Backpack, Bedroll, Hooded Lantern, Oil (3 flasks), Rope, Tinderbox, Traveler's Clothes, Waterskin, 23 GP; or (B) 50 GP

title: Revelry Pirate (Sailor)
contents: bullet | Skill Proficiencies: Athletics, Perception
bullet | Tool Proficiencies: Navigator's tools, vehicles (water)

bullet | Equipment: A belaying pin (club), silk rope (50 feet), a lucky charm such as a rabbit foot or a small stone with a hole in the center (or you may roll for a random trinket on the Trinkets table in chapter 5), a set of common clothes, and a belt pouch containing 10 gp

description | Feature: Ship's Passage | When you need to, you can secure free passage on a sailing ship for yourself and your adventuring companions. You might sail on the ship you served on, or another ship you have good relations with (perhaps one captained by a former crewmate). Because you're calling in a favor, you can't be certain of a schedule or route that will meet your every need. Your Dungeon Master will determine how long it takes to get where you need to go. In return for your free passage, you and your companions are expected to assist the crew during the voyage.

description | Suggested Characteristics | Sailors can be a rough lot, but the responsibilities of life on a ship make them generally reliable as well. Life aboard a ship shapes their outlook and forms their most important attachments.
text | d8｜Personality Trait
text | 1｜My friends know they can rely on me, no matter what.
text | 2｜I work hard so that I can play hard when the work is done.
text | 3｜I enjoy sailing into new ports and making new friends over a flagon of ale.
text | 4｜I stretch the truth for the sake of a good story.
text | 5｜To me, a tavern brawl is a nice way to get to know a new city.
text | 6｜I never pass up a friendly wager.
text | 7｜My language is as foul as an otyugh nest.
text | 8｜I like a job well done, especially if I can convince someone else to do it.
text | d6｜Ideal
text | 1｜Respect. The thing that keeps a ship together is mutual respect between captain and crew. (Good)
text | 2｜Fairness. We all do the work, so we all share in the rewards. (Lawful)
text | 3｜Freedom. The sea is freedom—the freedom to go anywhere and do anything. (Chaotic)
text | 4｜Mastery. I'm a predator, and the other ships on the sea are my prey. (Evil)
text | 5｜People. I'm committed to my crewmates, not to ideals. (Neutral)
text | 6｜Aspiration. Someday, I'll own my own ship and chart my own destiny. (Any)
text | d6｜Bond
text | 1｜I'm loyal to my captain first, everything else second.
text | 2｜The ship is most important—crewmates and captains come and go.
text | 3｜I'll always remember my first ship.
text | 4｜In a harbor town, I have a paramour whose eyes nearly stole me from the sea.
text | 5｜I was cheated out of my fair share of the profits, and I want to get my due.
text | 6｜Ruthless pirates murdered my captain and crewmates, plundered our ship, and left me to die. Vengeance will be mine.
text | d6｜Flaw
text | 1｜I follow orders, even if I think they're wrong.
text | 2｜I'll say anything to avoid having to do extra work.
text | 3｜Once someone questions my courage, I never back down no matter how dangerous the situation.
text | 4｜Once I start drinking, it's hard for me to stop.
text | 5｜I can't help but pocket loose coins and other trinkets I come across.
text | 6｜My pride will probably lead to my destruction.

title: Rewarded
contents: bullet | Skill Proficiencies: Insight, Persuasion
bullet | Languages: One of your choice
bullet | Equipment: A bottle of black ink, an ink pen, five sheets of paper, a gaming set (matching your chosen proficiency), a signet ring, a set of fine clothes, and a pouch containing 18 gp
bullet | Tool Proficiencies: One gaming set of your choice (such as playing cards or three-dragon ante cards)

description | Feature: Fortune's Favor | Your unexpected good fortune is reflected by a minor boon. You gain the Lucky, Magic Initiate, or Skilled feat (your choice). Your choice of feat reflects the transformation that changed your life. An encounter with a genie who gave you three wishes might have resulted in magical powers represented by Magic Initiate. If you paid off all your family debts with a fortuitous round of three-dragon ante, you might be Lucky instead. Alternatively, you could use the Skilled feat to reflect whatever trial you endured to secure your new destiny and to model the knowledge and abilities imparted to you by whatever force transformed your life.

description | Suggested Characteristics | Your character's perspective on life has changed thanks to their new destiny. The Rewarded Personality Traits table suggests traits you might adopt for your character and cards from the Deck of Many Things that might have prompted this trait.
text | d6｜Personality Trait
text | 1｜A safe home is a foundation on which anything else can be built. (Key, Throne)
text | 2｜I was elevated to heights I could never otherwise attain, and I won't waste my fortune. (Star, Sun)
text | 3｜I try to be a source of inspiration and joy to others. Life is never as bad as you think! (Euryale, Jester)
text | 4｜Courage and boldness can carry the day when all else fails. (Comet, Knight)
text | 5｜My good fortune means I can lift others up as well. (Gem, Moon)
text | 6｜Having the right answers is the first step to solving any problem, no matter how dire. (Fates, Sage)

description | Building a Rewarded Character | Rewarded characters have varied histories, but they have one thing in common: they were down on their luck before their lives abruptly turned around. They might have given up all hope of a happier life, only to suddenly get a second chance. A rewarded character has often spent many years struggling to escape painful circumstances. Now, extricated from the (sometimes literal) prison that was their former life, they throw their cares to the wind and become adventurers.

text | If your character's life was changed by a Deck of Many Things, consider which card was responsible. Perhaps the Fates card undid a tragic mistake your character made in their youth. The Gem card could have wiped out debts incurred over a lifetime. Maybe the Sage card provided the advice needed to escape a hopeless situation, the Star card increased an ability score to its current value, or a Wish spell cast after drawing the Moon card transformed your character from a peddler to a fledgling sorcerer infused with magic and new knowledge and skills. If you're making a character at higher than 1st level, magic items they have could have been granted by the Key or Sun card.
description | Rewarded Trinkets | When you make your character, you can roll once on the Rewarded Trinkets table instead of on the Trinkets table in the Player's Handbook for your starting trinket.
text | d6｜Trinket
text | 1｜A perfumed silk scarf from an admirer
text | 2｜A crystal bead that glows like a candle in the dark
text | 3｜A letter of introduction and invitation from an influential person in a far-off city
text | 4｜A motto or symbol whose meaning eludes you, etched on a piece of your equipment
text | 5｜A crisp playing card that never seems to tear or soil, depicting the card that affected you
text | 6｜Half a medallion designed to be rejoined to its other half

title: Rival Intern
contents: bullet | Skill Proficiencies: History, Investigation
bullet | Tool Proficiencies: One type of artisan's tools
bullet | Languages: Any one of your choice
bullet | Equipment: One set of artisan's tools, a ledger from your previous employer containing a small piece of useful information, a set of fine clothes, and a belt pouch containing 10 gp

description | Feature: Inside Informant | You have connections to your previous employer or other groups you dealt with during your previous employment. You can communicate with your contacts, gaining information at the DM's discretion.

description | Suggested Characteristics | If you were happy with your previous internship, the parting of ways might have been amicable. If not, it might have involved armed guards removing you from the premises. If you were passed over at your previous position, it might have left you a blend of seething rage, practiced nonchalance, and keen knowledge of where the bodies are buried (perhaps literally).
text | d8｜Personality Trait
text | 1｜My previous employer didn't respect me, and now I'll do whatever I can to gain respect.
text | 2｜The job is important, but the relationships I forge with my coworkers are even more so.
text | 3｜The job is everything to me. Who needs relaxation, hobbies, and a social life?
text | 4｜I know I'm not the best and brightest, but if I put my best self forward, I can overcome anything.
text | 5｜My former boss was an idiot. So was my boss before that. And before that. I'm sure those were all coincidences.
text | 6｜This company is so much better than my previous one. It will always be the best until they stop paying me.
text | 7｜I know this dagger belongs to the company, but I'm sure they won't miss it. Or this flask. Or this armor.
text | 8｜It's only a matter of time before I'll be upper management. I just have to kiss up to my superiors and kick down those beneath me.
text | d6｜Ideal
text | 1｜Advancement. Money and power can be gained more easily within an organization. I plan to gain as much as possible. (Evil)
text | 2｜Structure. Life goes much more smoothly when you follow the rules and work within a system. (Lawful)
text | 3｜Uncertainty. The more chaos that swirls around me, the more opportunities I can find to profit. (Chaotic)
text | 4｜Justice. I can't stand people being treated unjustly. I do whatever it takes to stop injustice and those who flout the law. (Lawful)
text | 5｜Pleasure. What's the use of working hard and making money if you can't enjoy the finer things in life? (Any)
text | 6｜Power. Money is fine, but real power means never having to say you're sorry. (Evil)
text | d6｜Bond
text | 1｜I have a family member in need. I consider them in everything I do.
text | 2｜My peers keep me grounded.
text | 3｜My past mistakes cost someone else dearly. I have to rectify that.
text | 4｜A childhood mentor put me on my current path. If I succeed, I want to repay that mentor in some way.
text | 5｜I value an oath of loyalty I took to a group of friends over everything else in my life.
text | 6｜Although I don't get along well with people, my pet means the world to me.
text | d6｜Flaw
text | 1｜I know what's best. Trust me.
text | 2｜Flaw? I have no flaws. I'm perfect.
text | 3｜My loyalties are... fluid.
text | 4｜If anything goes wrong, it must be someone else's fault. Let me explain that in detail.
text | 5｜There's right and there's wrong, and there's no gray area in between.
text | 6｜Our superiors might not like what you're doing. I'm going to have to put that in my report.

title: Ruined
contents: bullet | Skill Proficiencies: Stealth, Survival
bullet | Languages: One of your choice

bullet | Equipment: A cracked hourglass, a set of rusty manacles, a half-empty bottle, a hunting trap, a gaming set (matching your chosen proficiency), a set of traveler's clothes, and a pouch containing 13 gp
bullet | Tool Proficiencies: One gaming set of your choice (such as playing cards or three-dragon ante cards)

description | Feature: Still Standing | You have weathered ruinous misfortune, and you possess hidden reserves others don't expect. You gain the Alert, Skilled, or Tough feat (your choice). Your choice of feat reflects how you've dealt with the terrible loss that changed your life forever. If you've kept your senses sharp for every opportunity and climbed your way out of misery by seizing the tiniest scrap of hope, choose Alert. If you've redoubled your efforts to reclaim what was once yours, choose Skilled. If you've stoically persevered through your misfortune, select Tough.

description | Suggested Characteristics | Rising above misfortune shapes one's perspective. The Ruined Personality Traits table suggests traits you might adopt for your character (and ruinous cards that might have prompted this trait).
text | d6｜Personality Trait
text | 1｜I've changed from my past, and I work to live up to my new path. (Balance, Throne)
text | 2｜Every moment is a gift I refuse to squander. (Euryale, Skull)
text | 3｜Now that I've overcome having nothing, I can survive anything. (Fool, Ruin, Talons)
text | 4｜I know enemies are set against me, and I always prepare for the worst. (Flames, Rogue)
text | 5｜I interpret every event as part of a larger pattern I just haven't worked out yet. (Puzzle, Star)
text | 6｜I must make up for so much time I've already lost. (Donjon, Void)

description | Building a Ruined Character | Ruined characters were on top of the world before misfortune struck. Many were wealthy. Others come from modest backgrounds, but they were surrounded by friends, family, and loved ones. They might have been famous, or simply never encountered serious hardship before. Some were born to privilege or rose to prominence through trickery or a false reputation. Now a Deck of Many Things—or another calamity—has knocked them down like a house of cards.

text | If your character's life was ruined by a Deck of Many Things, consider which card was responsible. Perhaps your character was imprisoned for years by the Donjon or Void card, and now everyone they knew has died. Maybe your character drew the Rogue card, and the person closest to them—a spouse, child, or parent—turned against them. A devil unleashed by the Flames card might have destroyed their life. The Ruin or Talons card might have stolen the character's material goods or saddled them with vast debt.
description | Ruined Trinkets | When you make your character, you can roll once on the Ruined Trinkets table instead of on the Trinkets table in the Player's Handbook.
text | d6｜Trinket
text | 1｜A rusted scrap of a once-beloved family heirloom
text | 2｜A land deed, but all the names and markings that once tied it to you have faded into obscurity
text | 3｜A bauble once imbued with powerful magic
text | 4｜A battered playing card with a hole pierced in it, its face depicting the card that affected you
text | 5｜A yellowed Humanoid tooth that whispers eerily when placed under a pillow
text | 6｜A keepsake from someone you were once close to but who is now your enemy

title: Rune Carver
contents: bullet | Skill Proficiencies: History, Perception
bullet | Tool Proficiencies: One set of artisan's tools
bullet | Languages: Giant
bullet | Equipment: A set of artisan's tools (one of your choice), a small knife, a whetstone, a set of common clothes, and a pouch containing 10 gp
description | Rune Styles | Each rune carver has a unique style and preferred medium. To determine how you make your runes, you can roll on the Rune Style table.
text | Rune Style
text | d6｜Style
text | 1｜You inscribe runes in wax or clay with a fine metal needle.
text | 2｜You whittle pieces of wood into small figurines you mark with runes.
text | 3｜You engrave runes onto glass beads and thread them onto necklaces and bracelets.
text | 4｜You stitch runes into the hems of clothing.
text | 5｜You carve runes on a set of animal bones you can throw in different formations.
text | 6｜You draw runes into candles, melting the wax to smooth over the engravings.
description | Building a Rune Carver Character | Scholarly pursuits, ancient mysteries, or a fateful encounter might inspire a character to pursue the secrets of a rune carver.
description | Feature: Rune Shaper | You gain the Rune Shaper feat.
description | Suggested Characteristics | The Rune Carver Personality Traits table suggests a variety of traits you might adopt for your character.
text | d6｜Personality Trait
text | 1｜Is it practical to learn an ancient language that is rarely spoken? No. But is it fun? Very.
text | 2｜I learned one of my ancestors was a lauded rune carver whose story was lost to time. I seek to rekindle that legacy.
text | 3｜The old, traditional markings of runecraft look so boring. Why not give my runes some flair?
text | 4｜In my studies of runes, I strive to understand how great civilizations of the past fell, so I can prevent it from happening to societies of the present.
text | 5｜Life may be a whirlwind of chaos, but whenever I create my runes, I feel at peace.
text | 6｜My brain struggles to process words written in ink, but the feeling of carved runes makes my mind sing.

title: Selesnya Initiate
contents: bullet | Skill Proficiencies: Nature, Persuasion
bullet | Tool Proficiencies: One type of artisan's tools or one musical instrument
bullet | Languages: Choose one of Elvish, Loxodon, or Sylvan
bullet | Equipment: A Selesnya insignia, a healer's kit, robes, a set of common clothes, and a belt pouch containing 5 gp (Azorius 1-zino coins)

description | Feature: Conclave's Shelter | As a member of the Selesnya Conclave, you can count on your guild mates to provide shelter and aid. You and your companions can find a place to hide or rest in any Selesnya enclave in the city, unless you have proven to be a danger to them. The members of the enclave will shield you from the law or anyone else searching for you, though they will not risk their lives in this effort.
text | In addition, as a guild member you can receive free healing and care at a Selesnya enclave, though you must provide any material components needed for spells.
description | Selesnya Guild Spells | Prerequisite: Spellcasting or Pact Magic class feature

text | For you, the spells on the Selesnya Guild Spells table are added to the spell list of your spellcasting class. (If you are a multiclass character with multiple spell lists, these spells are added to all of them.)
text | Selesnya Guild Spells
text | Spell Level｜Spells
text | Cantrip｜druidcraft, friends
text | 1st｜animal friendship, charm person
text | 2nd｜aid, animal messenger, calm emotions, warding bond
text | 3rd｜plant growth, speak with plants
text | 4th｜aura of life, conjure minor elementals
text | 5th｜awaken, commune with nature

text | Members of the Selesnya Conclave refer to their magic as "doruvati," a Sylvan word meaning "gift." When you use these gifts of Mat'Selesnya, graceful swirls of green and silver light dance in the air around you, and phantasmal green leaves might waft through the air. A sensation of gentle warmth and the smell of spring flowers or autumn leaves might accompany your spells.

description | Suggested Characteristics | Most members of the Selesnya Conclave are true believers—the tight-knit community allows little room for the cynical or disillusioned. They are spiritual, empathetic, and generally peaceful—unless roused to action. Their flaws and bonds alike grow naturally from their close ties to the community.
text | Personality Traits
text | d8｜Personality Trait
text | 1｜I never raise my voice or lose my temper.
text | 2｜I feel the pains and joys of everyone around me, friend or foe.
text | 3｜I would rather make a friend than thwart an enemy.
text | 4｜I'm always straining to peer into another reality that seems to be just beyond my senses.
text | 5｜I'm uneasy if I can't see plants growing or feel soil beneath my feet.
text | 6｜Seeing illness or injury in any creature saddens me.
text | 7｜I have much to be proud of, but I am still just one strand in the grand, interwoven tapestry of life.
text | 8｜Nature offers rich and abundant metaphors for understanding the complexities of life.
text | Ideals
text | d6｜Ideal
text | 1｜Guild. My guild is all that really matters. (Any)
text | 2｜Harmony. Nothing is more beautiful than voices and actions aligned in common purpose. (Good)
text | 3｜Order. Like a well-pruned tree, society thrives when everything is kept in good order. (Lawful)
text | 4｜Life. Preserving life and nature is always a worthwhile endeavor. (Good)
text | 5｜Humility. Ambition and pride are the roots of strife. (Good)
text | 6｜Evangelism. When all have joined the Selesnya Conclave, Ravnica will finally know peace. (Any)
text | Bonds
text | d6｜Bond
text | 1｜I would give my life in the defense of the small enclave where I first encountered Mat'Selesnya.
text | 2｜I love beasts and plants of all kinds, and am loath to harm them.
text | 3｜A healer nursed me to recovery from a mortal illness.
text | 4｜I'll sing the invitation of Mat'Selesnya with my dying breath.
text | 5｜I cherish a leaf from Vitu-Ghazi that changes color with the seasons, even though it is no longer attached to the tree.
text | 6｜Every member of the conclave is my kin, and I would fight for any one of them.
text | Flaws
text | d6｜Flaw
text | 1｜I'm terrified of getting into a fight where my side is outnumbered.
text | 2｜I assume that people mean well until they prove otherwise.
text | 3｜I enjoy comfort and quiet, and prefer to avoid extra effort.
text | 4｜I have a fierce temper that doesn't reflect the inner calm I seek.
text | 5｜I'm convinced that everyone else in the conclave has a deeper connection to the Worldsoul than I do.
text | 6｜I'm trying to atone for the life of crime I led before I joined the Selesnya, but I find it hard to give up my bad habits.

description | Contacts | The Selesnya Conclave is all about connections, so its members cultivate contacts throughout the guild. The guild also engages in energetic recruitment to draw converts from other guilds, and often these new guild members maintain friendships with former guild mates.
text | Roll twice on the Selesnya Contacts table (for an ally and a rival) and once on the Non-Selesnya Contacts table.
text | Selesnya Contacts
text | d8｜Contact
text | 1｜A wise centaur trainer believed in me even though I was a terrible student.
text | 2｜A good friend has risen to become a Ledev guardian.
text | 3｜I left my former guild and joined the Selesnya along with a close friend.
text | 4｜The dryad at the head of my enclave has taken an interest in my activities.
text | 5｜A sibling is an instructor at the guild's training grounds.
text | 6｜One of my parents is a votary, tasked with protecting the temple gardens at the Vitu-Ghazi guildhall.
text | 7｜I had a romance with a well-known Selesnya healer.
text | 8｜Trostani, the head of the guild and the voice of Mat'Selesnya, once welcomed me into her presence.
text | Non-Selesnya Contacts
text | d10｜Contact
text | 1｜I left the Azorius, and a former colleague still resents me for that act.
text | 2｜A good friend, eager for action, left the Selesnya and joined the Boros.
text | 3｜I had a relationship with a guild mate who turned out to be a Dimir agent.
text | 4｜I know a disgruntled Golgari assassin who is ripe for recruitment.
text | 5｜I'm friendly with a Gruul centaur who almost joined us a few years back.
text | 6｜I once had a heated public argument with an Izzet chemister, and neither of us is allowed back into that restaurant.
text | 7｜I paid off my debt to the Orzhov Syndicate, but my good friend was not so lucky and remains indebted to that guild.
text | 8｜At a time of terrible grief in my life, a Rakdos performer made a mockery of my pain, leaving me with mixed feelings of sadness and humor.
text | 9｜Roll an additional Selesnya contact; you can decide if the contact is an ally or a rival.
text | 10｜I have a sibling in the Simic Combine, and we argue every time we see each other.

description | How Do I Fit In? | Although the guild teaches the importance of subjugating the individual will to the good of the conclave, it also celebrates the diversity of individuals, in the same sense that a field that produces different crops is healthier than one that yields a single crop. That principle applies to your skills as an adventurer. As long as your efforts are directed toward advancing the goals of the guild rather than your private agenda, you're allowed to put your talents to work in your unique way.

text | That said, you must never lose sight of the fact that you are part of a larger community. That includes the whole guild, of course, but your ties to community start with your vernadi (enclave) and its voda (dryad leader). The dryads want to know what you're doing and what purpose it serves, and they act to curtail your actions—or even expel you from the guild—if they determine that you aren't serving Selesnya's best interests.
