title: Shipwright
contents: bullet | Skill Proficiencies: History, Perception
bullet | Tool Proficiencies: Carpenter's tools, Vehicles (water)
bullet | Equipment: A set of well-loved carpenter's tools, a blank book, 1 ounce of ink, an ink pen, a set of traveler's clothes, and a leather pouch with 10 gp

description | Feature: I'll Patch It! | Provided you have carpenter's tools and wood, you can perform repairs on a water vehicle. When you use this ability, you restore a number of hit points to the hull of a water vehicle equal to 5 × your proficiency modifier. A vehicle cannot be patched by you in this way again until after it has been pulled ashore and fully repaired.
description | Life at Sea | Your life at sea and in port has shaped you; you can roll on the following table to determine its impact or choose an element that best fits your character.
text | d6｜Sea's Influence
text | 1｜Grand Designs. You are working on plans and schematics for a new, very fast ship. You must examine as many different kinds of vessels as possible to help ensure the success of your design.
text | 2｜Solid and Sound. You patched up a war galley and prevented it from sinking. The local navy regards you as a friend.

text | 3｜Favored. You insisted on thicker planking for a merchant vessel's hull, which saved it from sinking when it smashed against a reef. You have a standing invitation to visit the merchant's distant mansion.
text | 4｜Master of Armaments. You specialized in designing and mounting defenses for the navy. You easily recognize and determine the quality of such items.
text | 5｜Low Places. You have contacts in the smuggling outfits along the coast; you occasionally repair the criminals' ships in exchange for coin and favors.

text | 6｜Mysteries of the Deep. You experienced an encounter with a possibly divine being while sailing alone. Work with your DM to determine the secret about the deep waters of the sea that this entity revealed to you.

description | Suggested Characteristics | Shipwrights are resourceful carpenters and designers. They often have a dedicated spot at the local tavern, since shipwrights are invaluable to coastal communities. Some travel with naval fleets and might serve as officers if their temperament suits it. Shipwrights have an affinity for working with their hands and often perform feats of carpentry that others might deem miraculous.
text | Shipwright Personality Traits
text | d8｜Personality Trait
text | 1｜I love talking and being heard more than I like to listen.
text | 2｜I'm extremely fond of puzzles.
text | 3｜I thrive under pressure.
text | 4｜I love sketching and designing objects, especially boats.
text | 5｜I'm not afraid of hard work—in fact, I prefer it.
text | 6｜A pipe, an ale, and the smell of the sea: paradise.
text | 7｜I have an endless supply of cautionary tales related to the sea.
text | 8｜I don't mind getting my hands dirty.
text | Shipwright Ideals
text | d6｜Ideal
text | 1｜Crew. If everyone on deck pitches in, we'll never sink. (Good)
text | 2｜Careful Lines. A ship must be balanced according to the laws of the universe. (Lawful)
text | 3｜Invention. Make what you need out of whatever is at hand. (Chaotic)
text | 4｜Perfection. To measure a being and find it lacking is the greatest disappointment. (Evil)
text | 5｜Reflection. Muddied water always clears in time. (Any)
text | 6｜Hope. The horizon at sea holds the greatest promise. (Any)
text | Shipwright Bonds
text | d6｜Bond
text | 1｜I must visit all the oceans of the world and behold the ships that sail there.
text | 2｜Much of the treasure I claim will be used to enrich my community.
text | 3｜I must find a kind of wood rumored to possess magical qualities.
text | 4｜I repair broken things to redeem what's broken in myself.
text | 5｜I will craft a boat capable of sailing through the most dangerous of storms.
text | 6｜A kraken destroyed my masterpiece; its teeth shall adorn my hearth.
text | Shipwright Flaws
text | d6｜Flaw
text | 1｜I don't know when to throw something away. You never know when it might be useful again.
text | 2｜I get frustrated to the point of distraction by shoddy craftsmanship.
text | 3｜Though I am an excellent crafter, my work tends to look as though it belongs on a ship.
text | 4｜I am so obsessed with sketching my ideas for elaborate inventions that I sometimes forget little thing like eating and sleeping.
text | 5｜I'm judgmental of those who are not skilled with tools of some kind.
text | 6｜I sometimes take things that don't belong to me, especially if they are very well made.

title: Silverquill Student
contents: bullet | Skill Proficiencies: Intimidation, Persuasion
bullet | Languages: Two of your choice
bullet | Equipment: A bottle of black ink, an ink pen, a book of poetry, a school uniform, and a pouch containing 15 gp
description | Feature: Silverquill Initiate | You gain the Strixhaven Initiate feat and must choose Silverquill within it.

text | In addition, if you have the Spellcasting or Pact Magic feature, the spells on the Silverquill Spells table are added to the spell list of your spellcasting class. (If you are a multiclass character with multiple spell lists, these spells are added to all of them.)
text | Silverquill Spells
text | Spell Level｜Spells
text | 1st｜Dissonant Whispers, Silvery Barbs
text | 2nd｜Calm Emotions, Darkness
text | 3rd｜Beacon of Hope, Daylight
text | 4th｜Compulsion, Confusion
text | 5th｜Dominate Person, Rary's Telepathic Bond

text | Consider customizing how your spells look when you cast them. Your Silverquill spells might be accompanied by visual effects resembling splotches of ink or radiating ripples of golden light. Any auditory effects of your spells often sound like amplified echoes of your own voice speaking the spells' verbal components—even amid the crash of lightning or a fiery eruption.

description | Building a Silverquill Character | Many bards find a home in Silverquill, putting the power of their voices to use with Silverquill magic. Wizards (especially those who study the Schools of Illusion and Enchantment) are common in Silverquill, as are warlocks. Clerics with the Divine Domains of Light and Trickery also fit in well among the mages of Silverquill.
text | A number of both paladins and rogues attend Silverquill College as well, highlighting the diversity of the student body.

description | Suggested Characteristics | With the college's intense standards looming over them, Silverquill students range from cocky and cutthroat to overwhelmed perfectionists. The Silverquill Personality Traits table suggests a variety of traits you might adopt for your character.
text | Silverquill Personality Traits
text | d6｜Personality Trait
text | 1｜I'll say whatever I need to in order to maintain my high social status.
text | 2｜I prefer saying the blunt truth over a pretty lie, and I don't particularly care whose feelings I hurt.
text | 3｜I believe that uplifting my peers is the best way to succeed.
text | 4｜I've mastered the art of using humor as a defense, and I always have a charming joke ready.
text | 5｜I always wait before speaking, analyzing the situation for whichever angle is most advantageous to my goals.
text | 6｜No one knows about the all-nighters I've pulled to keep my magic looking effortless, and I'm going to keep it that way.

description | Silverquill Trinkets | When you make your character, you may roll once on the Silverquill Trinkets table, instead of on the Trinkets table in the Player's Handbook, for your starting trinket.

title: Simic Scientist
contents: bullet | Skill Proficiencies: Arcana, Medicine
bullet | Languages: Two of your choice

bullet | Equipment: A Simic insignia, a set of commoner's clothes, a book of research notes, an ink pen, a bottle of squid ink, a flask of oil (made from blubber), a vial of acid (derived from digestive juices), a vial of fish scales, a vial of seaweed, a vial of jellyfish stingers, a glass bottle of unidentified slime, and a belt pouch containing 10 gp (Azorius 1-zino coins)

description | Clades and Projects | As a Simic researcher, you are part of a clade—a diverse group of individuals combining disparate talents in pursuit of a common goal—or a researcher on a specialized, short-term project focused on addressing an immediate need. You can roll a d6 or choose from the options in the Research Options table to determine your area of research.
text | Research Options
text | d6｜Clade/Project
text | 1｜Hull Clade, focused on protection and durability
text | 2｜Fin Clade, focused on movement
text | 3｜Gyre Clade, focused on cyclical patterns and metamagic
text | 4｜Guardian Project, focused on creating guard monsters and super soldiers
text | 5｜Crypsis Project, focused on intelligence and counterintelligence
text | 6｜Independent research in a new area

description | Feature: Researcher | When you attempt to learn or recall a magical or scientific fact, if you don't know that information, you know where and from whom you can obtain it. Usually, this information comes from a Simic laboratory, or sometimes from an Izzet facility, a library, a university, or an independent scholar or other learned person or creature. Knowing where the information can be found doesn't automatically enable you to learn it; you might need to offer bribes, favors, or other incentives to induce people to reveal their secrets.

text | Your DM might rule that the knowledge you seek is secreted away in an inaccessible place, or that it simply can't be found. Unearthing the deepest secrets of the multiverse can require an adventure or even a whole campaign.
description | Simic Guild Spells | Prerequisite: Spellcasting or Pact Magic class feature

text | For you, the spells on the Simic Guild Spells table are added to the spell list of your spellcasting class. (If you are a multiclass character with multiple spell lists, these spells are added to all of them.)
text | Simic Guild Spells
text | Spell Level｜Spells
text | Cantrip｜acid splash, druidcraft
text | 1st｜detect poison and disease, expeditious retreat, jump
text | 2nd｜alter self, enhance ability, enlarge/reduce
text | 3rd｜gaseous form, water breathing, wind wall
text | 4th｜freedom of movement, polymorph
text | 5th｜creation

text | When your magic causes physical alterations in yourself or others, the result often displays the characteristics of fish, amphibians, or other water-dwelling creatures. Blue-green eddies of magical energy sometimes accompany your spellcasting, forming spirals that reflect the mathematical perfection of nature.

description | Suggested Characteristics | The bizarre science of the Simic Combine attracts a certain type of personality and encompasses a set of beliefs about the nature of life. Simic members' bonds and flaws derive from their scientific research—including their creation of new life forms, which they can become very attached to.
text | Personality Traits
text | d8｜Personality Trait
text | 1｜I can't wait to see what I become next!
text | 2｜I am convinced that everything inclines toward constant improvement.
text | 3｜I'm eager to explain every detail of my most intricate experiments and theories to anyone who shows the least bit of interest.
text | 4｜I assume that everyone needs even the most basic concepts explained to them.
text | 5｜I describe everything that happens as if it were going into my research notes (and it often is).
text | 6｜I am insatiably curious about the seemingly infinite forms and adaptations of life.
text | 7｜I can't resist prying into anything forbidden, since it must be terribly interesting.
text | 8｜I employ a highly technical vocabulary to avoid imprecision and ambiguity in my communication.
text | Ideals
text | d6｜Ideal
text | 1｜Guild. My guild is all that really matters. (Any)
text | 2｜Change. All life is meant to progress toward perfection, and our work is to hurry it along—no matter what must be upended along the way. (Chaotic)
text | 3｜Knowledge. Understanding the world is more important than what you do with your knowledge. (Neutral)
text | 4｜Greater Good. I want to reshape the world into higher forms of life so that all can enjoy evolution. (Good)
text | 5｜Logic. It's foolish to let emotions and principles interfere with the conclusions of logic. (Lawful)
text | 6｜Superiority. My vast intellect and strength are directed toward increasing my sway over others. (Evil)
text | Bonds
text | d6｜Bond
text | 1｜I helped create a krasis that I love like a pet and would carry with me everywhere... except it's the size of a building, and it might eat me.
text | 2｜In my laboratory, I discovered something that I think could eliminate half the life on Ravnica.
text | 3｜The other researchers in my clade are my family—a big, eccentric family including members and parts of many species.
text | 4｜The laboratory where I did my research contains everything that is precious to me.
text | 5｜I will get revenge on the shortsighted fool who killed my precious krasis creation.
text | 6｜Everything I do is an attempt to impress someone I love.
text | Flaws
text | d6｜Flaw
text | 1｜I have a rather embarrassing mutation that I do everything I can to keep hidden.
text | 2｜I'm more interested in taking notes on monstrous anatomy than in fighting monsters.
text | 3｜Every social situation I'm in seems to lead to my asking rude personal questions.
text | 4｜I'm supremely confident in my ability to adapt to any situation and handle any danger.
text | 5｜I'll take any risk to earn recognition for my scientific brilliance.
text | 6｜I have a tendency to take shortcuts in my research and any other tasks I have to complete.

description | Contacts | The fluid nature of clades, whose rosters span different laboratories and change as researchers discover new interests, creates abundant connections among the Simic. The guild members live in watery sinkholes called zonots, and their isolation shelters them from much contact with outsiders. Nonetheless, a fair number of Simic members are former members of other guilds.
text | Roll twice on the Simic Contacts table (for an ally and a rival) and once on the Non-Simic Contacts table.
text | Simic Contacts
text | d8｜Contact
text | 1｜My research builds on my parents' work and takes it in interesting new directions.
text | 2｜If a serious problem confounds me, I can count on my mentor to provide clarity of thought.
text | 3｜A former laboratory colleague went on to work on the Guardian Project.
text | 4｜A former colleague has ventured into fields of research that are possibly immoral and almost certainly illegal.
text | 5｜A former lover is now the supervisor of a prominent clade.
text | 6｜My sibling has become an almost unrecognizable mutant.
text | 7｜An old friend has retreated into a secluded life as an ascetic deepsage, devoted to contemplating philosophical principles.
text | 8｜My former clade supervisor is now engaged in field research studying some of the largest beasts and monsters on Ravnica.
text | Non-Simic Contacts
text | d10｜Contact
text | 1｜My older sibling is upset that I didn't follow them into the Azorius.
text | 2｜A Boros sergeant is always asking questions about my work, but I suspect they're genuinely curious.
text | 3｜A friend in my clade thinks I don't know they're a Dimir agent.
text | 4｜I helped a Golgari spore druid with the fertilization and growth of their fungus field.
text | 5｜I can't fathom what could have made my childhood friend run off and join the Gruul.
text | 6｜I love comparing notes with my friend in the Izzet, though our fields of research are very different.
text | 7｜I borrowed a lot of money from an Orzhov syndic to help finance my research.
text | 8｜A Rakdos ringmaster has taken an interest in my research which, come to think of it, might make a nice sideshow act.
text | 9｜I left the Selesnya—and a lover—behind when I joined the Simic.
text | 10｜Roll an additional Simic contact; you can decide if the contact is an ally or a rival.

description | How Do I Fit In? | As a Simic adventurer, your mission likely aligns with the Adaptationist philosophy; the disagreements and tensions among the guilds will soon erupt into open conflict, and your guild needs your help to ensure that the Simic survive. That help might come in the form of defending against Golgari incursions into Simic zonots or shielding Simic research from Azorius intrusion. It could also involve more subtle, diplomatic work to maintain balance among the guilds, or subterfuge aimed at undermining another guild's grab for power.

text | Self-improvement is also an important part of your mission. Anything you can do to make yourself more capable—whether learning a new spell or adopting a new hybridizing mutation—gives the Simic a stronger weapon in its arsenal. The combine must change to survive, and that means individual members of the guild must grow and adapt as well.

title: Smuggler
contents: bullet | Skill Proficiencies: Athletics, Deception
bullet | Tool Proficiencies: Vehicles (water)
bullet | Equipment: A fancy leather vest or a pair of leather boots, a set of common clothes, and a leather pouch with 15 gp

description | Feature: Down Low | You are acquainted with a network of smugglers who are willing to help you out of tight situations. While in a particular town, city, or other similarly sized community (DM's discretion), you and your companions can stay for free in safe houses. Safe houses provide a poor lifestyle. While staying at a safe house, you can choose to keep your presence (and that of your companions) a secret.

description | Claim to Fame | Every smuggler has that one tale that sets them apart from common criminals. By wits, sailing skill, or a silver tongue, you lived to tell the story—and you tell it often. You can roll on the following table to determine your claim or choose one that best fits your character.
text | d6｜Accomplishment

text | 1｜Spirit of the Whale. You smuggled stolen dwarven spirits in the body of a dead whale being pulled behind a fishing boat. When you delivered the goods, the corpse suddenly exploded, sending whale meat and whiskey bottles for half a mile.
text | 2｜Cart and Sword. You drove a cart filled with stolen art through the middle of a battlefield while singing sea shanties to confuse the combatants.

text | 3｜The Recruit. You enlisted in another nation's navy for the purpose of smuggling stolen jewels to a distant port. You attained a minor rank before disappearing from the navy and making your way here.

text | 4｜River of Shadows. Your riverboat accidentally slipped through the veil into the Shadowfell for several hours. While you were there, you sold some stolen dragonborn artifacts before returning to this plane and paddling home.

text | 5｜Gold-Hearted. You agreed to transport a family escaping a war. The baby began to cry at a checkpoint, and you gave the guards all your gold to let you pass. The family never found out about this gesture.

text | 6｜Playing Both Sides. You once smuggled crates of crossbow bolts and bundles of arrows, each destined for an opposing side in a regional war, at the same time. The buyers arrived within moments of each other but did not discover your trickery.

description | Suggested Characteristics | In general, smugglers value survival, and then profit, above other things. One could be a part of a larger organization, or might run a small smuggling vessel of their own. Smugglers live the lies they have told, and they have a natural ability to recall all the falsehoods and half-truths they have ever spouted.
text | Smuggler Personality Traits
text | d8｜Personality Trait
text | 1｜I love being on the water but hate fishing.
text | 2｜I think of everything in terms of monetary value.
text | 3｜I never stop smiling.
text | 4｜Nothing rattles me; I have a lie for every occasion.
text | 5｜I love gold but won't cheat a friend.
text | 6｜I enjoy doing things others believe to be impossible.
text | 7｜I become wistful when I see the sun rise over the ocean.
text | 8｜I am no common criminal; I am a mastermind.
text | Smuggler Ideals
text | d6｜Ideal
text | 1｜Wealth Heaps of coins in a secure vault is all I dream of. (Any)
text | 2｜Smuggler's Code I uphold the unwritten rules of the smugglers, who do not cheat one another or directly harm innocents. (Lawful)
text | 3｜All for a Coin I'll do nearly anything if it means I turn a profit. (Evil)
text | 4｜Peace and Prosperity I smuggle only to achieve a greater goal that benefits my community. (Good)
text | 5｜People For all my many lies, I place a high value on friendship. (Any)
text | 6｜Daring I am most happy when risking everything. (Any)
text | Smuggler Bonds
text | d6｜Bond
text | 1｜My vessel was stolen from me, and I burn with the desire to recover it.
text | 2｜I intend to become the leader of the network of smugglers that I belong to.
text | 3｜I owe a debt that cannot be repaid in gold.
text | 4｜After one last job, I will retire from the business.
text | 5｜I was tricked by a fellow smuggler who stole something precious from me. I will find that thief.
text | 6｜I give most of my profits to a charitable cause, and I don't like to brag about it.
text | Smuggler Flaws
text | d6｜Flaw
text | 1｜Lying is reflexive, and I sometimes engage in it without realizing.
text | 2｜I tend to assess my relationships in terms of profit and loss.
text | 3｜I believe everyone has a price and am cynical toward those who present themselves as virtuous.
text | 4｜I struggle to trust the words of others.
text | 5｜Few people know the real me.
text | 6｜Though I act charming, I feel nothing for others and don't know what friendship is.

bullet | Feat: Savage Attacker
bullet | Skill Proficiencies: Athletics, Intimidation
bullet | Tool Proficiency: Choose one kind of Gaming Set
bullet | Equipment: Choose A or B: (A) Spear, Shortbow, 20 Arrows, Gaming Set (same as above), Healer's Kit, Quiver, Traveler's Clothes, 14 GP; or (B) 50 GP

contents: bullet | Ability Scores: Constitution, Intelligence, Charisma
bullet | Feat: Spellfire Spark
bullet | Skill Proficiencies: Arcana and Perception
bullet | Tool Proficiencies: Choose one kind of Gaming Set
bullet | Equipment: Choose A or B: (A) Gaming Set (same as above), Arcane Focus (Crystal or Wand), 2 Pouches, Traveler's Clothes, 36 GP; or (B) 50 GP

title: Urban Bounty Hunter
contents: bullet | Skill Proficiencies: Choose two from among Deception, Insight, Persuasion, and Stealth
bullet | Tool Proficiencies: Choose two from among one type of gaming set, one musical instrument, and thieves' tools
bullet | Equipment: A set of clothes appropriate to your duties and a pouch containing 20 gp

description | Feature: Ear to the Ground | You are in frequent contact with people in the segment of society that your chosen quarries move through. These people might be associated with the criminal underworld, the rough-and-tumble folk of the streets, or members of high society. This connection comes in the form of a contact in any city you visit, a person who provides information about the people and places of the local area.

description | Suggested Characteristics | Use the tables for the criminal background in the Player's Handbook as the basis for your bounty hunter's traits and motivations, modifying the entries when appropriate to suit your identity as a bounty hunter.

text | For instance, your bond might involve other bounty hunters or the organizations or individuals that employ you. Your ideal could be associated with your determination always to catch your quarry or your desire to maintain your reputation for being dependable.

title: Urchin
contents: bullet | Skill Proficiencies: Sleight of Hand, Stealth
bullet | Tool Proficiencies: Disguise kit, Thieves' tools
bullet | Equipment: A small knife, a map of the city you grew up in, a pet mouse, a token to remember your parents by, a set of common clothes, and a belt pouch containing 10 gp

description | Feature: City Secrets | You know the secret patterns and flow to cities and can find passages through the urban sprawl that others would miss. When you are not in combat, you (and companions you lead) can travel between any two locations in the city twice as fast as your speed would normally allow.

description | Suggested Characteristics | Urchins are shaped by lives of desperate poverty, for good and for ill. They tend to be driven either by a commitment to the people with whom they shared life on the street or by a burning desire to find a better life—and maybe get some payback on all the rich people who treated them badly.
text | d8｜Personality Trait
text | 1｜I hide scraps of food and trinkets away in my pockets.
text | 2｜I ask a lot of questions.
text | 3｜I like to squeeze into small places where no one else can get to me.
text | 4｜I sleep with my back to a wall or tree, with everything I own wrapped in a bundle in my arms.
text | 5｜I eat like a pig and have bad manners.
text | 6｜I think anyone who's nice to me is hiding evil intent.
text | 7｜I don't like to bathe.
text | 8｜I bluntly say what others are hinting at or hiding.
text | d6｜Ideal
text | 1｜Respect. All people, rich or poor, deserve respect. (Good)
text | 2｜Community. We have to take care of each other, because no one else is going to do it. (Lawful)
text | 3｜Change. The low are lifted up, and the high and mighty are brought down. Change is the nature of things. (Chaotic)
text | 4｜Retribution. The rich need to be shown what life and death are like in the gutters. (Evil)
text | 5｜People. I help the people who help me—that's what keeps us alive. (Neutral)
text | 6｜Aspiration. I'm going to prove that I'm worthy of a better life. (Any)
text | d6｜Bond
text | 1｜My town or city is my home, and I'll fight to defend it.
text | 2｜I sponsor an orphanage to keep others from enduring what I was forced to endure.
text | 3｜I owe my survival to another urchin who taught me to live on the streets.
text | 4｜I owe a debt I can never repay to the person who took pity on me.
text | 5｜I escaped my life of poverty by robbing an important person, and I'm wanted for it.
text | 6｜No one else should have to endure the hardships I've been through.
text | d6｜Flaw
text | 1｜If I'm outnumbered, I will run away from a fight.
text | 2｜Gold seems like a lot of money to me, and I'll do just about anything for more of it.
text | 3｜I will never fully trust anyone other than myself.
text | 4｜I'd rather kill someone in their sleep than fight fair.
text | 5｜It's not stealing if I need it more than someone else.
text | 6｜People who can't take care of themselves get what they deserve.

title: Uthgardt Tribe Member
contents: bullet | Skill Proficiencies: Athletics, Survival
bullet | Languages: Any one of your choice
bullet | Tool Proficiencies: One type of musical instrument or artisan's tools
bullet | Equipment: A hunting trap, a totemic token or set of tattoos marking your loyalty to Uthgar and your tribal totem, a set of traveler's clothes, and a pouch containing 10 gp

description | Feature: Uthgardt Heritage | You have an excellent knowledge of not only your tribe's territory, but also the terrain and natural resources of the rest of the North. You are familiar enough with any wilderness area that you can find twice as much food and water as you normally would when you forage there.

text | Additionally, you can call upon the hospitality of your people, and those allied with your tribe, often including members of the druid circles, tribes of nomadic elves, the Harpers, and the priesthoods devoted to the gods of the First Circle.
section | Suggested Characteristics

text | Use the tables for the outlander background in the Player's Handbook as the basis for your traits and motivations, modifying the entries when appropriate to suit your identity as a member of an Uthgardt tribe.

text | Even if you have left your tribe behind (at least for now), you hold to the traditions of your people. You will never cut down a still-living tree, and you may not countenance such an act being done in your presence. The Uthgardt ancestral mounds - great hills where the totem spirits were defeated by Uthgar and where the heroes of the tribes are interred - are sacred to you.

text | Your bond is undoubtedly associated with your tribe or some aspect of Uthgardt philosophy or culture (perhaps even Uthgar himself). Your ideal is a personal choice that probably hews closely to the ethos of your people and certainly doesn't contradict or compromise what being an Uthgardt stands for.

title: Vampire Devotee
contents: bullet | Ability Scores: Strength, Constitution, Charisma
bullet | Feat: Vampire's Plaything
bullet | Skill Proficiencies: Persuasion and Stealth
bullet | Tool Proficiency: Cook's Utensils
bullet | Equipment: Choose A or B: (A) Cook's Utensils, Fine Clothes, 2 Glass Bottles, Healer's Kit, Perfume, Lamp, Oil (3 flasks), Waterskin, 19 GP; or (B) 50 GP

title: Vampire Survivor
contents: bullet | Ability Scores: Dexterity, Constitution, Wisdom
bullet | Feat: Vampire Hunter
bullet | Skill Proficiencies: Insight and Religion
bullet | Tool Proficiency: Woodcarver's Tools

bullet | Equipment: Choose A or B: (A) Woodcarver's Tools, Crowbar, Hooded Lantern, Holy Symbol (reliquary), Holy Water, Mirror, Oil (3 flasks), Tinderbox, Traveler's Clothes, Waterskin, 4 GP; or (B) 50 GP

title: Variant City Watch (Investigator)
contents: bullet | Skill Proficiencies: Insight, Investigation
bullet | Languages: Any two of your choice
bullet | Equipment: A uniform in the style of your unit and indicative of your rank, a horn with which to summon help, a set of manacles, and a pouch containing 10 gp

description | Feature: Watcher's Eye | Your experience in enforcing the law, and dealing with lawbreakers, gives you a feel for local laws and criminals. You can easily find the local outpost of the watch or a similar organization, and just as easily pick out the dens of criminal activity in a community, although you're more likely to be welcome in the former locations rather than the latter.

description | Suggested Characteristics | Use the tables for the soldier background in the Player's Handbook as the basis for your traits and motivations, modifying the entries when appropriate to suit your identity as a member of the city watch.

text | Your bond is likely associated with your fellow watch members or the watch organization itself and almost certainly concerns your community. Your ideal probably involves the fostering of peace and safety. An investigator is likely to have an ideal connected to achieving justice by successfully solving crimes.

title: Variant Criminal (Spy)
contents: bullet | Skill Proficiencies: Deception, Stealth
bullet | Tool Proficiencies: One type of gaming set, thieves' tools
bullet | Equipment: A crowbar, a set of dark common clothes including a hood, and a belt pouch containing 15 gp

description | Feature: Spy Contact | You have a reliable and trustworthy contact who acts as your liaison to a network of other spies. You know how to get messages to and from your contact, even over great distances; specifically, you know the local messengers, corrupt caravan masters, and seedy sailors who can deliver messages for you.

description | Specialty | There are many kinds of criminals, and within a thieves' guild or similar criminal organization, individual members have particular specialties. Even criminals who operate outside of such organizations have strong preferences for certain kinds of crimes over others. Choose the role you played in your criminal life, or roll on the table below.
text | d8｜Specialty
text | 1｜Blackmailer
text | 2｜Burglar
text | 3｜Enforcer
text | 4｜Fence
text | 5｜Highway robber
text | 6｜Hired killer
text | 7｜Pickpocket
text | 8｜Smuggler

description | Suggested Characteristics | Criminals might seem like villains on the surface, and many of them are villainous to the core. But some have an abundance of endearing, if not redeeming, characteristics. There might be honor among thieves, but criminals rarely show any respect for law or authority.
text | d8｜Personality Trait
text | 1｜I always have a plan for when things go wrong.
text | 2｜I am always calm, no matter what the situation. I never raise my voice or let my emotions control me.
text | 3｜The first thing I do in a new place is note the locations of everything valuable—or where such things could be hidden.
text | 4｜I would rather make a new friend than a new enemy.
text | 5｜I am incredibly slow to trust. Those who seem the fairest often have the most to hide.
text | 6｜I don't pay attention to the risks in a situation. Never tell me the odds.
text | 7｜The best way to get me to do something is to tell me I can't do it.
text | 8｜I blow up at the slightest insult.
text | d6｜Ideal
text | 1｜Honor. I don't steal from others in the trade. (Lawful)
text | 2｜Freedom. Chains are meant to be broken, as are those who would forge them. (Chaotic)
text | 3｜Charity. I steal from the wealthy so that I can help people in need. (Good)
text | 4｜Greed. I will do whatever it takes to become wealthy. (Evil)
text | 5｜People. I'm loyal to my friends, not to any ideals, and everyone else can take a trip down the Styx for all I care. (Neutral)
text | 6｜Redemption. There's a spark of good in everyone. (Good)
text | d6｜Bond
text | 1｜I'm trying to pay off an old debt I owe to a generous benefactor.
text | 2｜My ill-gotten gains go to support my family.
text | 3｜Something important was taken from me, and I aim to steal it back.
text | 4｜I will become the greatest thief that ever lived.
text | 5｜I'm guilty of a terrible crime. I hope I can redeem myself for it.
text | 6｜Someone I loved died because of a mistake I made. That will never happen again.
text | d6｜Flaw
text | 1｜When I see something valuable, I can't think about anything but how to steal it.
text | 2｜When faced with a choice between money and my friends, I usually choose the money.
text | 3｜If there's a plan, I'll forget it. If I don't forget it, I'll ignore it.
text | 4｜I have a 'tell' that reveals when I'm lying.
text | 5｜I turn tail and run when things look bad.
text | 6｜An innocent person is in prison for a crime that I committed. I'm okay with that.

title: Variant Entertainer (Gladiator)
contents: bullet | Skill Proficiencies: Acrobatics, Performance
bullet | Tool Proficiencies: Disguise kit, one type of musical instrument

bullet | Equipment: An inexpensive but unusual weapon, such as a trident or net (one of your choice), the favor of an admirer (love letter, lock of hair, or trinket), costume clothes, and a belt pouch containing 15 gp

description | Feature: By Popular Demand | You can always find a place to perform in any place that features combat for entertainment—perhaps a gladiatorial arena or secret pit fighting club. At such a place, you receive free lodging and food of a modest or comfortable standard (depending on the quality of the establishment), as long as you perform each night. In addition, your performance makes you something of a local figure. When strangers recognize you in a town where you have performed, they typically take a liking to you.

description | Specialty | A good entertainer is versatile, spicing up every performance with a variety of different routines. Choose one to three routines or roll on the table below to define your expertise as an entertainer.
text | d10｜Routines
text | 1｜Actor
text | 2｜Dancer
text | 3｜Fire-eater
text | 4｜Jester
text | 5｜Juggler
text | 6｜Instrumentalist
text | 7｜Poet
text | 8｜Singer
text | 9｜Storyteller
text | 10｜Tumbler

description | Suggested Characteristics | Successful entertainers have to be able to capture and hold an audience's attention, so they tend to have flamboyant or forceful personalities. They're inclined toward the romantic and often cling to high-minded ideals about the practice of art and the appreciation of beauty.
text | d8｜Personality Trait
text | 1｜I know a story relevant to almost every situation.
text | 2｜Whenever I come to a new place, I collect local rumors and spread gossip.
text | 3｜I'm a hopeless romantic, always searching for that "special someone".
text | 4｜Nobody stays angry at me or around me for long, since I can defuse any amount of tension.
text | 5｜I love a good insult, even one directed at me.
text | 6｜I get bitter if I'm not the center of attention.
text | 7｜I'll settle for nothing less than perfection.
text | 8｜I change my mood or my mind as quickly as I change key in a song.
text | d6｜Ideal
text | 1｜Beauty. When I perform, I make the world better than it was. (Good)
text | 2｜Tradition. The stories, legends, and songs of the past must never be forgotten, for they teach us who we are. (Lawful)
text | 3｜Creativity. The world is in need of new ideas and bold action. (Chaotic)
text | 4｜Greed. I'm only in it for the money and fame. (Evil)
text | 5｜People. I like seeing the smiles on people's faces when I perform. That's all that matters. (Neutral)
text | 6｜Honesty. Art should reflect the soul; it should come from within and reveal who we really are. (Any)
text | d6｜Bond
text | 1｜My instrument is my most treasured possession, and it reminds me of someone I love.
text | 2｜Someone stole my precious instrument, and someday I'll get it back.
text | 3｜I want to be famous, whatever it takes.
text | 4｜I idolize a hero of the old tales and measure my deeds against that person's.
text | 5｜I will do anything to prove myself superior to my hated rival.
text | 6｜I would do anything for the other members of my old troupe.
text | d6｜Flaw
text | 1｜I'll do anything to win fame and renown.
text | 2｜I'm a sucker for a pretty face.
text | 3｜A scandal prevents me from ever going home again. That kind of trouble seems to follow me around.
text | 4｜I once satirized a noble who still wants my head. It was a mistake that I will likely repeat.
text | 5｜I have trouble keeping my true feelings hidden. My sharp tongue lands me in trouble.
text | 6｜Despite my best efforts, I am unreliable to my friends.

title: Variant Guild Artisan (Guild Merchant)
contents: bullet | Skill Proficiencies: Insight, Persuasion
bullet | Tool Proficiencies: One type of artisan's tools, or navigator's tools, or an additional language
bullet | Languages: One of your choice
bullet | Equipment: A set of artisan's tools (one of your choice) or a mule and cart, a letter of introduction from your guild, a set of traveler's clothes, and a belt pouch containing 15 gp

description | Feature: Guild Membership | As an established and respected member of a guild, you can rely on certain benefits that membership provides. Your fellow guild members will provide you with lodging and food if necessary, and pay for your funeral if needed. In some cities and towns, a guildhall offers a central place to meet other members of your profession, which can be a good place to meet potential patrons, allies, or hirelings.

text | Guilds often wield tremendous political power. If you are accused of a crime, your guild will support you if a good case can be made for your innocence or the crime is justifiable. You can also gain access to powerful political figures through the guild, if you are a member in good standing. Such connections might require the donation of money or magic items to the guild's coffers.
text | You must pay dues of 5 gp per month to the guild. If you miss payments, you must make up back dues to remain in the guild's good graces.

description | Specialty | Guilds are generally found in cities large enough to support several artisans practicing the same trade. However, your guild might instead be a loose network of artisans who each work in a different village within a larger realm. Work with your DM to determine the nature of your guild. You can select your guild business from the Guild Business table or roll randomly.
text | d20｜Guild Business
text | 1｜Alchemists and apothecaries
text | 2｜Armorers, locksmiths, and finesmiths
text | 3｜Brewers, distillers, and vintners
text | 4｜Calligraphers, scribes, and scriveners
text | 5｜Carpenters, roofers, and plasterers
text | 6｜Cartographers, surveyors, and chart-makers
text | 7｜Cobblers and shoemakers
text | 8｜Cooks and bakers
text | 9｜Glassblowers and glaziers
text | 10｜Jewelers and gemcutters
text | 11｜Leatherworkers, skinners, and tanners
text | 12｜Masons and stonecutters
text | 13｜Painters, limners, and sign-makers
text | 14｜Potters and tile-makers
text | 15｜Shipwrights and sail-makers
text | 16｜Smiths and metal-forgers
text | 17｜Tinkers, pewterers, and casters
text | 18｜Wagon-makers and wheelwrights
text | 19｜Weavers and dyers
text | 20｜Woodcarvers, coopers, and bowyers

description | Suggested Characteristics | Guild artisans are among the most ordinary people in the world—until they set down their tools and take up an adventuring career. They understand the value of hard work and the importance of community, but they're vulnerable to sins of greed and covetousness.
text | d8｜Personality Trait
text | 1｜I believe that anything worth doing is worth doing right. I can't help it—I'm a perfectionist.
text | 2｜I'm a snob who looks down on those who can't appreciate fine art.
text | 3｜I always want to know how things work and what makes people tick.
text | 4｜I'm full of witty aphorisms and have a proverb for every occasion.
text | 5｜I'm rude to people who lack my commitment to hard work and fair play.
text | 6｜I like to talk at length about my profession.
text | 7｜I don't part with my money easily and will haggle tirelessly to get the best deal possible.
text | 8｜I'm well known for my work, and I want to make sure everyone appreciates it. I'm always taken aback when people haven't heard of me.
text | d6｜Ideal
text | 1｜Community. It is the duty of all civilized people to strengthen the bonds of community and the security of civilization. (Lawful)
text | 2｜Generosity. My talents were given to me so that I could use them to benefit the world. (Good)
text | 3｜Freedom. Everyone should be free to pursue his or her own livelihood. (Chaotic)
text | 4｜Greed. I'm only in it for the money. (Evil)
text | 5｜People. I'm committed to the people I care about, not to ideals. (Neutral)
text | 6｜Aspiration. I work hard to be the best there is at my craft. (Any)
text | d6｜Bond
text | 1｜The workshop where I learned my trade is the most important place in the world to me.
text | 2｜I created a great work for someone, and then found them unworthy to receive it. I'm still looking for someone worthy.
text | 3｜I owe my guild a great debt for forging me into the person I am today.
text | 4｜I pursue wealth to secure someone's love.
text | 5｜One day I will return to my guild and prove that I am the greatest artisan of them all.
text | 6｜I will get revenge on the evil forces that destroyed my place of business and ruined my livelihood.
text | d6｜Flaw
text | 1｜I'll do anything to get my hands on something rare or priceless.
text | 2｜I'm quick to assume that someone is trying to cheat me.
text | 3｜No one must ever learn that I once stole money from guild coffers.
text | 4｜I'm never satisfied with what I have—I always want more.
text | 5｜I would kill to acquire a noble title.
text | 6｜I'm horribly jealous of anyone who can outshine my handiwork. Everywhere I go, I'm surrounded by rivals.

title: Variant Noble (Knight)
contents: bullet | Skill Proficiencies: History, Persuasion
bullet | Tool Proficiencies: One type of gaming set
bullet | Languages: One of your choice
bullet | Equipment: A set of fine clothes, a signet ring, a scroll of pedigree, and a purse containing 25 gp

description | Variant Noble (Knight) | A knighthood is among the lowest noble titles in most societies, but it can be a path to higher status. If you wish to be a knight, choose the Retainers feature instead of the Position of Privilege feature.

text | As an emblem of chivalry and the ideals of courtly love, you might include among your equipment a banner or other token from a noble lord or lady to whom you have given your heart-in a chaste sort of devotion.

description | Feature: Retainers | You have the service of three retainers loyal to your family. These retainers can be attendants or messengers, and one might be a majordomo. One of your retainers is a noble who serves as your squire, aiding you in exchange for training on his or her own path to knighthood (This person could be your bond.). Your two remaining retainers might include a groom to care for your horse and a servant who polishes your armor (and even helps you put it on).

text | Your retainers can perform mundane tasks for you, but they do not fight for you, will not follow you into obviously dangerous areas (such as dungeons), and will leave if they are frequently endangered or abused.

description | Suggested Characteristics | Nobles are born and raised to a very different lifestyle than most people ever experience, and their personalities reflect that upbringing. A noble title comes with a plethora of bonds—responsibilities to family, to other nobles (including the sovereign), to the people entrusted to the family's care, or even to the title itself. But this responsibility is often a good way to undermine a noble.
text | d8｜Personality Trait
text | 1｜My eloquent flattery makes everyone I talk to feel like the most wonderful and important person in the world.
text | 2｜The common folk love me for my kindness and generosity.
text | 3｜No one could doubt by looking at my regal bearing that I am a cut above the unwashed masses.
text | 4｜I take great pains to always look my best and follow the latest fashions.
text | 5｜I don't like to get my hands dirty, and I won't be caught dead in unsuitable accommodations.
text | 6｜Despite my noble birth, I do not place myself above other folk. We all have the same blood.
text | 7｜My favor, once lost, is lost forever.
text | 8｜If you do me an injury, I will crush you, ruin your name, and salt your fields.
text | d6｜Ideal
text | 1｜Respect. Respect is due to me because of my position, but all people regardless of station deserve to be treated with dignity. (Good)
text | 2｜Responsibility. It is my duty to respect the authority of those above me, just as those below me must respect mine. (Lawful)
text | 3｜Independence. I must prove that I can handle myself without coddling from my family. (Chaotic)
text | 4｜Power. If I can attain more power, no one will tell me what to do. (Evil)
text | 5｜Family. Blood runs thicker than water. (Any)
text | 6｜Noble Obligation. It is my duty to protect and care for the people beneath me. (Good)
text | d6｜Bond
text | 1｜I will face any challenge to win the approval of my family.
text | 2｜My house's alliance with another noble family must be sustained at all costs.
text | 3｜Nothing is more important than the other members of my family.
text | 4｜I am in love with the heir of a family that my family despises.
text | 5｜My loyalty to my sovereign is unwavering.
text | 6｜The common folk must see me as a hero of the people.
text | d6｜Flaw
text | 1｜I secretly believe that everyone is beneath me.
text | 2｜I hide a truly scandalous secret that could ruin my family forever.
text | 3｜I too often hear veiled insults and threats in every word addressed to me, and I'm quick to anger.
text | 4｜I have an insatiable desire for carnal pleasures.
text | 5｜In fact, the world does revolve around me.
text | 6｜By my words and actions, I often bring shame to my family.

title: Variant Sailor (Pirate)
contents: bullet | Skill Proficiencies: Athletics, Perception
bullet | Tool Proficiencies: Navigator's tools, vehicles (water)

bullet | Equipment: A belaying pin (club), silk rope (50 feet), a lucky charm such as a rabbit foot or a small stone with a hole in the center (or you may roll for a random trinket on the Trinkets table in chapter 5), a set of common clothes, and a belt pouch containing 10 gp

description | Feature: Bad Reputation | No matter where you go, people are afraid of you due to your reputation. When you are in a civilized settlement, you can get away with minor criminal offenses, such as refusing to pay for food at a tavern or breaking down doors at a local shop, since most people will not report your activity to the authorities.

description | Suggested Characteristics | Sailors can be a rough lot, but the responsibilities of life on a ship make them generally reliable as well. Life aboard a ship shapes their outlook and forms their most important attachments.
text | d8｜Personality Trait
text | 1｜My friends know they can rely on me, no matter what.
text | 2｜I work hard so that I can play hard when the work is done.
text | 3｜I enjoy sailing into new ports and making new friends over a flagon of ale.
text | 4｜I stretch the truth for the sake of a good story.
text | 5｜To me, a tavern brawl is a nice way to get to know a new city.
text | 6｜I never pass up a friendly wager.
text | 7｜My language is as foul as an otyugh nest.
text | 8｜I like a job well done, especially if I can convince someone else to do it.
text | d6｜Ideal
text | 1｜Respect. The thing that keeps a ship together is mutual respect between captain and crew. (Good)
text | 2｜Fairness. We all do the work, so we all share in the rewards. (Lawful)
text | 3｜Freedom. The sea is freedom—the freedom to go anywhere and do anything. (Chaotic)
text | 4｜Mastery. I'm a predator, and the other ships on the sea are my prey. (Evil)
text | 5｜People. I'm committed to my crewmates, not to ideals. (Neutral)
text | 6｜Aspiration. Someday, I'll own my own ship and chart my own destiny. (Any)
text | d6｜Bond
text | 1｜I'm loyal to my captain first, everything else second.
text | 2｜The ship is most important—crewmates and captains come and go.
text | 3｜I'll always remember my first ship.
text | 4｜In a harbor town, I have a paramour whose eyes nearly stole me from the sea.
text | 5｜I was cheated out of my fair share of the profits, and I want to get my due.
text | 6｜Ruthless pirates murdered my captain and crewmates, plundered our ship, and left me to die. Vengeance will be mine.
text | d6｜Flaw
text | 1｜I follow orders, even if I think they're wrong.
text | 2｜I'll say anything to avoid having to do extra work.
text | 3｜Once someone questions my courage, I never back down no matter how dangerous the situation.
text | 4｜Once I start drinking, it's hard for me to stop.
text | 5｜I can't help but pocket loose coins and other trinkets I come across.
text | 6｜My pride will probably lead to my destruction.

title: Volstrucker Agent
contents: bullet | Skill Proficiencies: Deception, Stealth
bullet | Tool Proficiencies: Poisoner's kit
bullet | Languages: One of your choice
bullet | Equipment: A set of common clothes, a black cloak with a hood, a poisoner's kit, and a pouch containing 10 gp

description | Feature: Shadow Network | You have access to the Volstrucker shadow network, which allows you to communicate with other members of the order over long distances. If you write a letter in a special arcane ink, address it to a member of the Volstrucker, and cast it into a fire, the letter will burn to cinders and materialize whole again on the person of the agent you addressed it to.
text | The ink used to send a letter across the shadow network is the same as that used by a wizard to scribe spells in a spellbook. Writing a letter in this ink costs 10 gp per page.

description | Suggested Characteristics | Agents of the Volstrucker are groomed to follow orders without question and to kill without mercy. The trauma that brings one into the order can fester even more strongly against the darkness of a Volstrucker agent's assignments. Officially, no one ever leaves the order—but those desperate enough do whatever it takes to gain some measure of freedom.
text | d6｜Personality Trait
text | 1｜I prefer to keep my thoughts to myself.
text | 2｜I indulge vice in excess to quiet my conscience.
text | 3｜I've left emotion behind me. I'm now perfectly placid.
text | 4｜Some event from the past keeps worming its way into my mind, making me restless.
text | 5｜I always keep my word—except when I'm commanded to break it.
text | 6｜I laugh off insults and never take them personally.
text | d6｜Ideal
text | 1｜Order. The will of the crown is absolute. (Law)
text | 2｜True Loyalty. The Cerberus Assembly is greater than any power, even the crown. (Law)
text | 3｜Death. The penalty for disloyalty is death. (Evil)
text | 4｜Determination. I cannot fail. Not ever. (Neutral)
text | 5｜Fear. People should not respect power. They should fear it. (Evil)
text | 6｜Escape. The Volstrucker are pure evil! I can't atone for what I've done for them, but I can escape with my life. (Any)
text | d4｜Bond
text | 1｜The job is all that matters. I will see it through.
text | 2｜My orders are important, but my comrades are worth more than anything. I would die for them.
text | 3｜Everything I've done, I've done to protect someone close to me.
text | 4｜If the empire falls, all of civilization falls with it. I will hold back chaos and barbarism at any cost.
text | d4｜Flaw
text | 1｜I drink to dull the pain in the back of my head.
text | 2｜I go a bit mad when I see blood.
text | 3｜I can hear the voices of everyone I've killed. I see their faces. I can't be free of these ghosts.
text | 4｜Fear is a powerful motivator. I will do whatever it takes to prevent those who know what I am from seeing me fail, and from those I care about from knowing what I am.

title: Waterdhavian Noble
contents: bullet | Skill Proficiencies: History, Persuasion
bullet | Languages: Any one of your choice
bullet | Tool Proficiencies: One type of gaming set or musical instrument
bullet | Equipment: A set of fine clothes, a signet ring or brooch, a scroll of pedigree, a skin of fine zzar or wine, and a purse containing 20 gp

description | Feature: Kept in Style | While you are in Waterdeep or elsewhere in the North, your house sees to your everyday needs. Your name and signet are sufficient to cover most of your expenses; the inns, taverns, and festhalls you frequent are glad to record your debt and send an accounting to your family's estate in Waterdeep to settle what you owe.

text | This advantage enables you to live a comfortable lifestyle without having to pay 2 gp a day for it, or reduces the cost of a wealthy or aristocratic lifestyle by that amount. You may not maintain a less affluent lifestyle and use the difference as income—the benefit is a line of credit, not an actual monetary reward.
section | Suggested Characteristics

text | Use the tables for the noble background in the Player's Handbook as the basis for your traits and motivations, modifying the entries when appropriate to suit your identity as a member of a Waterdhavian family.

text | Like other nobles, you were born and raised in a different world from the one that most folk know - one that grants you privilege but also calls you to fulfill a duty befitting your station. Your bond might be associated with your family alone, or it could be concerned with another noble house that sides with or opposes your own. Your ideal depends to some extent on how you view your role in the family, and how you intend to conduct yourself in the world at large as a representative of your house.

bullet | Skill Proficiencies: Insight, Stealth
bullet | Tool Proficiency: Thieves' Tools

title: Wildspacer
contents: bullet | Skill Proficiencies: Athletics, Survival
bullet | Tool Proficiencies: Navigator's tools, vehicles (space)
bullet | Equipment: A belaying pin (club), a set of traveler's clothes, a grappling hook, 50 feet of hempen rope, and a pouch containing 10 gp

description | Close Encounter | You had a harrowing encounter with one of Wildspace's many terrors. You escaped with your life, but the encounter left you with a scar or two, or perhaps a recurring nightmare. Roll on the Close Encounter table to determine which creature nearly got the best of you. Creatures marked with an asterisk appear in Boo's Astral Menagerie; the others are described in the Monster Manual.

description | Feature: Wildspace Adaptation | You gain the Tough feat from the Player's Handbook. In addition, you learned how to adapt to zero gravity. Being weightless doesn't give you disadvantage on any of your melee attack rolls (see "Weightlessness" in chapter 2).

title: Witchlight Hand
contents: bullet | Skill Proficiencies: Performance, Sleight of Hand
bullet | Tool Proficiencies: Disguise kit or one type of musical Instrument
bullet | Languages: One of your choice

bullet | Equipment: A disguise kit or a musical instrument of your choice, a deck of cards, a carnival uniform or costume, one trinket (determined by rolling on the Feywild Trinkets), and a pouch containing 8 gp

description | Feature: Carnival Fixture | The Witchlight Carnival provides you with free, modest lodging and food. In addition, you may wander about the carnival and partake of its many wonders at no cost to you, provided you don't disrupt its shows or cause any other trouble.

description | Carnival Companion | Over the years, you have earned the friendship of another carnival fixture. Roll a d8 and consult the Carnival Companion table to determine whom or what you've befriended, or you can choose an option that you like. Work with your DM to flesh out this friendship. This companion hangs around you while you're in the carnival, but it won't voluntarily leave the carnival.

text | The DM can use the Witchlight hand stat block in chapter 1 to represent hands, performers, and animal trainers who serve as carnival companions. Statistics for the other companions appear in the Monster Manual.
text | Carnival Companion
text | d8｜Companion
text | 1｜Old, cantankerous Witchlight hand
text | 2｜Young, impressionable Witchlight hand
text | 3｜Performer (such as an acrobat, a clown, or a musician)
text | 4｜Retired performer
text | 5｜Seasoned animal trainer
text | 6｜Old blink dog
text | 7｜Cheery sprite
text | 8｜Harmless, magical wisp of light (no stat block required) that has a flying speed of 30 feet, can hover, and sheds bright light in a 5-foot radius and dim light for an additional 5 feet
section | Character Traits

text | As the players choose backgrounds for their characters, they can use the following tables to help determine their characters' personality traits, ideals, bonds, and flaws. Players can use these tables instead of the ones that appear in the Player's Handbook, or they can mix and match them. If a rolled result doesn't make sense for a character, the player can roll again or choose a more appropriate entry on the table.
text | These tables, while optional, are well suited to Feywild-themed adventures and are ideal for any character who has the feylost or Witchlight hand background.
text | Personality Traits
text | d8｜Trait
text | 1｜I'm haunted by fey laughter that only I can hear, though I know it's just my mind playing tricks on me.
text | 2｜Like a nomad, I can't settle down in one place for very long.
text | 3｜Good music makes me weep like a baby.
text | 4｜Wherever I go, I try to bring a little of the warmth and tranquility of home with me.
text | 5｜I have never lost my childlike sense of wonder.
text | 6｜When I have a new idea, I get wildly excited about it until I come up with another, better idea.
text | 7｜I live by my own set of weird and wonderful rules.
text | 8｜I can't bring myself to trust most adults.
text | Ideals
text | d8｜Ideal
text | 1｜Friendship. I never leave a friend behind. (Good)
text | 2｜Empathy. No creature should be made to suffer. (Good)
text | 3｜Wanderlust. I prefer to take the less traveled path. (Chaotic)
text | 4｜Changeability. Change is good, which is why I live by an ever-changing set of rules. (Chaotic)
text | 5｜Honor. A deal is a deal, and I would never break one. (Lawful)
text | 6｜Rule of Three. Everything in the multiverse happens in threes. I see the "rule of three" everywhere. (Lawful)
text | 7｜Obsession. I won't let go of a grudge. (Evil)
text | 8｜Greed. I will do whatever it takes to get what I want, regardless of the harm it might cause. (Evil)
text | Bonds
text | d8｜Bond
text | 1｜I would never break my word.
text | 2｜I find magic in all its forms to be compelling. The more magical a place, the more I am drawn to it.
text | 3｜I do what I can to protect the natural world.
text | 4｜A trusted friend is the most important thing in the multiverse to me.
text | 5｜I can't bring myself to harm a Fey creature, either because I consider myself one or because I fear the repercussions.
text | 6｜The Witchlight Carnival feels like home to me.
text | 7｜I'm drawn to the Feywild and long to return there, if only for a short while.
text | 8｜I feel indebted to Mister Witch and Mister Light for giving me a home and a purpose.
text | Flaws
text | d8｜Flaw
text | 1｜I easily lose track of time. My poor sense of time means I'm always late.
text | 2｜I think the whole multiverse is out to get me.
text | 3｜I'm always operating under a tight timeline, and I'm obsessed with keeping everything on schedule.
text | 4｜I'm a kleptomaniac who covets shiny, sparkling treasure.
text | 5｜I'm forgetful. Sometimes I can't remember even the simplest things.
text | 6｜I never give away anything for free and always expect something in return.
text | 7｜I have many vices and tend to indulge them.
text | 8｜I'm always changing my mind—well, almost always.

title: Witherbloom Student
contents: bullet | Skill Proficiencies: Nature, Survival
bullet | Tool Proficiencies: Herbalism kit
bullet | Languages: One of your choice
bullet | Equipment: A bottle of black ink, an ink pen, a book about plant identification, an iron pot, an herbalism kit, a school uniform, and a pouch containing 15 gp
description | Feature: Witherbloom Initiate | You gain the Strixhaven Initiate feat and must choose Witherbloom within it.

text | In addition, if you have the Spellcasting or Pact Magic feature, the spells on the Witherbloom Spells table are added to the spell list of your spellcasting class. (If you are a multiclass character with multiple spell lists, these spells are added to all of them.)
text | Witherbloom Spells
text | Spell Level｜Spells
text | 1st｜Cure Wounds, Inflict Wounds
text | 2nd｜Lesser Restoration, Wither and Bloom
text | 3rd｜Revivify, Vampiric Touch
text | 4th｜Blight, Death Ward
text | 5th｜Antilife Shell, Greater Restoration

text | Consider customizing how your spells look when you cast them. Your Witherbloom spells might rely on material components or a spellcasting focus drawn from the swamp environment of Witherbloom, and your spells might take on an appearance suggesting those natural elements. Spectral shapes of swamp animals or plants might form amid your spell effects.

description | Building a Witherbloom Character | Druids and warlocks make up most of Witherbloom's student body. A few wizards (mostly those who study the School of Necromancy) and clerics (including those with the Divine Domains of Life or Nature) also find their home in Witherbloom.
text | A number of rangers and barbarians study at Witherbloom as well, and some rogues learn how to create and use poisons during their studies at this college.

description | Suggested Characteristics | Students of Witherbloom College are equally likely to be found picking herbs for a healing tincture or riding zombified swamp beasts through the bayou. The Witherbloom Personality Traits table suggests a variety of traits you might adopt for your character.
text | Witherbloom Personality Traits
text | d6｜Personality Trait
text | 1｜I love brewing up a new recipe, even if some might be repulsed by my choice of ingredients. Or the final product. Or both.
text | 2｜My fashion sense is like my garden: withered, black, and weird.
text | 3｜I'm going to befriend every single monster in this swamp if it's the last thing I do.
text | 4｜Everything in this world dies eventually. The question is, what will you do with the time you have left?
text | 5｜I know we just met, but when you die, may I have your bones? For research.
text | 6｜Don't interrupt me; I'm brooding.

description | Witherbloom Trinkets | When you make your character, you may roll once on the Witherbloom Trinkets table, instead of on the Trinkets table in the Player's Handbook, for your starting trinket.
